original: 'di ltar yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bzung ba bying ba dang / rgod pa dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs kyi brtson 'grus gang yin pa de la yang dag pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa'i lta bas yongs su bzung ba bying ba dang / rgod pa dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs kyi brtson 'grus gang yin pa de la yang dag pa'i rtsol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Right effort is the effort in the state of samadhi, which is free from laxity and excitement, and which is supported by right view.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba des sgom pas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu spang ba'i don du de'i gnyen po'i phyogs lam sgom par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba des sgom pas spong bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams rab tu spang ba'i don du de'i gnyen po'i phyogs lam sgom par byed do //
translated: By means of right effort, one cultivates the path that is the antidote to the afflictions that are to be abandoned by cultivation, in order to completely abandon them.

original: des na yang dag pa'i rtsol ba nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa sbyangs pa'i yan lag go ;
analyzed: des na yang dag pa'i rtsol ba nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa sbyangs pa'i yan lag go ;
translated: Thus, right effort is the factor of purification of the afflictive obstructions.

original: / yang dag pa'i dran pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyangs pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: / yang dag pa'i dran pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyangs pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right mindfulness is the factor of purification of the obstructions of the secondary afflictions.

original: des zhi gnas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mi brjed pas bying ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la go skabs mi 'byed pas so //
analyzed: des zhi gnas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mi brjed pas bying ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la go skabs mi 'byed pas so //
translated: Because it does not forget the signs of serenity and so forth, it does not allow laxity and so forth, which are secondary afflictions, to arise.

original: 'di ltar rgod pa dang / rgod par dogs pa'i sems yod @50a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgod pa dang / rgod par dogs pa'i sems yod @50a * //
translated: Thus, it is a mind that is free from excitement and the fear of excitement.

original: par gyur pa la yid 'byung ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa ni zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yin la /
analyzed: par gyur pa la yid 'byung ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa ni zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yin la /
translated: The sign of serenity is the attention to the things which cause one to turn away from the world.

original: sems bying ba dang bying bar dogs pa'i sems yod par gyur na rab tu dga' ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa de rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma'o //🔽zhi gnas 'ba' zhig gi lam la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: sems bying ba dang bying bar dogs pa'i sems yod par gyur na rab tu dga' ba'i dngos po yid la byed pa de rab tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma'o // zhi gnas 'ba' zhig gi lam la gnas pa'am /
translated: The sign of full attention is the attention to the things which cause one to be joyful when one's mind is depressed or in danger of depression.

original: zung du 'phel bar 'jug pa'i lam la bying ba dang / rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa'i rtsol ba med pa'i yid la byed pa la ni btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: zung du 'phel bar 'jug pa'i lam la bying ba dang / rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa'i rtsol ba med pa'i yid la byed pa la ni btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma'o //
translated: The sign of equanimity is the attention to the absence of effort when one is on the path of serenity alone, or when one is on the path of the union of serenity and insight, and is not troubled by the secondary defilement of torpor or excitement.

original: de ltar zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma ma brjed par bying ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la go skabs med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma ma brjed par bying ba la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la go skabs med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, by not forgetting the signs of serenity, full attention, and equanimity, one prevents the secondary defilements of torpor, etc. from disturbing one's attention.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni yon tan khyad par can gyi sgrib pa rnam par sbyangs pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni yon tan khyad par can gyi sgrib pa rnam par sbyangs pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right concentration is the member that is the purification of the obscurations to the special qualities.

original: des mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rdzogs par byed pas so //
analyzed: des mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rdzogs par byed pas so //
translated: Because it perfects the qualities such as the superknowledges.🔽Thus, right concentration is the antidote to the obscurations to the meditative development of the overlordship of the qualities such as the superknowledges, which have the nature of the qualities such as the superknowledges.

original: 'di ltar mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid can khyab bdag nyid kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i bdag nyid can nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de'i gnyen po yang dag pa'i🔽ting nge 'dzin yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid can khyab bdag nyid kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i bdag nyid can nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de'i gnyen po yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin te /
translated: It is the antidote to the obscurations to the meditative development of the overlordship of the qualities such as the superknowledges, which have the nature of the obscurations to the meditative development of the overlordship of the qualities such as the superknowledges.

original: bsam gtan ni yon tan khyad par can thams cad 'grub par byed pa'i rten yin pas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'grub pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni yon tan khyad par can thams cad 'grub par byed pa'i rten yin pas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'grub pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: Since meditative concentration is the basis for the accomplishment of all the special qualities, it is the antidote to the obscurations to the meditative development of the overlordship of the qualities such as the superknowledges, which are adverse to the accomplishment of the qualities such as the superknowledges.

original: de ltar ngo bo bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, the nature has been described.

original: grogs ni de rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so ;
analyzed: grogs ni de rnams dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so ;
translated: The associates are the mind and mental factors that are concomitant with those.

original: / sgom pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag bzhin no //
analyzed: / sgom pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag bzhin no //
translated: The cultivation is like the branches of enlightenment.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is thus:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba sgom pa dang rnam par dben pa la gnas pa la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba sgom pa dang rnam par dben pa la gnas pa la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The cultivation of right view, the cultivation of the basis of spiritual practice, and so on are taught in detail.

original: tshig 'di rnams kyi don ni ji ltar sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //🔽bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni yongs su gcod pa dang ; gzhan go bar byed pa dang / yid ches bar byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: tshig 'di rnams kyi don ni ji ltar sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o // bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni yongs su gcod pa dang ; gzhan go bar byed pa dang / yid ches bar byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: The meaning of these terms should be understood as previously explained.

original: yon tan khyad par can gyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'o //🔽lam gyi yan lag dang lhan cig tu gyur ba bstan zin to //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can gyi sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'o // lam gyi yan lag dang lhan cig tu gyur ba bstan zin to //
translated: The results of cultivation are: the elimination of the afflictive obstructions, the elimination of the obstructions to the knowable, the elimination of the obstructions to meditative equipoise, the elimination of the obstructions to the minor spiritual qualities, and the elimination of the obstructions to the special spiritual qualities.🔽The limbs of the path have been explained together with the path of cultivation.

original: @50b bsgom pa'i lam bstan zin to //
analyzed: @50b bsgom pa'i lam bstan zin to //
translated: The path of cultivation has been explained.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sar gdul bya'i bsam pa la ltos nas dngos gzhi dang rjes kyi sems bskyed pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can lam gyi rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis pas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sar gdul bya'i bsam pa la ltos nas dngos gzhi dang rjes kyi sems bskyed pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can lam gyi rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis pas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun cu rtsa gnyis rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: On the ground of Buddha, in dependence on the thought of the one to be subdued, the two kinds of generation of the thought of enlightenment, the essence of the path with its thirty-seven aspects, completely abandons the seventy-two kinds of addictions.

original: 'di kho na la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rab tu spangs pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin can sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di kho na la nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rab tu spangs pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin can sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od ces bya'o //
translated: This very ground is called “Universal Light” of the Buddha, because it has the nature of complete purity, since it completely abandons the obscurations of the addictions and the knowable.

original: gnas skabs de kho na zad pa'i ye shes dang mi skye ba'i ye shes zhes rnam par gzhag go //🔽de la kun 'byung ba ma lus pa rab tu spangs nas de'i gnas skabs kyi shes pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: gnas skabs de kho na zad pa'i ye shes dang mi skye ba'i ye shes zhes rnam par gzhag go // de la kun 'byung ba ma lus pa rab tu spangs nas de'i gnas skabs kyi shes pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: This very ground is established as the “knowledge of destruction” and the “knowledge of non-production.”🔽The knowledge of destruction is the knowledge of that ground, or🔽it is the knowledge which has the object of the cessation of the origin of suffering.

original: yang na kun 'byung gi 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la zad pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na kun 'byung gi 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la zad pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of non-production is the knowledge of the non-production of the suffering of that ground, or🔽it is the knowledge which has the object of the cessation of the origin of suffering.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su sdug bsngal thams cad mi skye ba'i chos nyid du gyur nas de'i gnas skabs kyi shes pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su sdug bsngal thams cad mi skye ba'i chos nyid du gyur nas de'i gnas skabs kyi shes pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: The future is the nature of all suffering not arising.🔽

original: sdug bsngal gyi mi skye ba la dmigs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la mi skye ba'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mi skye ba la dmigs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de la mi skye ba'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of non-arising is the knowledge of the future non-arising of all suffering, or the knowledge which has the non-arising of suffering for its object.

original: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gcig pa ni bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gcig pa ni bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The twenty-first generation of the thought of enlightenment is simultaneous with the path of a single passage.🔽The path of a single passage is the path of a Bodhisattva who has attained the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering. It is the path of a Bodhisattva who has realized the nature of enlightenment which is in the stage of the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering. It is the path of a Bodhisattva who has realized the nature of enlightenment which is in the stage of the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering. It is the path of a Bodhisattva who has realized the nature of enlightenment which is in the stage of the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering. It is the path of a Bodhisattva who has realized the nature of enlightenment which is in the stage of the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering.🔽It is simultaneous with the generation of the thought of enlightenment which is the nature of enlightenment in the stage of the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering.

original: de la bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam ni bla na med pa'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob na de'i sa pa rnams kyi byang chub kyi rang bzhin can gyi sems so sor mngon du byas pas tha mi dad pa'i bya ba byed pa gang yin pa🔽ste // de dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //🔽de yang chu bo'i rgyun lta bu ste /
analyzed: de la bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam ni bla na med pa'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob na de'i sa pa rnams kyi byang chub kyi rang bzhin can gyi sems so sor mngon du byas pas tha mi dad pa'i bya ba byed pa gang yin pa ste // de dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o // de yang chu bo'i rgyun lta bu ste /
translated: It is the path of a Bodhisattva who has realized the nature of enlightenment which is in the stage of the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering. It is the path of a Bodhisattva who has realized the nature of enlightenment which is in the stage of the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering. It is the path of a Bodhisattva who has realized the nature of enlightenment which is in the stage of the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering. It is the path of a Bodhisattva who has realized the nature of enlightenment which is in the stage of the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa yin pas so //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa yin pas so //
translated: It is the path of a Bodhisattva who has realized the nature of enlightenment which is in the stage of the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering. It is the path of a Bodhisattva who has realized the nature of enlightenment which is in the stage of the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering. It is the path of a Bodhisattva who has realized the nature of enlightenment which is in the stage of the acceptance of the fact that there is no origination of suffering.

original: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam ni sa mi g-yo ba nas brtsams nas yod kyi 'on kyang 'dir bla na med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam ni sa mi g-yo ba nas brtsams nas yod kyi 'on kyang 'dir bla na med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The path of single progress begins from the stage of Immovability, but here it is unsurpassed.

original: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa ni chos kyi sku dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa ni chos kyi sku dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The twenty-second generation of the Thought is that which is accompanied by the Dharma Body.

original: de yang sprin lta bu ste /
analyzed: de yang sprin lta bu ste /
translated: And that is like a cloud.

original: ji ltar sprin gyis snod kyi 'jig rten yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi byed pa la 'jug pa yin pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar sprin gyis snod kyi 'jig rten yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi byed pa la 'jug pa yin pas so //
translated: Just as a cloud fills the world of the vessel, so it is engaged in the activity of all sentient beings.

original: mi zad pa'i thabs la mkhas pa dang yang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa'i thabs la mkhas pa dang yang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: It is also accompanied by the skill in means of inexhaustibility.

original: de la stong pa dang / snying rje las byung ba'i bya ba la mkhas pa ni thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: de la stong pa dang / snying rje las byung ba'i bya ba la mkhas pa ni thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: Therein, the skill in the performance which arises from emptiness and compassion is the skill in means.

original: des dga' ldan la sogs pa'i gnas su bzhugs pa la sogs par yang dag par ston par byed pas so //
analyzed: des dga' ldan la sogs pa'i gnas su bzhugs pa la sogs par yang dag par ston par byed pas so //
translated: By that, he demonstrates the dwelling in the abode of Tushita, etc.

original: 'di ltar ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' ldan gyi gnas su @51a * //🔽gnas par ston par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' ldan gyi gnas su @51a * //🔽gnas par ston par byed la /
translated: Thus, why does the Lord demonstrate the dwelling in the abode of Tushita?

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su ma yin zhe na /
translated: not in the form and formless realms.

original: mi khom pa'i gnas nas 'dir byon pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mi khom pa'i gnas nas 'dir byon pa yin gyi /
translated: He came here from a place of leisure,🔽but he did not come for our sake.

original: kho bo cag gi don du byon pa ma yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid la rab tu ma gus pa spang bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi don du byon pa ma yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid la rab tu ma gus pa spang bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: This is to abandon extreme disrespect for the Lord.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan 'phrul dbang byed du gnas par ston par mi mdzad ce na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan 'phrul dbang byed du gnas par ston par mi mdzad ce na /
translated: Why does he not manifest in Paranirmita-vaśavartin Heaven?

original: skye ba khyad par can dor nas sems can rnams la rjes su brtse bas dga' ldan gyi gnas su gnas so snyam pa'i shin tu rab tu gus pa bskyed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: skye ba khyad par can dor nas sems can rnams la rjes su brtse bas dga' ldan gyi gnas su gnas so snyam pa'i shin tu rab tu gus pa bskyed pa'i don du'o //
translated: He is in Tuṣita Heaven, out of compassion for sentient beings, having abandoned his special birth there, in order to generate extreme respect, thinking, “He is like us.”

original: de bzhin du lhums su 'jug pa la sogs pa yang thabs la mkhas pa'i dgos par shes par bya'o //🔽rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes la mthar phyin pa'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lhums su 'jug pa la sogs pa yang thabs la mkhas pa'i dgos par shes par bya'o // rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes la mthar phyin pa'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: Similarly, the descent into the womb and so on should be understood as the purpose of skillful means.

original: gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas so //
analyzed: gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas so //
translated: The vajra like concentration and the knowledge of elimination and nonarising are called the path of conclusion, because they are free from all negative tendencies.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi nang nas dang po'i 'jig rten pa'i sems bskyed pa bzhi dor te /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyi nang nas dang po'i 'jig rten pa'i sems bskyed pa bzhi dor te /
translated: Thus, from among the twenty-two kinds of generation of the Thought, the first four, the mundane generation of the Thought, are rejected.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems bskyed pa dang po bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems bskyed pa dang po bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the first supramundane generation of the Thought,

original: rgyal ba'i sras po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The son of the Victor, having generated the Thought of the Great Vehicle, etc.”

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis sems bskyed pa dang po pa rnam pa lnga bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis sems bskyed pa dang po pa rnam pa lnga bstan te /
translated: This verse teaches the first generation of the Thought in five aspects:

original: dgos pa'i khyad par dang / rgyu'i khyad par dang / bsngo ba'i khyad par dang / gnas kyi khyad par dang / grangs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: dgos pa'i khyad par dang / rgyu'i khyad par dang / bsngo ba'i khyad par dang / gnas kyi khyad par dang / grangs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: the special purpose, the special cause, the special dedication, the special basis, and the special number.

original: de la 'gro ba rnams par grol bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa 'dis dgos pa'i khyad par bstan te /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba rnams par grol bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa 'dis dgos pa'i khyad par bstan te /
translated: Therein, “in order to liberate all beings” teaches the special purpose.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyis bsdus pa'i 'gro ba'i sgrib pa gnyis kyis bcings pa rnam par grol bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyis bsdus pa'i 'gro ba'i sgrib pa gnyis kyis bcings pa rnam par grol bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: It is for the sake of liberating those beings included in the world systems who are bound by the two obscurations.

original: snying rje'i dbang gyur cing zhes pa 'dis rgyu'i khyad par bstan no //
analyzed: snying rje'i dbang gyur cing zhes pa 'dis rgyu'i khyad par bstan no //
translated: The phrase “governed by compassion” indicates the special cause.

original: kun du bzang po'i smon pas rab bsngos zhes pa 'dis yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par bstan te /
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i smon pas rab bsngos zhes pa 'dis yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par bstan te /
translated: The phrase “dedicated by the aspiration of Samantabhadra” indicates the special dedication.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po'i smon lam ni 'dod pa khyad par dge ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po'i smon lam ni 'dod pa khyad par dge ba ste /
translated: The aspiration of the bodhisattva Samantabhadra is a special virtuous aspiration.

original: des yongs su bsgyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: des yongs su bsgyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is transformed by it is the special dedication.

original: dga' ba la rab tu gnas pa zhes pa 'dis gnas kyi khyad par bstan te /
analyzed: dga' ba la rab tu gnas pa zhes pa 'dis gnas kyi khyad par bstan te /
translated: The phrase “abiding in joy” indicates the special abode.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba dang sems bskyed pa dang po tha dad pa med du zin kyang tha dad pa bstan te /
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba dang sems bskyed pa dang po tha dad pa med du zin kyang tha dad pa bstan te /
translated: Although the first generation of the thought of enlightenment and the stage of the joyous one are not different, they are taught as if they were different.

original: sgra gcan gyi mgo bzhin du thun mong ma yin pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: sgra gcan gyi mgo bzhin du thun mong ma yin pa rtogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: This is in order to make known the uncommon realization, as in the case of Rāhu’s head.

original: 'di ni dang po zhes bya ba 'dis grangs kyi khyad par @51b bstan te ;
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhes bya ba 'dis grangs kyi khyad par @51b bstan te ;
translated: The phrase “this is the first” indicates the special number.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems bskyed pa rnams kyi dang po yin pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems bskyed pa rnams kyi dang po yin pas so //
translated: It is the first of the supramundane generations of the thought of enlightenment.

original: sems bskyed pa'i rnam pas bsdus pa yin pas spyi'i dbang du byas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa'i rnam pas bsdus pa yin pas spyi'i dbang du byas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Since it is included in the aspect of generating the Thought, in general terms it says, “of the Bodhisattvas.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes nyid la sogs pa zhes pa'i ming 'thob ste zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes nyid la sogs pa zhes pa'i ming 'thob ste zhes 'brel lo //
translated: The knowledge of the Bodhisattvas obtains the name “pristine wisdom” and so on.

original: sogs pa'i tshig gis stong pa nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i tshig gis stong pa nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: The word “and so on” indicates that one should know emptiness.

original: zag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa rnams de la rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa rnams de la rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: “ Without contamination” means that the contaminations do not increase in it.

original: 'di ltar stong pa dang / snying rjes yongs su zin pa'i shes pa de lam gyis bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa dang / snying rjes yongs su zin pa'i shes pa de lam gyis bsdus pa yin la /
translated: Thus, that knowledge which is embraced by emptiness and compassion is included in the path.

original: lam gyi rang bzhin can gyis shes pa la zag pa rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lam gyi rang bzhin can gyis shes pa la zag pa rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The contaminations do not increase in the knowledge which has the nature of the path.

original: gang bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag gi sred pas brlan par ma byas pa de la zag pa rnams rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag gi sred pas brlan par ma byas pa de la zag pa rnams rgyas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The contaminations do not increase in that which is not moistened by the view of self and the craving for self.

original: rdo tshan de la rkang mthil bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo tshan de la rkang mthil bzhin no //
translated: It is like the sole of the foot on a hot stone.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag gi sred pas lam gyi shes pa brlan par ma byas pa yin pas zag pa med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag gi sred pas lam gyi shes pa brlan par ma byas pa yin pas zag pa med par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since the knowledge of the path is not moistened by the view of self and craving for self, it should be understood as uncontaminated.

original: char rnam par phye ba na shes rab ni chos kyi dbyings la kun tu 'gro ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba yongs su shes pa dang / yon tan la sogs pa'i sgo nas char rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: char rnam par phye ba na shes rab ni chos kyi dbyings la kun tu 'gro ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba yongs su shes pa dang / yon tan la sogs pa'i sgo nas char rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
translated: When classifying the rains, wisdom is classified in terms of the divisions of the knowledge of the dharmadhatu and so on and in terms of the qualities and so forth.

original: 'di ltar gang phyir chos dbyings dang bral ba'i chos ni yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pas chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid de thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pas chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i don du rtogs pa'i cha nas sa dang por rnam🔽par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang phyir chos dbyings dang bral ba'i chos ni yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pas chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid de thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pas chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i don du rtogs pa'i cha nas sa dang por rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, since it is said, “Because there is no phenomenon that is separate from the dharmadhatu,” the dharmadhatu, which is emptiness, is the general characteristic of all phenomena. Therefore, in terms of the aspect of realizing the meaning of the dharmadhatu as omnipresent, it is posited as the first bhumi.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par gyur ba yin te /
translated: For that reason, the perfection of generosity becomes preeminent.

original: bdag dang gzhan la stong pa nyid tha mi dad par mthong ba yin pas rang gi don bzhin du gzhan gyi don la yang 'jug pa yin pas so //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la stong pa nyid tha mi dad par mthong ba yin pas rang gi don bzhin du gzhan gyi don la yang 'jug pa yin pas so //
translated: Since he sees emptiness as undifferentiated in himself and others, he engages in the benefit of others just as in his own benefit.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin pas mchog nyid du yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa gnyis par rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin pas mchog nyid du yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa gnyis par rnam par 'jog go //
translated: Similarly, the second stage is established from the point of view of the complete knowledge of the supreme, since the realm of the Dharma is naturally luminous.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par gyur pa yin te ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par gyur pa yin te ;
translated: For that very reason, the perfection of morality becomes predominant,

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i don de don du gnyer ba yin pas bdag snod du rung bar byed pas so //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i don de don du gnyer ba yin pas bdag snod du rung bar byed pas so //
translated: since he makes himself a suitable vessel by striving for that supreme meaning.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa'i chos kyi sku zhes bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang gis zhugs pa yin pas mdo sde la sogs pa bstan pa'i chos rnams mchog yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa'i chos kyi sku zhes bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi dbang gis zhugs pa yin pas mdo sde la sogs pa bstan pa'i chos rnams mchog yin no //
translated: Similarly, the Dharma teachings of the sutra collection, etc. are supreme, since he is engaged by the power of the realm of the Dharma called the completely purified Dharma body in every way.

original: des @52a * //
analyzed: des @52a * //
translated: By that,

original: na chos kyi dbyings dang rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i chos mchog tu yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa gsum par rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: na chos kyi dbyings dang rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i chos mchog tu yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa gsum par rnam par 'jog go //
translated: The third ground is posited from the perspective of the complete knowledge of the supreme Dharma that is concordant with the dharmadhātu.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa 'dir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa 'dir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: For that very reason, the perfection of patience is greatly enhanced on this ground,

original: thos pa'i ched du sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pas so ;
analyzed: thos pa'i ched du sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pas so ;
translated: because all suffering is endured for the sake of listening to the Dharma.

original: / de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings la bdag gi'o snyam pa'i zhen pa med pas bdag gi ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can yongs su shes pa med pa'i cha nas sa bzhi pa'i rnam gzhag bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings la bdag gi'o snyam pa'i zhen pa med pas bdag gi ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can yongs su shes pa med pa'i cha nas sa bzhi pa'i rnam gzhag bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the fourth ground is posited from the perspective of the complete knowledge of the absence of the conception of mine, which is the characteristic of the absence of mine, because there is no clinging to the dharmadhātu as mine.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa 'dir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa 'dir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
translated: For that very reason, the perfection of effort is greatly enhanced on this ground,

original: spros pa med pa'i shes pas chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa yin pas chos la srid pa la sogs pas chos kyi dbyings de rtogs pa'i don du brtson 'grus lhag par rtsom pas so //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i shes pas chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa yin pas chos la srid pa la sogs pas chos kyi dbyings de rtogs pa'i don du brtson 'grus lhag par rtsom pas so //
translated: because through nonconceptual consciousness, the dharmadhātu is realized. Therefore, in order to realize the dharmadhātu, one makes effort in the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyud kyi chos nyid dang bdag gi rgyud kyi chod nyid la phan tshun tha mi dad pa mnyam pa nyid du mthong nas chos kyi dbyings la rgyu tha dad pa med par yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa lnga par rnam par
analyzed: de bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyud kyi chos nyid dang bdag gi rgyud kyi chod nyid la phan tshun tha mi dad pa mnyam pa nyid du mthong nas chos kyi dbyings la rgyu tha dad pa med par yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa lnga par rnam par
translated: Likewise, having seen that the reality of the continuum of all Buddhas of the past, future, and present and the reality of the continuum of one’s own mental continuum are not mutually different, but are the same, one is placed on the fifth ground, the Hard to Overcome, from the point of view of thoroughly knowing the realm of reality as not having different causes.

original: 'jog go // de nyid kyi phyir sa 'dir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jog go // de nyid kyi phyir sa 'dir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
translated: For that very reason, the perfection of meditative stabilization is far superior on this ground,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan bzhin du bden pa'i rnam pa mang du bsgom pas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan bzhin du bden pa'i rnam pa mang du bsgom pas so //
translated: because, like the bodhisattva, one cultivates many aspects of the truth.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can kun nas nyon mongs pa glo bur ba yod pa yin pas chos kyi dbyings ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur ba dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin pas rnam par ma dag par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa'i chos kyi dbyings yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa drug pa rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can kun nas nyon mongs pa glo bur ba yod pa yin pas chos kyi dbyings ngo bo nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur ba dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin pas rnam par ma dag par mi 'gyur ro snyam pa'i chos kyi dbyings yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa drug pa rnam par 'jog go //
translated: Thus, from the perspective of understanding the dharmadhatu, the sixth ground is posited.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
translated: For that very reason, the perfection of wisdom becomes especially exalted on this ground,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med do snyam pa'i chos kyi dbyings zab par rtogs pa yin pas so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med do snyam pa'i chos kyi dbyings zab par rtogs pa yin pas so //
translated: because it is the realization of the profundity of the dharmadhatu, thinking, “There is no affliction and there is no purification.”

original: de bzhin du gang mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan mas chos kyi dbyings la 'jug cing mtshan ma de rnams mi 'dod pa bzhin du sbyor ba dang de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pa las drug pa'i bar du tha dad pa nyid du mngon @52b par
analyzed: de bzhin du gang mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan mas chos kyi dbyings la 'jug cing mtshan ma de rnams mi 'dod pa bzhin du sbyor ba dang de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pa las drug pa'i bar du tha dad pa nyid du mngon @52b par
translated: After that, the sixfold consciousnesses manifest as different.🔽On the seventh ground, the dharmadhatu is realized as signless through the consciousness that has the aspect of the single taste of signs, phenomena, and the dharmadhatu.

original: 'gyur ro // sa bdun par mtshan ma rnams dang chos rnams dang chos kyi dbyings ro gcig pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pas mtshan ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa yin pas chos kyi dbyings la rnam pa tha dad pa med do snyam du shes pa'i cha nas sa
analyzed: 'gyur ro // sa bdun par mtshan ma rnams dang chos rnams dang chos kyi dbyings ro gcig pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pas mtshan ma med pa'i chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa yin pas chos kyi dbyings la rnam pa tha dad pa med do snyam du shes pa'i cha nas sa
translated: From the point of view of knowing that there is no difference in aspect in the dharmadhatu,

original: bdun par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: bdun par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: it is posited as the seventh.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa 'dir thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa 'dir thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
translated: For that very reason, the perfection of method is far superior on this ground,

original: mtshan ma rnams dang chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad par rtogs kyang mtshan mas byas pa'i bya ba mi 'gegs pas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams dang chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad par rtogs kyang mtshan mas byas pa'i bya ba mi 'gegs pas so //
translated: because although the signs and the dharmadhatu are realized as nondifferent, the activities created by the signs are not negated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa bdun pa la mtshan ma med pa'i lam zhes bya'o //🔽de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin pas dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs la khyad par med pas sa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs na chos gang yang 'grib pa med pa dang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa bdun pa la mtshan ma med pa'i lam zhes bya'o // de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin pas dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs la khyad par med pas sa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs na chos gang yang 'grib pa med pa dang /
translated: For that very reason, the seventh stage is called the stage of the path without signs.🔽Similarly, because the realm of Dharma is pure by nature, there is no difference in the situation of being with stains and being without stains. Therefore, the eighth stage is established from the point of view of the complete knowledge of the non-decrease and non-increase of the realm of Dharma, thinking that when the realm of Dharma is in the situation of defilement, no phenomenon decreases,

original: rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs na chos gang yang 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du chos kyi dbyings la nyams pa med pa dang 'phel ba med pa yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa brgyad pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs na chos gang yang 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du chos kyi dbyings la nyams pa med pa dang 'phel ba med pa yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa brgyad pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: and when the realm of Dharma is in the situation of purification, no phenomenon increases.

original: de yang dbang bzhi'i nang nas dbang gnyis kyi rten nyid du 'gyur ba shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang dbang bzhi'i nang nas dbang gnyis kyi rten nyid du 'gyur ba shes pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the knowledge that it is the basis of two of the four masteries.

original: de la dbang bzhi ni rnam par mi rtog pa la dbang ba nyid dang / zhing yongs su dag pa la dbang ba nyid dang / ye shes la dbang ba nyid dang / las la dbang ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la dbang bzhi ni rnam par mi rtog pa la dbang ba nyid dang / zhing yongs su dag pa la dbang ba nyid dang / ye shes la dbang ba nyid dang / las la dbang ba nyid do //
translated: The four masteries are mastery over nonconceptuality, mastery over the pure land, mastery over intuition, and mastery over action.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa la dbang ba nyid ni chos kyi dbyings la rtsol ba med par mtshan ma thams cad kun du mi spyod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa la dbang ba nyid ni chos kyi dbyings la rtsol ba med par mtshan ma thams cad kun du mi spyod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Mastery over nonconceptuality should be understood as the absence of any activity of signs in the realm of reality, without any effort.

original: sa bdun par yang mtshan ma la kun tu spyod pa med par rtsol la ;
analyzed: sa bdun par yang mtshan ma la kun tu spyod pa med par rtsol la ;
translated: On the seventh stage, there is no activity of signs, but there is effort.

original: 'dir ni med do zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni med do zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: But here, there is none. This is the difference.

original: zhing yongs su dag pa la dbang ba nyid ni chos kyi dbyings kyi mthus ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / 'khor ston pa'i nus pa thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa la dbang ba nyid ni chos kyi dbyings kyi mthus ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / 'khor ston pa'i nus pa thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: Mastery over the pure land should be understood as the attainment of the power to manifest a buddha land and a circle of followers in whatever way one wishes, by the power of the realm of reality.

original: dbang gnyis kyi rten chos kyi dbyings yin no snyam du yongs su shes pa ni sa brgyad pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: dbang gnyis kyi rten chos kyi dbyings yin no snyam du yongs su shes pa ni sa brgyad pa kho nar ro //
translated: The understanding that the realm of reality is the basis of the two masteries occurs only on the eighth stage.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa der smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa der smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the perfection of vows is preeminent on that stage,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / zhing yongs su dag pa la dbang ba nyid yin pas dge ba la bar ma chad par sbyor ba yin pas so //🔽de bzhin du so so yang dag par rig pa thob pas chos kyi dbyings @53a * //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa dang / zhing yongs su dag pa la dbang ba nyid yin pas dge ba la bar ma chad par sbyor ba yin pas so // de bzhin du so so yang dag par rig pa thob pas chos kyi dbyings @53a * //
translated: because one is uninterruptedly engaged in virtue by being nonconceptual and by having power over the complete purification of the realm.🔽Similarly, the ninth stage is established from the perspective of the portion of understanding that is the basis for power over the wisdom of the dharmadhatu

original: ye shes la dbang ba nyid kyi rten nyid du yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa dgu par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ye shes la dbang ba nyid kyi rten nyid du yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa dgu par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: through the attainment of the correct and discerning awarenesses.

original: sngar sa bcu pa la so so yang dag par rig pa dang lhan cig tu gyur par gang smras pa de mi zad pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa thob pas so //
analyzed: sngar sa bcu pa la so so yang dag par rig pa dang lhan cig tu gyur par gang smras pa de mi zad pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa thob pas so //
translated: The correct and discerning awarenesses that were previously mentioned on the tenth stage are attained through the attainment of the inexhaustible correct and discerning awarenesses.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa der stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa der stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the perfection of power is preeminent on that stage,

original: shes rab kyi stobs khyad par can yod pas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs khyad par can yod pas so //
translated: because the power of wisdom is special.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings las la dbang ba'i rten nyid du yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa bcu par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings las la dbang ba'i rten nyid du yongs su shes pa'i cha nas sa bcu par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Similarly, it is established as the tenth stage from the perspective of the aspect of thorough knowledge as the basis of power over karma in the dharmadhatu.

original: de la las la dbang ba nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i las la dbang ba nyid thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la las la dbang ba nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i las la dbang ba nyid thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Power over karma is the attainment of the power over karma of the Tathagata.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa der ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa der ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu lhag par 'gyur te /
translated: For that very reason, the perfection of wisdom becomes especially superior on that stage,

original: chos kyi longs spyod kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas so //
translated: because it is endowed with the distinction of bringing sentient beings to full maturity through the enjoyment of Dharma.

original: cha shas rnam par phye bar bya ba bstan zin to ;
analyzed: cha shas rnam par phye bar bya ba bstan zin to ;
translated: The analysis of the parts has been explained.

original: / yon tan gyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin brgya thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i yon tan rnams kyi gnas yin pas so //
analyzed: / yon tan gyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin brgya thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i yon tan rnams kyi gnas yin pas so //
translated: Because it is the basis of good qualities means that it is the basis of the good qualities that will be explained, such as attaining a hundred concentrations.

original: sa zhes bya ba'i ming thob ste zhes pa ni ji ltar sas sems can gyi gnas byed pas sa zhes brjod pa bzhin du sems bskyed pa yang sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba'i ming thob ste zhes pa ni ji ltar sas sems can gyi gnas byed pas sa zhes brjod pa bzhin du sems bskyed pa yang sa zhes bya ste /
translated: The name “level” is obtained because, just as the earth is called “earth” because it acts as the support of sentient beings, so too is the bodhicitta called a “level” because it acts as the support of the qualities of the āryas.🔽

original: yon tan gyi rten byed pas so //
analyzed: yon tan gyi rten byed pas so //
translated: The phrase “one obtains the name ‘ground’” means that just as the term “ground” is used because the earth acts as the abode of sentient beings, so the term “ground” is used for the generation of the mind because it acts as the basis for good qualities.

original: de lta bu'i sa zhes bya ba'i shes pa la don dam par rang bzhin med pa yin pas rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gyis byas pa'i dbye ba med du zin kyang kun rdzob tu dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sa zhes bya ba'i shes pa la don dam par rang bzhin med pa yin pas rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gyis byas pa'i dbye ba med du zin kyang kun rdzob tu dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Although the cognition called “ground” is ultimately devoid of intrinsic nature, and thus there is no division made by way of its own nature, in order to teach the division conventionally,

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: the text says “that” and so on.

original: shes pa de yang sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bas dbye ba rnam pa bcur gzhag gi zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
analyzed: shes pa de yang sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye bas dbye ba rnam pa bcur gzhag gi zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
translated: That cognition is posited as having ten divisions by way of the divisions of the grounds, such as the Joyful.

original: de la 'dir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnams la rnam pa bzhi bzhi'i sgo nas dbye ba'i rnam gzhag bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rnams la rnam pa bzhi bzhi'i sgo nas dbye ba'i rnam gzhag bya ste /
translated: Here, the grounds such as the first ground, the Joyful, are presented as having divisions by way of four topics each.

original: yon tan gyi grangs lhag par thob pa dang / mthu lhag par thob pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par smin pa mchog tu gyur ba'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: yon tan gyi grangs lhag par thob pa dang / mthu lhag par thob pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par smin pa mchog tu gyur ba'i dbye bas so //
translated: The superiority of attainment of the number of virtues, the superiority of attainment of power, the superiority of the perfections such as giving, and the superiority of the best evolutionary development.

original: de la yon tan gyi grangs lhag par thob pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yon tan gyi grangs lhag par thob pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The superiority of attainment of the number of virtues is as follows:

original: sa dang por skad cig ma gcig la ting nge 'dzin brgya thob @53b pa dang ; snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnam par shes par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang por skad cig ma gcig la ting nge 'dzin brgya thob @53b pa dang ; snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnam par shes par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: On the first stage, in a single moment one attains a hundred meditative concentrations, enters a hundred meditative attainments, sees a hundred Buddhas, and recognizes their blessing.

original: mthu lhag par thob pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams brgya 'gul bar byed pa dang / snang bar byed pa dang / zhing brgya phrag gcig tu snon par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthu lhag par thob pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams brgya 'gul bar byed pa dang / snang bar byed pa dang / zhing brgya phrag gcig tu snon par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The superiority of attainment of power is as follows: One can shake a hundred world-realms, illuminate them, and so on.

original: sa gnyis par yon tan grangs lhag par thob pa ni skad cig ma gcig la ting nge 'dzin stong thob pa dang / sangs rgyas stong mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis par yon tan grangs lhag par thob pa ni skad cig ma gcig la ting nge 'dzin stong thob pa dang / sangs rgyas stong mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the qualities in greater number on the second ground is the attainment of a thousand meditative absorptions in a single moment, the seeing of a thousand buddhas, and so forth.

original: mthu ni 'jig rten gyi khams stong 'gul bar byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthu ni 'jig rten gyi khams stong 'gul bar byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The power is the shaking of a thousand world systems and so forth.

original: yon tan dang mthu 'di dag sa thams cad la de'i tshe sangs rgyas brgya ni 'dis mthong 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa'i yon tan ston pa'i dus su bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan dang mthu 'di dag sa thams cad la de'i tshe sangs rgyas brgya ni 'dis mthong 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa'i yon tan ston pa'i dus su bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: These qualities and powers are explained in the context of teaching the qualities of each ground, such as “At that time, he sees a hundred buddhas” and so forth.

original: 'dir yon tan dang mthu tha dad du bstan la /
analyzed: 'dir yon tan dang mthu tha dad du bstan la /
translated: Here, the qualities and powers are taught separately.

original: 'og tu ni mthu yon tan gyi rang bzhin du bstan no ;
analyzed: 'og tu ni mthu yon tan gyi rang bzhin du bstan no ;
translated: Later, the powers are taught as being of the nature of the qualities.

original: / sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par 'gyur ba sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: / sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par 'gyur ba sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been taught that the perfections such as generosity become superior.

original: rnam par smin pa mchog tu gyur pa'i khyad par ni sa dang po thob pa na 'dzam bu'i gling la dbang bsgyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa mchog tu gyur pa'i khyad par ni sa dang po thob pa na 'dzam bu'i gling la dbang bsgyur ro //
translated: The distinctive supreme evolutionary development is that upon attaining the first ground, one becomes a monarch of the Rose Apple Continent.

original: sa gnyis pa thob pas gling bzhi la dbang ba'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa thob pas gling bzhi la dbang ba'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: By attaining the second ground, one becomes a universal monarch ruling over the four continents.

original: ji ltar rin po che'i phreng ba las //
analyzed: ji ltar rin po che'i phreng ba las //
translated: As it says in the Precious Garland:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin pa mchog /'jig rten khams brgya 'gul bar byed //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol phyin pa mchog /'jig rten khams brgya 'gul bar byed //
translated: The perfection of generosity, supreme, shakes a hundred world systems.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling la dbang byed mchog / rnam par smin pa 'di ru skye //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling la dbang byed mchog / rnam par smin pa 'di ru skye //
translated: The supreme ripening is birth in Jambudvīpa.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: 'di dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni don dam par ye shes rang bzhin med pas so //🔽de nyid la sa bcu'i mdo'i tshig cha de mar bya bar bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni don dam par ye shes rang bzhin med pas so // de nyid la sa bcu'i mdo'i tshig cha de mar bya bar bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: The phrase “in these” and so on is stated because, ultimately, wisdom is devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this very point, the following verse is cited from the Sūtra on the Ten Grounds.🔽As it says:

original: ji ltar na nam mkha' la 'phur ba'i bya'i rjes mkhas pa rnams kyis smra ba dang mthong bar mi nus te /
analyzed: ji ltar na nam mkha' la 'phur ba'i bya'i rjes mkhas pa rnams kyis smra ba dang mthong bar mi nus te /
translated: Just as the tracks of a bird moving through the sky cannot be shown,

original: nam mkha'i yul phyogs yongs su gcod par mi nus pas so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yul phyogs yongs su gcod par mi nus pas so //
translated: because the domain of space cannot be delimited,

original: der bya mi 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der bya mi 'gro ba ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not that the bird does not move through the sky.

original: de bzhin du bya'i rjes dang 'dra ba'i ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs kyi gnas su gyur pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa so so rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin can mkhas pa rnams kyis smra bar mi nus pa dang / thos par mi nus te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bya'i rjes dang 'dra ba'i ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs kyi gnas su gyur pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa so so rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin can mkhas pa rnams kyis smra bar mi nus pa dang / thos par mi nus te /
translated: Likewise, the bodhisattva levels, which are the basis for the collection of names, phrases and letters that are like the imprints of a bird's foot, are by nature to be realized by oneself and cannot be spoken of or heard by the wise.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'i @54a * //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'i @54a * //
translated: Likewise, the bodhisattva stages, which are the basis for the collection of names, words, and letters, which are like the tracks of a bird, are of the nature of individual knowledge, and cannot be spoken or heard by the wise.

original: rang bzhin med pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pas so //
translated: Because they are not of the nature of the literal.

original: de la kun rdzob tu ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs dgod par mi bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob tu ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs dgod par mi bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not that the collection of names, words, and letters should not be set forth conventionally.

original: de la sa bcu'i ming gi dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la sa bcu'i ming gi dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the classification of the names of the ten stages,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said there and so on.

original: de la sems bskyed pa bcu ni rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang /
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa bcu ni rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang /
translated: There, the ten types of generation of bodhicitta are the Joyful, the Stainless, the Luminous, the Radiant, the Hard-to-Conquer, the Manifested, the Gone Afar, the Immovable, the Excellent Intelligence, and the Cloud of Dharma.

original: legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba'i ming can no //
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros dang / chos kyi sprin zhes bya ba'i ming can no //
translated: the stage called Perfect Understanding, and the stage called Cloud of Dharma.

original: de la mngal gyi gnas skabs bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la mngal gyi gnas skabs bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: The ten stages of the bodhisattva should be understood as being like the ten states of the embryo.

original: sa rnams sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa rnams sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the stages are associated with obscurations.

original: skyes pa'i gnas skabs lta bu ni sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i gnas skabs lta bu ni sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The state of Buddhahood is like the state of birth,

original: bya ba yongs su rdzogs pas shes bya thams cad nyams su myong bas so //
analyzed: bya ba yongs su rdzogs pas shes bya thams cad nyams su myong bas so //
translated: because the task is completed, since all that is to be done is accomplished, and all that is to be known is experienced.

original: skye gnas dbang po thams cad kyi spyod yul nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: skye gnas dbang po thams cad kyi spyod yul nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the embryo experiences the objects of all the sense faculties.

original: de la mngal gyi gnas skabs rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de la mngal gyi gnas skabs rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten states of the embryo:

original: khu ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / sha'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / lhod pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / sra ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / lus dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / rang bzhin dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang /
analyzed: khu ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / sha'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / lhod pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / sra ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / lus dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / rang bzhin dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang /
translated: the state of semen and blood, the state of flesh, the state of pimples, the state of oblongs, the state of hands and feet, the state of head-hair, body-hair and nails, the state of four limbs and five places, the state of teeth, and the state of faculties.

original: las dang bcas pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: las dang bcas pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: the stage of the body with its karma, and the stage of the complete body.

original: de la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The latter is threefold:

original: dbang po yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mtshan yongs su rdzogs pa dang / chu dang zheng yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mtshan yongs su rdzogs pa dang / chu dang zheng yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: the stage of the complete sense-organs, the stage of the complete sexual characteristics, and the stage of the complete size and shape.

original: mngal gyi gnas skabs bcu dang sa bcu chos mthun par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mngal gyi gnas skabs bcu dang sa bcu chos mthun par rig par bya'o //
translated: The ten stages of the embryo should be known as analogous to the ten stages.

original: sa'i don bshad nas tshigs su bcad pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sa'i don bshad nas tshigs su bcad pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the meaning of the stages, in order to demonstrate the meaning of the verse, he says,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therein and so on.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'gro ba g-yo ba chu'i nang gi zla ba ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'gro ba g-yo ba chu'i nang gi zla ba ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The moving world is like a reflection in water and so on, in the manner already explained.

original: snying rje'i khyad par gyis nye bar gzung ba'i zhes pa ni chos la dmigs pa'i snying rje dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje'i khyad par gyis nye bar gzung ba'i zhes pa ni chos la dmigs pa'i snying rje dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The special compassion is that which is endowed with the compassion which has the Dharma as its object.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas so //
translated: Non-dual intuition is free from the conceptualization of subject and object.

original: de'i rgyu can gyi 'bras bu nye bar mtshon pa zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu las byung ba'i mthong bas spong bar bya @54b ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can gyi 'bras bu nye bar mtshon pa zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu las byung ba'i mthong bas spong bar bya @54b ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The result that is characterized by that cause is the result that is characterized by the abandonment of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing, etc., which arises from the cause of nondual knowledge.

original: kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyis yongs su bsngos pa zhes smos pa'i dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun tu bzang po'i smon lam gyis yongs su bsngos pa zhes smos pa'i dgos pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the purpose of the statement, “dedicated by the Samantabhadra prayer,”

original: de la smon lam chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la smon lam chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Therein, the great prayers,” and so on.

original: smon lam chen po bcu zhes pa ni 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las bstan to //
analyzed: smon lam chen po bcu zhes pa ni 'phags pa sa bcu'i mdo las bstan to //
translated: The ten great prayers are taught in the noble Sūtra on the Ten Stages.🔽They are as follows:

original: 'di lta ste sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i phyir rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i mos pa rgya chen pos rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa rgya che ba /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i phyir rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa'i mos pa rgya chen pos rnam par dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa rgya che ba /
translated: In order to make offerings and render service to all the buddhas, with vast, superior aspiration endowed with all the best forms, pure, extending as far as the realm of phenomena,

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa /
translated: reaching the end of space,

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa bskal pa'i grangs su 'byung ba la rim gro dang mchod pa chen po bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub po zhes pa ni dang po'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa bskal pa'i grangs su 'byung ba la rim gro dang mchod pa chen po bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub po zhes pa ni dang po'o //
translated: The first great vow is to make offerings and to serve for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the river Ganges, until the end of time.

original: smon lam 'di ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: smon lam 'di ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: This vow is for the sake of perfecting the accumulation of merit.

original: de la mchod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /🔽rnyed pa'i mchod pa chos gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mchod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste / rnyed pa'i mchod pa chos gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: There are three kinds of offerings:🔽material offerings, such as robes;

original: bkur sti'i mchod pa gdugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti'i mchod pa gdugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: respectful offerings, such as parasols;

original: sgrub pa'i mchod pa dang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i mchod pa dang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: and offerings of practice, such as the first of the perfections.

original: rim grol rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rim grol rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of service:

original: bsnyen bkur dang / bka' lung dang / sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur dang / bka' lung dang / sgrub pa'o //
translated: service through respect, service through orders, and service through practice.

original: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa ni rab tu mang po dang / sna tshogs pa'i dngos po dang / gya nom pa'i dngos pos so //
analyzed: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa ni rab tu mang po dang / sna tshogs pa'i dngos po dang / gya nom pa'i dngos pos so //
translated: Possessing all the best aspects means having many things, various things, and excellent things.

original: mos pa rgya chen pos rnam par dag pa ni shin tu dang ba dang / byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i lhag par mos pas so //
analyzed: mos pa rgya chen pos rnam par dag pa ni shin tu dang ba dang / byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i lhag par mos pas so //
translated: The purification by vast aspiration is by means of the aspiration to the highest enlightenment.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pas rgya che ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan thams cad las gtso bor gyur pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pas rgya che ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan thams cad las gtso bor gyur pas so //
translated: The vastness of the realm of totality is due to the preeminence of all the roots of virtue.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa ni 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mi rtag pa'i rgyu nyid du mi zad pas so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthar thug pa ni 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mi rtag pa'i rgyu nyid du mi zad pas so //
translated: The limit of the realm of space is due to the impermanence of the result of the desire for it, since it is inexhaustible.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa ni rtag pa'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa ni rtag pa'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu yin pas so //
translated: The limit of the future is due to the permanence of the result of the desire for it, since it is the cause of attaining nirvana.

original: bskal pa'i grangs la sogs pa'i don ni bsdul  ba thams cad du sangs rgyas 'byung ba thams cad la rim gro dang / mchod pa chen po rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: bskal pa'i grangs la sogs pa'i don ni bsdul  ba thams cad du sangs rgyas 'byung ba thams cad la rim gro dang / mchod pa chen po rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning of the enumeration of eons, etc. is for the sake of the uninterrupted performance of great service and worship of all the Buddhas in all the universes.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi tshul yang dag par gzung ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub sems dpa' yongs su @55a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi tshul yang dag par gzung ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub sems dpa' yongs su @55a * //
translated: Likewise, it is to uphold the way of the Dharma that has been taught by all thus-gone ones, and it is to uphold the bodhisattva way of all buddhas.🔽

original: 'dzin pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir zhes pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Likewise, for the purpose of upholding the way of the Dharma taught by all the Tathagatas, and for the purpose of upholding the Bodhisattvas of all the Buddhas, and for the purpose of protecting the teachings of all the Perfectly Awakened Ones, he made this vow.

original: smon lam 'di ni ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: smon lam 'di ni ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: This vow is for the purpose of completing the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata is the perfect teacher.

original: chos kyi tshul ni mdo sde la sogs pa lung gi tshogs so //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul ni mdo sde la sogs pa lung gi tshogs so //
translated: The way of the Dharma is the collection of scriptures such as the sutras.

original: sangs rgyas ni ji snyed pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni ji snyed pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: The Buddhas are the perfect realizations.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa ni rtog pa'i ched du gdams ngag 'bogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa ni rtog pa'i ched du gdams ngag 'bogs pa'o //
translated: Upholding is the giving of instructions for the sake of realization.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ji lta ba bzhin mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ji lta ba bzhin mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The Perfectly Awakened Ones are the realizations of things as they are.

original: bstan pa yongs su bsrung ba ni sgrub pa byed pa rnams la nye bar 'tshe ba bsrung bas so //
analyzed: bstan pa yongs su bsrung ba ni sgrub pa byed pa rnams la nye bar 'tshe ba bsrung bas so //
translated: Protecting the teaching is protecting the practice from harm.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa ma lus pa thams cad du sangs rgyas 'byung zhing dga' ldan gyi pho brang dam pa na bzhugs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa ma lus pa thams cad du sangs rgyas 'byung zhing dga' ldan gyi pho brang dam pa na bzhugs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, in all the infinite world systems, the Buddha appears, dwells in the excellent Tuṣita palace, and so on.

original: 'pho ba dang / gshegs pa dang / lhums na bzhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / gzhon nu rol pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyad pa dang / snying po byang chub tu gshegs pa dang /
analyzed: 'pho ba dang / gshegs pa dang / lhums na bzhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / gzhon nu rol pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyad pa dang / snying po byang chub tu gshegs pa dang /
translated: He descends, enters the womb, is born, enjoys youth, lives in the harem, leaves home, practices austerities, goes to the seat of awakening,🔽conquers the demons, awakens, is requested to teach, turns the great wheel of Dharma, and goes to nirvana.

original: bdud btul ba dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gsol ba btab pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du nye bar 'gro ba'o zhes pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bdud btul ba dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba dang / gsol ba btab pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du nye bar 'gro ba'o zhes pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third.

original: gsum pa la sogs pa'i smon lam lnga ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i ched du ste /
analyzed: gsum pa la sogs pa'i smon lam lnga ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i ched du ste /
translated: The five prayers beginning with the third are for the sake of bringing beings to maturity.

original: bsam pa ci 'dra ba dang / sems ci 'dra ba dang / sems can gang dang gang na gnas pa dang / ji ltar gyur pa sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / smon lam lngas rim pa bzhin du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ci 'dra ba dang / sems ci 'dra ba dang / sems can gang dang gang na gnas pa dang / ji ltar gyur pa sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / smon lam lngas rim pa bzhin du bstan pa'o //
translated: They are taught by five prayers, respectively, with regard to what kind of attitude, what kind of mind, what kind of beings are to be brought to maturity, how they are to be brought to maturity, and how the bodhisattva is to be reborn.

original: de la bsam pa'i sgo nas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa la sogs pa thabs la mkhas pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: de la bsam pa'i sgo nas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa la sogs pa thabs la mkhas pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: Among them, bringing beings to maturity by means of attitude is due to the nature of skill in liberative art, as when he dwells in the Tusita palace, and so on.

original: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the verses is easy to understand.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa'i sa yongs su sbyong ba'i yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag dang bcas pa'i yongs su sbyong ba la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa 'bogs pa'i don du nye bar bstan pa'i sems bskyed pa grub pa'i phyir zhes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus pa'i sa yongs su sbyong ba'i yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag dang bcas pa'i yongs su sbyong ba la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa 'bogs pa'i don du nye bar bstan pa'i sems bskyed pa grub pa'i phyir zhes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the fourth is for the sake of the bodhisattva's spiritual practice, the instructions and follow up teachings on the purification of the stages which are included in the perfections, and for the sake of the accomplishment of the generation of the mind which is taught for that purpose.

original: sa yongs su @55b sbyong ba ni mngon rtogs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa yongs su @55b sbyong ba ni mngon rtogs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The purification of the stages should be understood according to the Abhisamayalankara.

original: rjes su bstan pa ni gdams ngag thob pa de yongs su bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa ni gdams ngag thob pa de yongs su bsrung ba'o //
translated: The follow up teachings are the protection of the instructions which have been received.

original: de bzhin du khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / rigs la gnas pa'i ming dang / gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i sems can gyi khams ma lus pa yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos la gzud pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / rigs la gnas pa'i ming dang / gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i sems can gyi khams ma lus pa yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos la gzud pa dang /
translated: Similarly, the fifth is for the sake of the maturation of the entire realm of sentient beings included in the name and form which is based on the realms, destinies, birth places and families, and for the sake of introducing them to the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'gro ba grangs kyis yongs su mi chod pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dgod pa'i phyir zhes pa ni lnga pa'o //🔽de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams yangs pa dang / dog pa dang / rgya chen po dang / tshad med pa dang / phra ba dang / che ba dang ; snrel zhi dang / rtse mo dang bral zhing gzhi mnyam pa dang / rab tu 'jug pa la yang dag par gzhol ba dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba grangs kyis yongs su mi chod pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dgod pa'i phyir zhes pa ni lnga pa'o // de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams yangs pa dang / dog pa dang / rgya chen po dang / tshad med pa dang / phra ba dang / che ba dang ; snrel zhi dang / rtse mo dang bral zhing gzhi mnyam pa dang / rab tu 'jug pa la yang dag par gzhol ba dang ldan pa dang /
translated: In order to establish all beings, as numerous as the limits of space, in the knowledge of omniscience, is the fifth.

original: mig 'phrul gyi rnam pa ltar phyogs bcu'i rnam pa tha dad pa ma lus pa'i rnam pa 'jug pa rnam par phye ba'i ye shes khong du chud cing mngon du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni drug go //
analyzed: mig 'phrul gyi rnam pa ltar phyogs bcu'i rnam pa tha dad pa ma lus pa'i rnam pa 'jug pa rnam par phye ba'i ye shes khong du chud cing mngon du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni drug go //
translated: In order to understand and realize the knowledge that penetrates all the different aspects of the ten directions, such as the vast and the narrow, the great and the immeasurable, the subtle and the coarse, the inverted and the upright, the level and the uneven, and the entry and the engagement, is the sixth.
