original: de la ji ltar rigs par yangs pa dang / dog pa dang / rgya chen po ni stong gcig dang / stong gnyis dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ji ltar rigs par yangs pa dang / dog pa dang / rgya chen po ni stong gcig dang / stong gnyis dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la shes par bya'o //
translated: The dimensions of the world-realms are to be understood as follows: the small, the medium, and the great, are respectively one, two, and three thousand of the four continents.

original: de la stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams ni 'dzam bu'i gling dang / shar gyi lus 'phags dang / ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan stong dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba stong dang / ri rab stong dang / rgyal chen ris bzhi nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar stong dang /🔽tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong la stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams ni 'dzam bu'i gling dang / shar gyi lus 'phags dang / ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan stong dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba stong dang / ri rab stong dang / rgyal chen ris bzhi nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar stong dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong la stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The small chiliocosm is one thousand times the four continents, the sun, the moon, Meru, and Jambudvipa, etc.🔽The medium dichiliocosm is one thousand times the small chiliocosm.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams stong la stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams stong la stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: The great trichiliocosm is one thousand times the medium dichiliocosm.

original: stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams stong la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o //🔽tshad med pa ni sems can mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams stong la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o // tshad med pa ni sems can mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: A thousand times the medium dichiliocosm is called a great trichiliocosm.

original: phra ba ni gang na yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus yod pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba ni gang na yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus yod pa'o //
translated: The small is where there is a body of the nature of mind.

original: che ba ni yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus yod pa'o //🔽snrel zhi ni rim pa ma yin par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: che ba ni yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus yod pa'o // snrel zhi ni rim pa ma yin par gnas pa'o //
translated: The great is where there is a body of the nature of mind.🔽The inverted is where it is not arranged in stages.

original: rtse mo dang bral zhing gzhi mnyam pa ni khang khyim gyi dbyibs ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: rtse mo dang bral zhing gzhi mnyam pa ni khang khyim gyi dbyibs ma byas pa'o //
translated: The even is where there are no houses.

original: rab tu 'jug pa la yang dag par gzhol ba ni khang khyim gyi dbyibs byas pa'o //🔽'di ni 'jig @56a * //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa la yang dag par gzhol ba ni khang khyim gyi dbyibs byas pa'o // 'di ni 'jig @56a * //
translated: The entered is where there are houses.

original: rten gyi khams spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rten gyi khams spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the general characteristic of the world systems.

original: mig 'phrul gyi rnam pa lta bu ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad las kyi sgyu ma'i rang bzhin yin pas mig 'phrul gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig 'phrul gyi rnam pa lta bu ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad las kyi sgyu ma'i rang bzhin yin pas mig 'phrul gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
translated: Like an illusion means that all world systems are of the nature of illusory karma, so they are like an illusion.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyi don dam pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyi don dam pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the ultimate of the world-realms.

original: phyogs bcu'i rnam pa tha dad pa ma lus pa'i rnam pa la 'jug pas rnam par phye ba'i zhes pa ni phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa tha dad pa yod pa thams cad ye shes kyi sgo nas rnam par phye ba gang
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i rnam pa tha dad pa ma lus pa'i rnam pa la 'jug pas rnam par phye ba'i zhes pa ni phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa tha dad pa yod pa thams cad ye shes kyi sgo nas rnam par phye ba gang
translated: The phrase “distinguished by the engagement with all the different aspects in the ten directions” means that all the world-realms that exist in the ten directions, without exception, are distinguished by way of their knowledge.

original: yin pa'o // 'di ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi tshad med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yin pa'o // 'di ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi tshad med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the immeasurability of the world-realms.

original: de la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la smon pa ni ye shes kyi khong du chud par bya ba'i don du smon pa'o //
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la smon pa ni ye shes kyi khong du chud par bya ba'i don du smon pa'o //
translated: With regard to that, the aspiration for the characteristic of the ultimate is the aspiration for the purpose of being understood by way of knowledge.

original: spyi dang tshad med pa'i mtshan nyid la smon pa ni mngon du gyur pa'i don du smon pa'o //
analyzed: spyi dang tshad med pa'i mtshan nyid la smon pa ni mngon du gyur pa'i don du smon pa'o //
translated: The aspiration for the characteristic of the general and the immeasurable is the aspiration for the purpose of being actualized.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid can 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa shes nas der gnas te /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid can 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa shes nas der gnas te /
translated: Having understood all the world-realms, which have the characteristics of the conventional and the ultimate, one abides there.

original: sems can rnams smin par bya'o zhes pa'o //🔽de bzhin du zhing thams cad zhing gcig tu yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba dang / zhing gcig zhing thams cad du yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba dang / yongs su sbyong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa 'od mang po'i rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan par bya ba dang /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal bas yongs su dag pa'i lam dang ldan pa dang / sems can ye shes kyi 'byung gnas tshad med pas yongs su gang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po la yang dag par gzhol zhing khong du chud par bya ba dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams smin par bya'o zhes pa'o // de bzhin du zhing thams cad zhing gcig tu yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba dang / zhing gcig zhing thams cad du yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba dang / yongs su sbyong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa 'od mang po'i rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan par bya ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal bas yongs su dag pa'i lam dang ldan pa dang / sems can ye shes kyi 'byung gnas tshad med pas yongs su gang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po la yang dag par gzhol zhing khong du chud par bya ba dang /
translated: and to bring sentient beings to maturity.🔽Similarly, to cause all buddha-fields to be absorbed into one buddha-field, and one buddha-field to be absorbed into all buddha-fields; to purify the buddha-fields by adorning them with the light of immeasurable buddha-fields;🔽to cause the buddha-fields to be endowed with the path of purity by removing all the defilements; to cause the buddha-fields to be absorbed into the vast domain of the Buddha, filled with immeasurable sources of knowledge of sentient beings;

original: bsam pa'i tshul bzhin du sems can rnams la yang dag par bstan cing shin tu tshim par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i tshul bzhin du sems can rnams la yang dag par bstan cing shin tu tshim par bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: and to cause the buddha-fields to be absorbed into the domain of the Buddha, filled with immeasurable sources of knowledge of sentient beings; and to cause the buddha-fields to be absorbed into the domain of the Buddha, filled with immeasurable sources of knowledge of sentient beings; original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows the purification of the Buddha-land.

original: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: And that is sevenfold:

original: thun mong ba nyid kyi rnam par dag pa ni zhing thams cad zhing gcig tu yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba dang zhes pas bstan to //
analyzed: thun mong ba nyid kyi rnam par dag pa ni zhing thams cad zhing gcig tu yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba dang zhes pas bstan to //
translated: Purification as commonality is indicated by “making all lands converge into one land.”

original: yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes pa ni dbang nyid yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbyang ba dang zhes pa ni dbang nyid yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Purification as mastery is indicated by “purifying the Buddha-land.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa 'od mang po'i rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan par bya ba dang / rab tu dang ba skyed par byed pa'i rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med pa 'od mang po'i rgyan gyis rab tu brgyan par bya ba dang / rab tu dang ba skyed par byed pa'i rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Purification as the creation of faith is indicated by “adorn with many lights the immeasurable Buddha-lands.”

original: 'od kyi rgyan dang dbyibs kyi @56b rgyan gyis so //
analyzed: 'od kyi rgyan dang dbyibs kyi @56b rgyan gyis so //
translated: This is because of the adornment of light and the adornment of shape.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal bas yongs su dag pa'i lam dang ldan pa dang zhes pa ni yongs su longs spyod pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal bas yongs su dag pa'i lam dang ldan pa dang zhes pa ni yongs su longs spyod pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Purification as the path of purification is indicated by “endowed with the path of purification free from all afflictions.”🔽This is the purification of enjoyment.

original: sems can ye shes kyi 'byung gnas tshad med pa yongs su gang ba'i zhes pa ni der gnas pa'i sems can gyi yongs su dag pa'o ;
analyzed: sems can ye shes kyi 'byung gnas tshad med pa yongs su gang ba'i zhes pa ni der gnas pa'i sems can gyi yongs su dag pa'o ;
translated: The phrase “filled with immeasurable sentient beings who are the source of pristine awareness” describes the purity of the sentient beings who dwell there.

original: / sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po la yang dag par gzhol zhing khong du chud par bya ba dang zhes pas ni rgyu'i rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: / sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po la yang dag par gzhol zhing khong du chud par bya ba dang zhes pas ni rgyu'i rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The phrase “to engage in and comprehend the vast domain of the buddhas” describes the purity of the cause.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul du gyur pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la gzhol bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul du gyur pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la gzhol bas so //
translated: It is the purity of the cause because it is the engagement in generosity and so forth that is the domain of the buddhas.

original: bsal ba'i tshul bzhin du sems can rnams la yang dag par bstan cing shin tu tshim pa'i zhes pas ni 'bras bu'i rnam par dag pa bstan te /
analyzed: bsal ba'i tshul bzhin du sems can rnams la yang dag par bstan cing shin tu tshim pa'i zhes pas ni 'bras bu'i rnam par dag pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “to teach sentient beings in accordance with their dispositions and to satisfy them completely” describes the purity of the result.

original: de la yang dag par bstan pa ni ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: de la yang dag par bstan pa ni ye shes kyis so //
translated: In this context, “to teach” refers to the purity of pristine awareness.

original: shin tu tshim par byed pa ni mthu'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: shin tu tshim par byed pa ni mthu'i sgo nas so //
translated: “To satisfy completely” refers to the purity of power.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang bsam pa gcig pa'i sbyor ba dang / mtshungs pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'grogs shing mi 'bral ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang bsam pa gcig pa'i sbyor ba dang / mtshungs pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'grogs shing mi 'bral ba dang /
translated: Likewise, they are the same in their application of being of one mind with all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, in all their roots of virtue that are beyond compare, and so forth, and in their constant companionship with all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, never being apart from them.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ji ltar ston pa dang / rang gi sems bskyed pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mthu dang ye shes khong du chud par bya ba dang / mnyam zhing rjes su 'brang ba'i mngon par shes pa thob par bya ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba ji ltar ston pa dang / rang gi sems bskyed pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mthu dang ye shes khong du chud par bya ba dang / mnyam zhing rjes su 'brang ba'i mngon par shes pa thob par bya ba dang /
translated: They are the same in the way they display the appearance of buddhas, in their generating the mind of awakening, in their understanding the power and wisdom of all the tathagatas, and in their attaining the superknowledges that are equal and in accord with that.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam par bsgyur bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du snang ba thob pa dang theg pa chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir zhes pa ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam par bsgyur bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du snang ba thob pa dang theg pa chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir zhes pa ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: In order to transform all worldly realms, to attain the light of the Buddha's retinue circle, and to continuously practice all the bodhisattva practices endowed with the inconceivable Great Vehicle. This is the eighth.

original: brgyad pa la sogs pa smon lam gsum ni bdag nyid kyis yongs su sbyong ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa la sogs pa smon lam gsum ni bdag nyid kyis yongs su sbyong ba'i don du'o //
translated: The three aspirations beginning with the eighth are for the sake of one's own purification.

original: de la bsam pa gcig pa'i sbyor ba dang zhes pa ni theg pa gzhan la mi reg pas theg pa chen po la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bsam pa gcig pa'i sbyor ba dang zhes pa ni theg pa gzhan la mi reg pas theg pa chen po la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the application of single-pointed intention means to enter the Great Vehicle without touching other vehicles.

original: gzhan ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo la yang dag par gnas shing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las don yod par bya ba dang / mthong ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi chos gdon mi za bar thob par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo la yang dag par gnas shing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las don yod par bya ba dang / mthong ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi chos gdon mi za bar thob par bya ba dang /
translated: Likewise, it is to be perfectly established in the irreversible wheel and to practice the bodhisattva deeds, to make one’s physical, verbal, and mental actions meaningful, and to make one attain the Buddha’s qualities without fail as soon as one sees them.

original: @57a * // dbyangs brjod ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang ye shes khong du chud par bya ba dang / mthong ba'i de ma thag tu dad par 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa phyir bzlog par bya ba dang / rten sman gyi rgyal po chen po lta bu thob par bya ba dang /
analyzed: @57a * // dbyangs brjod ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang ye shes khong du chud par bya ba dang / mthong ba'i de ma thag tu dad par 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa phyir bzlog par bya ba dang / rten sman gyi rgyal po chen po lta bu thob par bya ba dang /
translated: It is to comprehend the power and wisdom of the Buddha as soon as one utters the melody, to have faith as soon as one sees, to turn away the afflictions, to attain the support that is like the king of great medicines,

original: lus yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu thob par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad spyad pa'i phyir zhes pa ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: lus yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu thob par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad spyad pa'i phyir zhes pa ni dgu pa'o //
translated: to attain a body that is like a wish-fulfilling jewel, and to practice all the bodhisattva deeds.

original: de la mthong ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum gyis lus kyi la sogs pa'i bya ba bstan no //
analyzed: de la mthong ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum gyis lus kyi la sogs pa'i bya ba bstan no //
translated: The three phrases beginning with “as soon as he sees them” indicate the activity of the body.

original: rang nyid sdug bsngal dang phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir sman gyi rgyal po chen po lta bu dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang nyid sdug bsngal dang phongs pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir sman gyi rgyal po chen po lta bu dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu zhes gsungs so //
translated: He is like a great king of physicians and like a wish-fulfilling gem, in that he frees himself and others from the suffering of being deprived of what is desirable.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i don du dang / byis pa'i lan gcig las ma log pa'i byis pa'i lam thams cad skye ba len pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i don du dang / byis pa'i lan gcig las ma log pa'i byis pa'i lam thams cad skye ba len pa dang /
translated: Similarly, he takes birth in all the worlds in order to fully awaken to highest genuine full Awakening, and in all the paths of the foolish who have not turned away from the one path of the foolish.

original: gzhon nu rol rtsed dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du 'jug pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi snying por gshegs pa dang / bdud btul ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: gzhon nu rol rtsed dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du 'jug pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / dka' ba spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi snying por gshegs pa dang / bdud btul ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang /
translated: the youthful play, the entry into the harem, the renunciation, the practice of austerities, the journey to the site of enlightenment, the subjugation of Mara, the full enlightenment,🔽the request, the setting in motion of the wheel of the great Dharma, and the demonstration of the great nirvana.

original: gsol ba 'debs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po bstan pa'i ched du sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul gyi mthu chen po dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i ched du chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pas rgya che ba dang /
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo chen po bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po bstan pa'i ched du sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul gyi mthu chen po dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i ched du chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pas rgya che ba dang /
translated: For the sake of the great power of the domain of the Buddha, and for the sake of following after the wisdom, it is vast, reaching to the limits of the realm of space.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa /
translated: It reaches to the end of the realm of nirvana.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'o //
translated: It reaches to the end of the future.

original: bskal pa'i grangs thams cad sangs rgyas grangs su 'byung ba la rgyun mi 'chad pa'i ye shes chen po mngon par zhen pa sgrub pa'i don du smon lam chen po 'debs pa ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa'i grangs thams cad sangs rgyas grangs su 'byung ba la rgyun mi 'chad pa'i ye shes chen po mngon par zhen pa sgrub pa'i don du smon lam chen po 'debs pa ni bcu pa'o //
translated: The tenth is the great vow which is made for the sake of accomplishing the great wisdom of uninterruptedness in the appearance of the Buddhas for all the enumerations of aeons as the number of Buddhas.

original: de la byis pa'i lam ni gdul bya byis pa rnams kyi gnas yin pas gtso bo'i dbang du byas nas byis pa'i lam ni 'dzam bu'i gling ngo //
analyzed: de la byis pa'i lam ni gdul bya byis pa rnams kyi gnas yin pas gtso bo'i dbang du byas nas byis pa'i lam ni 'dzam bu'i gling ngo //
translated: In this regard, the path of the childish is the abode of the disciples who are childish.

original: des na 'dzam bu'i gling gcig tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dus su 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ston @57b to zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na 'dzam bu'i gling gcig tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dus su 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par ston @57b to zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, at the time of perfect enlightenment in one Rose-Apple Land, he demonstrates perfect enlightenment in all Rose-Apple Lands.

original: mthu chen po ni 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu gdul bya sems can la bden pa ston pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: mthu chen po ni 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu gdul bya sems can la bden pa ston pa'i don du'o //
translated: The great power is for the sake of demonstrating the truth to the disciples, the sentient beings, in other world systems.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa'i rnam pas chos gcig mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'o zhes lhag par mos pas so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa'i rnam pas chos gcig mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'o zhes lhag par mos pas so //
translated: The one who follows wisdom is the one who, by the aspect of the selflessness of phenomena, has the superior understanding that all phenomena are naturally peaceful, through the realization of one phenomenon.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa rgya che ba ni gsung gcig brjod pas mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams kyis dus gcig tu rang rang gi sems la go bar byed pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa rgya che ba ni gsung gcig brjod pas mos pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams kyis dus gcig tu rang rang gi sems la go bar byed pas so //
translated: The one who is vast as the realm of totality is the one who, by uttering a single sound, causes all sentient beings, who have various understandings, to understand it in their own minds at the same time.

original: smon lam chen po bcu pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: smon lam chen po bcu pa bstan zin to //
translated: This concludes the explanation of the ten great vows.

original: sogs pa ni bcu po dang 'dra ba gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: sogs pa ni bcu po dang 'dra ba gzhan rnams so //
translated: The “etc.” refers to the other vows that are similar to the ten.

original: smon lam 'bum phrag grangs med pa phrag bcu po gang dag zhes pa la /
analyzed: smon lam 'bum phrag grangs med pa phrag bcu po gang dag zhes pa la /
translated: The “ten non-countable hundreds of thousands of vows” are the ones that are mentioned.

original: de la gcig ni gnas gcig go //
analyzed: de la gcig ni gnas gcig go //
translated: Among them, one is one place.

original: bcu ni gnas gnyis so //
analyzed: bcu ni gnas gnyis so //
translated: Ten is two places.

original: brgya ni gnas gsum mo //
analyzed: brgya ni gnas gsum mo //
translated: One hundred is three places.

original: de ltar bsgres pa'i bcu 'gyur du bsgres pa'i gnas drug cu par gang slebs pa de la grangs med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgres pa'i bcu 'gyur du bsgres pa'i gnas drug cu par gang slebs pa de la grangs med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The one that is reached by multiplying that by ten to the sixtieth place is called “non-countable.”

original: de lta bu'i smon lam 'bum phrag grangs med pa phrag bcu sa dang po rab tu dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpas 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i smon lam 'bum phrag grangs med pa phrag bcu sa dang po rab tu dga' ba'i byang chub sems dpas 'debs par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva on the first stage, the Joyous, makes ten times one hundred thousand countless such prayers.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang po bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang po bskyed pa'o //
translated: The first generation of the thought is the first supramundane generation of the thought.

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Those, etc.

original: gang yang dus gsum gshegs pa rgyal ba ni ;
analyzed: gang yang dus gsum gshegs pa rgyal ba ni ;
translated: The victors who have gone in the three times

original: / byang chub spyod pa'i smon lam bye brag rnams //
analyzed: / byang chub spyod pa'i smon lam bye brag rnams //
translated: the various prayers for the conduct of enlightenment

original: bzang por spyod pa byang chub sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: bzang por spyod pa byang chub sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: the good conduct, the enlightened buddhas,

original: de kun ma lus bdag gis rdzogs par bgyi //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i kun du bzang po'i smon lam gyi nang du smon lam 'di rnams 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: de kun ma lus bdag gis rdzogs par bgyi // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i kun du bzang po'i smon lam gyi nang du smon lam 'di rnams 'dus pa yin no //
translated: I will complete them all without exception.🔽In this way, these prayers are included in the prayer of Samantabhadra, which says, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir smon lam ma lus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smon lam ma lus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: That is why he says, all prayers, etc.

original: da ni nyan thos kyi theg par zhugs pa rnams kyi the tshom bsal bar bya ba'i phyir nyan thos kyis bstan pa'i sgo nas sa'i rnam par dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i don du de la ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni nyan thos kyi theg par zhugs pa rnams kyi the tshom bsal bar bya ba'i phyir nyan thos kyis bstan pa'i sgo nas sa'i rnam par dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i don du de la ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to remove the doubts of those who have entered the Śrāvaka Vehicle, in order to teach the divisions of the stages by way of teaching the Śrāvaka Vehicle, he says, “In that regard, how?”

original: de la nyan thos kyi theg par zhugs pa dang / 'bras bu lam la gnas pa'i dbye bas ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thob par bya ba'i don du sgrub par byed pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam la gnas pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: de la nyan thos kyi theg par zhugs pa dang / 'bras bu lam la gnas pa'i dbye bas ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa thob par bya ba'i don du sgrub par byed pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam la gnas pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: In that regard, those who have entered the Śrāvaka Vehicle and who abide on the path of the result, by way of the division of attaining the result of stream-enterer and so forth, practice in order to attain the result of stream-enterer and so forth.

original: 'di'i don ni nyan thos kyi lam 'dir 'dod chags dang / khong khro @58a * //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni nyan thos kyi lam 'dir 'dod chags dang / khong khro @58a * //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: In this Śrāvaka Vehicle, desire, anger,

original: dang ; nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom ste lnga dang / lta ba la yang sngar bstan pa'i rnam par dbye ba rnam pa lngar bya ste /
analyzed: dang ; nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom ste lnga dang / lta ba la yang sngar bstan pa'i rnam par dbye ba rnam pa lngar bya ste /
translated: pride, ignorance, and doubt, and also the views, are to be divided into five types, as previously explained.

original: bcur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bcur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus there are ten.

original: de yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, they are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and by the path of cultivation.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa bdun bdun ni kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa bdun bdun ni kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: In the desire realm, there are ten to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, seven to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin and seven to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, except for the afflicted view of the self, extreme view and clinging to rules and ritual as supreme.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba ma gtogs par nyon mongs pa gzhan brgyad ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba ma gtogs par nyon mongs pa gzhan brgyad ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Eight other afflictions, except for the afflicted view of the self and extreme view, are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams na bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams na bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Thus there are thirty two negative tendencies to be abandoned by seeing the four truths in the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams na bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khong khro'i rnam pa bzhi med pas bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khong khro'i rnam pa bzhi med pas bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa brgyad do //
translated: In the form realm, there are twenty-eight negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, since there are no four aspects of anger that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams na yang nyi shu rtsa brgyad yin pas khams gsum na mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad do //🔽'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams na yang nyi shu rtsa brgyad yin pas khams gsum na mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad do // 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa ste /
translated: Similarly, there are twenty-eight in the formless realm. Thus there are eighty-eight negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing in the three realms.

original: bzhi ni 'dod pa'i khams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bzhi ni 'dod pa'i khams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Four negative tendencies are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm: attachment, anger, pride and ignorance.

original: bzhi po de nyid la khong khro ba ma gtogs pa'i gsum ni gzugs kyi khams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi po de nyid la khong khro ba ma gtogs pa'i gsum ni gzugs kyi khams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Three of those four negative tendencies are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the form realm, except for anger.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams na yang gsum yin pas spang bar bya ba bcur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams na yang gsum yin pas spang bar bya ba bcur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, there are three in the formless realm. Thus there are ten objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de ltar bsdoms na phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bsdoms na phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, there are ninety-eight proclivities.

original: de ltar bsdoms nas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po ni mthong ba'i lam ste /🔽de yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba skad cig ma bcu drug go //
analyzed: de ltar bsdoms nas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po ni mthong ba'i lam ste / de yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba skad cig ma bcu drug go //
translated: The path of insight is the antidote to the proclivities that are abandoned by insight.🔽It is made up of sixteen thought-moments, distinguished according to the four noble truths.

original: de la khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa ni bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma bzhi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa ni bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma bzhi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The four noble truths are the noble truth of unsatisfactoriness, the noble truth of the origin of unsatisfactoriness, the noble truth of the cessation of unsatisfactoriness, and the noble truth of the path.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The noble truth of unsatisfactoriness is threefold:🔽unsatisfactoriness of the world of beings, unsatisfactoriness of the world of things, and unsatisfactoriness of the process of change.🔽The noble truth of the origin of unsatisfactoriness is threefold:🔽cause, effect, and the process of perpetuation.🔽The noble truth of the cessation of unsatisfactoriness is threefold:

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi brgya phrag bcu'i gnyen po mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa can 'dod pa na @58b spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi brgya phrag bcu'i gnyen po mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa can 'dod pa na @58b spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dmigs pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma ni dang po'o //
translated: cessation, emptiness, and the process of transcendence.🔽The noble truth of the path is threefold:🔽path, skill in means, and process of realization.

original: de la sngar med pa dang / phyis med pas mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de la sngar med pa dang / phyis med pas mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of impermanence is due to the fact that it is not existent before and does not exist later.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of suffering is due to the fact that it is not in accord with the noble ones because of the suffering of conditioned states.

original: nang gi bdag nyid can byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi skyes bu dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid can byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi skyes bu dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of emptiness is due to the fact that it is devoid of a person who is an inner self and who is an agent.

original: phung po rnams la bdag gi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: phung po rnams la bdag gi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of selflessness is due to the fact that the aggregates do not have the characteristics of a self.

original: rnam pa 'di rnams ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag gi ba dang / bdag tu lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di rnams ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag gi ba dang / bdag tu lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: These aspects should be understood as antidotes to the conduct of the views of permanence, happiness, purity, and a self.

original: de bzhin du dmigs pa dang rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni skad cig ma gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs pa dang rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can sdug bsngal la chos shes pa ni skad cig ma gnyis pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, which has the nature of the path of liberation and possesses just those focal objects and aspects, is the second moment.

original: de bzhin du khong khro ba ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa de rnams kho na gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas bco brgyad kyi gnyen po sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa can bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan🔽nyid can sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khong khro ba ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa de rnams kho na gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas bco brgyad kyi gnyen po sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa can bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni gsum pa'o //
translated: So too, the antidote to the eighteen negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin in the form and formless realms, except for anger, is the third moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, which has the aspect of suffering and so on and is characterized as the uninterrupted path.

original: de'i rnam pa dang dmigs pa can nyid kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma ni bzhi ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang dmigs pa can nyid kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma ni bzhi ba'o //
translated: The fourth moment is the subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, which has the aspect and focal object of the former and is characterized as the liberated path.🔽Just as there are four moments of perseverance and knowledge that comprehend the truth of suffering of the three realms, so too there are four moments of perseverance and knowledge that comprehend the truth of origin.

original: ji ltar khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rtogs pa la bzod pa dang / shes pa bzhi yod pa de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas bdun gyi rgyu dang ; kun 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: ji ltar khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rtogs pa la bzod pa dang / shes pa bzhi yod pa de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas bdun gyi rgyu dang ; kun 'byung ba dang /
translated: The first moment is perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin, which has the aspect of origin and is the antidote to the seven negative tendencies that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin in the desire realm.

original: rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa can 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung gi bden pa la dmigs pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni dang po'o //
analyzed: rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa can 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kun 'byung gi bden pa la dmigs pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni dang po'o //
translated: The first moment of the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to the origin, which has the nature of the uninterrupted path, is the aspect of origination and the aspect of condition.

original: de la 'du byed thams cad ni rgyu med pa yin no snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni rgyu'i gnyen po'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed thams cad ni rgyu med pa yin no snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni rgyu'i gnyen po'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of cause is the antidote to the view that all formations are causeless.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyu gcig bu'o snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni kun 'byung gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa rgyu gcig bu'o snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni kun 'byung gi rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of origination is the antidote to the view that there is a single cause such as Īśvara.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa ste /🔽sngar med pa 'byung ba @59a * //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa ste / sngar med pa 'byung ba @59a * //
translated: The aspect of origination is the antidote to the view that there is transformation.

original: rab tu skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rab tu skye ba yin gyi /
translated: The aspect of origination is the arising of what did not previously exist.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba ni ma yin pas so //
translated: It is not transformation.

original: blo sngon du 'gro ba'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: blo sngon du 'gro ba'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The antidote to the view and the action of those who are dominated by mind is the aspect of condition.

original: blo sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin pa'i phyir rkyen zhes brjod pas so //🔽de bzhin du dmigs pa dang / rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma ni gnyis pa'o //🔽de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na kun 'byung gi bden pa la dmigs pa bshad ma thag pa'i khong khro ma gtogs pa'i phra rgyas bcu gnyis kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: blo sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin pa'i phyir rkyen zhes brjod pas so // de bzhin du dmigs pa dang / rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma ni gnyis pa'o // de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa na kun 'byung gi bden pa la dmigs pa bshad ma thag pa'i khong khro ma gtogs pa'i phra rgyas bcu gnyis kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: It is called condition because it is not dominated by mind.🔽Similarly, the second moment is the Dharma knowledge of origin that has the same object and aspect as the liberated path.

original: de'i rnam pa dang ldan pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang ldan pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni gsum pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the third moment is the subsequent forbearance of origin that has the same aspect as the uninterrupted path and is the antidote to the twelve negative tendencies focusing on the truth of origin in the form and formless realms, excluding anger.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa'i kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma ni bzhi pa'o //🔽de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba phra rgyas bdun gyi gnyen po 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa la dmigs pa 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa'i kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma ni bzhi pa'o // de bzhin du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba phra rgyas bdun gyi gnyen po 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa la dmigs pa 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang /
translated: The moment of subsequent knowledge of origin that possesses that same focal object and aspect is the fourth moment.🔽Similarly, the antidote to the seven negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation in the desire realm is the moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation that focuses on the truth of cessation in the desire realm and possesses the aspects of cessation, peace, excellence, and definitive release.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni dang po'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first moment that has the nature of the uninterrupted path.

original: skye ba'i rgyu la thar pa med do snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni 'gog pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu la thar pa med do snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni 'gog pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of cessation is the antidote to the view that one who is the cause of birth is not liberated.

original: yul la nye bar longs spyod pa med pa'i phyir dbang po rnams nyams par 'gyur bas thar pa ni sdug bsngal ba'o snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni zhi ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yul la nye bar longs spyod pa med pa'i phyir dbang po rnams nyams par 'gyur bas thar pa ni sdug bsngal ba'o snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni zhi ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of peace is the antidote to the view that liberation is suffering, since the faculties deteriorate due to the absence of enjoyment of objects.

original: bsam gtan gyi bde ba kho na gya nom pa'o snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bde ba kho na gya nom pa'o snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni gya nom pa'o //
translated: The aspect of excellence is the antidote to the view that the bliss of the absorptions is excellent.

original: yang nas yang du nyams par gyur pas thar pa rten du ma yin no snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po rnams ni nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yang nas yang du nyams par gyur pas thar pa rten du ma yin no snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po rnams ni nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of definite emergence is the antidote to the view that liberation is not a refuge since it degenerates again and again.

original: dmigs pa dang / rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can sdug bsngal 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can sdug bsngal 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second moment is the moment of the Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation that possesses that same object and aspect of the liberated path.

original: rnam pa de nyid kyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i khong khro ba ma gtogs pa'i phra rgyas bcu gnyis kyi @59b gnyen po bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i🔽sdug bsngal 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid kyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i khong khro ba ma gtogs pa'i phra rgyas bcu gnyis kyi @59b gnyen po bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni gsum pa'o //
translated: By that same aspect, the fourth moment is the instant of subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation that is the path of liberation, which has the same focal object and aspect as the third moment and is the antidote to the twelve negative tendencies of the form and formless realms, except for anger.🔽The third moment is the instant of perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation that is the uninterrupted path, which has the same focal object and aspect as the second moment and is the antidote to the twelve negative tendencies of the form and formless realms.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth moment is the instant of subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation that is the path of liberation, which has the same focal object and aspect as the third moment and is the antidote to the twelve negative tendencies of the formless realm.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas brgyad kyi gnyen po lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa can 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam la dmigs pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni dang po'o //🔽de la lam med do snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni lam gyi sgom pa'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas brgyad kyi gnyen po lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa can 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam la dmigs pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni dang po'o // de la lam med do snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni lam gyi sgom pa'o ;
translated: So too, the antidote to the eight negative tendencies abandoned by seeing the truth of path that is the path leading to the cessation of suffering that is experienced in the desire realm is the path, the aspect of correctness, the aspect of accomplishment, and the aspect of definite release that focuses on the path leading to the cessation of suffering that is experienced in the desire realm. The first moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of path that has the defining characteristic of the uninterrupted path is the first moment.🔽The antidote to the view that the path does not exist is meditation on the path.

original: / lam ngan pa'o snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni rigs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: / lam ngan pa'o snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni rigs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the view that the path is bad is the aspect of correctness.

original: lam gzhan yang yod pa yin no snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni sgrub pa'i rnam pa ste de nyid nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gzhan yang yod pa yin no snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni sgrub pa'i rnam pa ste de nyid nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aspect of accomplishment is the antidote to the view that there are other paths.

original: lam yang ldog pa yin no snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: lam yang ldog pa yin no snyam pa'i lta ba la spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen po ni nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of definite deliverance is the antidote to the view that the path is reversible.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can lam la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can lam la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second moment is the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to the path, which has the same focal object and aspect as the liberated path.

original: rnam pa de nyid kyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam la dmigs par phra rgyas bcu bzhi'i gnyen po'i bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni gsum
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid kyis gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam la dmigs par phra rgyas bcu bzhi'i gnyen po'i bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig ma ni gsum
translated: The third moment is the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to the path, which has the same aspect and focuses on the path that is the antidote to the fourteen negative tendencies that focus on the truth of suffering in the desire and higher realms and that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: pa'o // skad cig ma bco lnga po 'di rnams la mthong ba'i lam zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'o // skad cig ma bco lnga po 'di rnams la mthong ba'i lam zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: These fifteen moments are called the path of seeing.

original: skad cig ma bco lnga po 'di rnams la gnas na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'i don du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //🔽dmigs pa dang rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma ni bzhi @60a * //
analyzed: skad cig ma bco lnga po 'di rnams la gnas na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa'i don du zhugs pa zhes bya'o // dmigs pa dang rnam pa de nyid dang ldan pa rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma ni bzhi @60a * //
translated: If one abides in these fifteen moments, one is called “entered into the result of stream enterer.”🔽The sixteenth moment is the path of liberation, having the same focal object and aspect as the previous uninterrupted path, and its aspect is the path that goes to the cessation of the suffering of the form and formless realms.

original: pa'o ; / de la skad cig ma bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / de la skad cig ma bcu drug pa'o //
translated: The four moments of subsequent knowledge of the path are the sixteenth moment.

original: de la gnas na rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas na rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Abiding in that, one is called a “stream enterer.”

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba phra rgyas rnam pa bcu po rnams sngar bzhin du sa re re la rnam pa dgu dgu yin pas rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig tu rnam par gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba phra rgyas rnam pa bcu po rnams sngar bzhin du sa re re la rnam pa dgu dgu yin pas rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa gcig tu rnam par gnas pa yin la /
translated: The eleven afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation are the ten types of branch afflictions and the view of the self.

original: rnam pa re re'i gnyen por gyur pa'i lam la bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin nyid du gnas pa yin pas zhugs pa dang 'bras bu'i rnam gzhag bya'o //🔽de la skad cig ma bcu drug la gnas pa'i 'phags pa la gang gi tshe bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa gcig nas brtsams te rnam pa lnga pa'i bar spangs par gyur na de'i tshe lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o
analyzed: rnam pa re re'i gnyen por gyur pa'i lam la bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin nyid du gnas pa yin pas zhugs pa dang 'bras bu'i rnam gzhag bya'o // de la skad cig ma bcu drug la gnas pa'i 'phags pa la gang gi tshe bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa gcig nas brtsams te rnam pa lnga pa'i bar spangs par gyur na de'i tshe lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o
translated: The path that is the antidote to each aspect abides as the nature of the uninterrupted and liberated paths, so the presentation of the approachers and abiders is made.🔽When āryas abiding in the sixteen moments abandon from one to five aspects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, they are called approachers to the result of once return.

original: // de nyid kyi phyir gang gi tshe sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa drug pa spangs pa de'i tshe lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: // de nyid kyi phyir gang gi tshe sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa drug pa spangs pa de'i tshe lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When they abandon the sixth aspect to be abandoned by the path of meditation, they are called once returners.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang gi tshe bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa bdun dang / brgyad pa spang bar gyur na de'i tshe phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang gi tshe bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa bdun dang / brgyad pa spang bar gyur na de'i tshe phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, when one abandons seven or eight stages of the mental afflictions abandoned by the path of cultivation, one is said to be “entering the result of non-returner.”

original: gang gi tshe de nyid bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa de'i tshe lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe de nyid kyi bsam gtan dang po'i rnam pa gcig spangs pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa de'i tshe lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o // gang gi tshe de nyid kyi bsam gtan dang po'i rnam pa gcig spangs pa nas brtsams te /
translated: When one abandons the ninth stage of the mental afflictions abandoned by the path of cultivation, one is said to be “a once-returner.”

original: srid rtse'i rnam pa brgyad pa'i bar spangs pa dang rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas na yang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: srid rtse'i rnam pa brgyad pa'i bar spangs pa dang rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas na yang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one abandons the first stage of the mental afflictions abandoned by the path of cultivation in the first meditative absorption and so on up to when one abandons the eighth stage of the mental afflictions abandoned by the path of cultivation in the summit of existence, and when one is abiding in the uninterrupted path that abandons the ninth stage of the mental afflictions abandoned by the path of cultivation, one is said to be “entering the result of arhatship.”

original: rnam pa dgu pa spangs nas rnam par grol ba'i lam la gnas na dgra bcom pa zhes brjod par bya'o//
analyzed: rnam pa dgu pa spangs nas rnam par grol ba'i lam la gnas na dgra bcom pa zhes brjod par bya'o//
translated: When one abandons the ninth stage of the mental afflictions abandoned by the path of cultivation and is abiding in the liberated path, one is said to be an “arhat.”

original: de ltar zhugs pa dang / 'bras bu'i lam la gnas pa'i dbye bas nyan thos kyis brgyad du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du theg pa chen por yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lam la gnas pa'i dbye ba la brten nas nyan thos kyis brgyad du rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du lam la
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa dang / 'bras bu'i lam la gnas pa'i dbye bas nyan thos kyis brgyad du rnam par gzhag par bya'o // de bzhin du theg pa chen por yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lam la gnas pa'i dbye ba la brten nas nyan thos kyis brgyad du rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du lam la
translated: Thus, the eightfold noble path is established as the path of seeing, and the path of seeing is established as eightfold by way of the divisions of the abiding in the path of result.🔽Similarly, in the Great Vehicle, the ten bodhisattva stages of the bodhisattvas are so.

original: brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa yang rnam pa bcur rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa yang rnam pa bcur rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Just as the eightfold noble path is established as eightfold by way of the divisions of abiding in the path, so the bodhisattva stages are established as tenfold by way of the divisions of abiding in the path.

original: des na theg pa chen po la som nyi za bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na theg pa chen po la som nyi za bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not doubt the Great Vehicle.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi sngar gyi gnas skabs dang 'dra ba nyid yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽yang @60b ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi sngar gyi gnas skabs dang 'dra ba nyid yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽yang @60b ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach that it is just like the previous state prior to the path of seeing, it says:🔽Again, just as the eightfold noble path is established as eightfold by way of the divisions of abiding in the path, so the bodhisattva stages are established as tenfold by way of the divisions of abiding in the path.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs skyes pa zhes bya ba ni drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gnas skabs gang las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs skyes pa zhes bya ba ni drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gnas skabs gang las skyes pa'o //
translated: “Arisen in the state of the aids to penetration” means arisen in the state of heat, summit, patience, and the supreme mundane state.

original: de la rim pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la rim pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The order is as follows:

original: bden pa mthong bar 'dod pas dang po so sor thar pa'i sdom pa bsrung bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: bden pa mthong bar 'dod pas dang po so sor thar pa'i sdom pa bsrung bar bya dgos so //
translated: One who desires to see the truths must first observe the vow of the pratimoksa.

original: de nas bden pa mthong ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos nyan par byed do //
analyzed: de nas bden pa mthong ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos nyan par byed do //
translated: Then he listens to the Dharma which is in conformity with the seeing of the truths.

original: thos nas phyin ci ma log par sems par byed do //
analyzed: thos nas phyin ci ma log par sems par byed do //
translated: Having heard it, he reflects on it without error.

original: bsams nas ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: bsams nas ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Having reflected on it, he applies himself to the cultivation of samadhi.

original: bsgom pa de yang 'du 'dzi dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa las dben na 'grub par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa de yang 'du 'dzi dang / mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa las dben na 'grub par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And that cultivation is accomplished by seclusion from worldly pursuits and from unwholesome thoughts.

original: de la grogs med par gnas pas na 'du 'dzis dben pa'o //
analyzed: de la grogs med par gnas pas na 'du 'dzis dben pa'o //
translated: Seclusion from worldly pursuits is to dwell without companions.

original: 'dod chags dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pas spangs pa ni mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pas dben pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pas spangs pa ni mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pas dben pa'o //
translated: The avoidance of the discursive thoughts of greed, ill-will, and violence is the avoidance of the discursive thoughts of the unwholesome.

original: dben pa gnyis po 'di yang gang la gya nom pa ma yin pa dang / mang po ma yin pa rnyed pas yid mi bde ba med pa dang / gya nom pa dang / mang po ma rnyed pa la 'dod pa med pa de la 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dben pa gnyis po 'di yang gang la gya nom pa ma yin pa dang / mang po ma yin pa rnyed pas yid mi bde ba med pa dang / gya nom pa dang / mang po ma rnyed pa la 'dod pa med pa de la 'grub pa yin no //
translated: And this twofold avoidance is accomplished by one who is not unhappy at not finding what is not excellent and not abundant, and who is not desirous of finding what is excellent and abundant.

original: de ltar bsgom pa'i snod du gyur pas dang po zhi gnas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i snod du gyur pas dang po zhi gnas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having become a vessel for meditation, one should first cultivate calming.

original: zhi gnas sgom pa la yang gang zag gnyis te /
analyzed: zhi gnas sgom pa la yang gang zag gnyis te /
translated: And there are two kinds of persons who cultivate calming.

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: Those who are greed-addicted and those who are discursive.

original: de la gang 'dod chags la spyod pa des mi sdug pa sgom pa'i sgo nas zhi gnas bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang 'dod chags la spyod pa des mi sdug pa sgom pa'i sgo nas zhi gnas bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Of these, the one who is greed-addicted should generate calming by means of the meditation on the foul.

original: gang rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa des dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba dran pas zhi gnas bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: gang rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa des dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba dran pas zhi gnas bskyed par bya ste /
translated: One who is engaged in discursive thought should generate tranquility by mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: mi sdug pa kha dog dang dbyibs la dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi spong sbas so //
analyzed: mi sdug pa kha dog dang dbyibs la dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi spong sbas so //
translated: This is not a remedy for the abandonment of discursive thought, because it has the form and color of the unattractive as its object.

original: de la mi sdug pa bsgom pa la gsum ste /
analyzed: de la mi sdug pa bsgom pa la gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of meditation on the unattractive:

original: las dang po ba dang / yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dang / yid la byed pa rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: las dang po ba dang / yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dang / yid la byed pa rdzogs pa'o //
translated: for the beginner, for one who has completed the training, and for one who has completed the mental attentions.

original: de la las dang po pa ni dang po nyid du lus kyi rkang pa'i mthe bong la sogs pa la dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la las dang po pa ni dang po nyid du lus kyi rkang pa'i mthe bong la sogs pa la dmigs pa yin la /
translated: The beginner first focuses on the toes and so on of the body.

original: phyis de nyid du rul zhing myags te ltung bar mos pa byas te /
analyzed: phyis de nyid du rul zhing myags te ltung bar mos pa byas te /
translated: Later, he imagines that they rot and decay and fall off.

original: rus par rnam par sbyong zhing rim gyis rang gi lus thams cad keng rus kyi rang bzhin du lta bar byed do //
analyzed: rus par rnam par sbyong zhing rim gyis rang gi lus thams cad keng rus kyi rang bzhin du lta bar byed do //
translated: He then imagines that the bones separate and gradually sees his entire body as the nature of a skeleton.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa la yang lhag par @61a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa la yang lhag par @61a * //
translated: In the same way, he imagines that the second,🔽and then the third,

original: mos par byas te /
analyzed: mos par byas te /
translated: and then the fourth,🔽and then the entire world, is filled with skeletons.

original: gtsug lag khang dang / kun dga' ra ba dang / grong dang / zhing gi rim gyis rgya mtsho'i mthas klas pa'i bar gyis gzhi rus pa'i keng rus kyis gang la mos pa 'phel bar bya ba'i don du mos par byed do //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang / kun dga' ra ba dang / grong dang / zhing gi rim gyis rgya mtsho'i mthas klas pa'i bar gyis gzhi rus pa'i keng rus kyis gang la mos pa 'phel bar bya ba'i don du mos par byed do //
translated: He visualizes the earth filled with skeletons as far as the ocean, and he increases his visualization in order to increase his interest.

original: yang sdud pa ni sems bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir bdag gcig pu kho na la rus pa'i keng rus su mos par byed do //
analyzed: yang sdud pa ni sems bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir bdag gcig pu kho na la rus pa'i keng rus su mos par byed do //
translated: In order to concentrate his mind, he reduces his visualization to a single skeleton.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni mi sdug pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni mi sdug pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the complete meditation on the loathsome.

original: 'di ni las dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni las dang po'o //
translated: This is the beginner’s practice.

original: de sems bsdus pa khyad par du bya ba'i phyir rus pa'i keng rus de las rkang pa'i rus pa rnams bor nas lhag ma yid la byed cing de bzhin du thod pa'i phyed por nas thod pa phyed kyi bar yid la byed pa 'di ni yongs su sbyang
analyzed: de sems bsdus pa khyad par du bya ba'i phyir rus pa'i keng rus de las rkang pa'i rus pa rnams bor nas lhag ma yid la byed cing de bzhin du thod pa'i phyed por nas thod pa phyed kyi bar yid la byed pa 'di ni yongs su sbyang
translated: In order to increase the concentration of his mind, he reduces his visualization to a single skeleton.

original: bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bar bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the practice of purification.

original: de thod pa phyed kyang bor nas smin ma gnyis kyi bar du sems 'dzin par byed pa 'di ni mi sdug pa yid la byed pa rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa yin no //
analyzed: de thod pa phyed kyang bor nas smin ma gnyis kyi bar du sems 'dzin par byed pa 'di ni mi sdug pa yid la byed pa rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa yin no //
translated: The yogin who has completed the meditation on the impurity of the body is one who, having discarded the notion of the skull, fixes his mind between the two eyebrows.🔽Mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation is the mindfulness of the air that enters and leaves the body.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba dran pa ni gang rlung nang du 'jug pa ni dbugs rngub pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba dran pa ni gang rlung nang du 'jug pa ni dbugs rngub pa'o //
translated: Inhalation is the air that enters the body.

original: rlung 'byung ba gang yin pa ni dbugs 'byin pa ste /🔽de dag dran pa'o //🔽de ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin du zin kyang dran pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rlung 'byung ba gang yin pa ni dbugs 'byin pa ste / de dag dran pa'o // de ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin du zin kyang dran pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Exhalation is the air that leaves the body.🔽The mindfulness of that is called mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //🔽dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba de yang bgrang ba la sogs pa rnam pa drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro // dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba de yang bgrang ba la sogs pa rnam pa drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: Although it is by nature wisdom, it is called mindfulness because it functions by the power of mindfulness.🔽That inhalation and exhalation is sixfold: counting, following, fixing, observing, transforming, and purifying.

original: bgrang ba dang / rjes su bgrang ba dang / 'jog pa dang / nye bar 'jog pa dang / bsgyur ba dang / yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: bgrang ba dang / rjes su bgrang ba dang / 'jog pa dang / nye bar 'jog pa dang / bsgyur ba dang / yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Counting is the practice of counting from one to six, following is the practice of following the air in its course, fixing is the practice of fixing the mind on the tip of the nose or on the upper lip, observing is the practice of observing the air as it enters and leaves the body, transforming is the practice of transforming the air into fire and burning the body, and purifying is the practice of purifying the body by the remaining water.

original: de la bgrang ba ni dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dag la sems btang nas mngon par 'du bya ba med par lus dang sems rnal du bzhag ste /
analyzed: de la bgrang ba ni dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba dag la sems btang nas mngon par 'du bya ba med par lus dang sems rnal du bzhag ste /
translated: Counting is when the mind is placed on the inhalation and exhalation of the breath, and the body and mind are settled in their natural condition without any effort.

original: dran pa tsam gyis gcig dang gnyis nas bcu'i bar du bgrang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa tsam gyis gcig dang gnyis nas bcu'i bar du bgrang bar byed pa ste /
translated: With mere mindfulness, one counts from one to ten.

original: sems mngon par sdud pa dang / rnam par g-yeng bar dogs pas ha cang mang ba dang / nyung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems mngon par sdud pa dang / rnam par g-yeng bar dogs pas ha cang mang ba dang / nyung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: One does not count too many or too few, for fear of drawing the mind inward or of distraction.

original: de la dang po dbugs rngub pa bgrang zhing phyis 'byung ba dran par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang po dbugs rngub pa bgrang zhing phyis 'byung ba dran par bya'o //
translated: First, one counts the inhalations, and later one remembers the exhalations.

original: de la skyon ni gsum yod de /🔽gal te gnyis la gcig tu 'dzin na ma tshang bar bgrang ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: de la skyon ni gsum yod de / gal te gnyis la gcig tu 'dzin na ma tshang bar bgrang ba'i skyon no //
translated: There are three faults in this.🔽If one takes two for one, there is the fault of an incomplete count.

original: gal te gcig la gnyis su 'dzin na ni lhag par bgrang ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: gal te gcig la gnyis su 'dzin na ni lhag par bgrang ba'i skyon no //
translated: If one takes one for two, there is the fault of an excessive count.

original: gal te dbugs rngub pha la 'byung bar 'dzin tam /
analyzed: gal te dbugs rngub pha la 'byung bar 'dzin tam /
translated: If one takes an inhalation for an exhalation,

original: dbugs 'byin pa la rngub par 'dzin na 'tshol bar bgrang @61b pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa la rngub par 'dzin na 'tshol bar bgrang @61b pa'i skyon no //
translated: or an exhalation for an inhalation, there is the fault of a misplaced count.

original: de las gzhan pa ni yang dag pa'i bgrang ba yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni yang dag pa'i bgrang ba yin no //
translated: The other is right counting.

original: bar skabs su sems rnam par g-yeng na'ang mgo nas ji srid du ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du bgrang bar bya'o //🔽rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ji srid cig tu 'byung ngam 'jug / ci 'di dag lus thams cad la khyab pa dag cig gam /
analyzed: bar skabs su sems rnam par g-yeng na'ang mgo nas ji srid du ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du bgrang bar bya'o // rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ji srid cig tu 'byung ngam 'jug / ci 'di dag lus thams cad la khyab pa dag cig gam /
translated: If the mind is distracted in the middle, one should begin again from the beginning and count until one attains concentration.🔽Following means following the inhalation and exhalation without mental construction, thinking, “How far do these go? How far do they extend? Do they extend throughout the whole body?

original: phyogs 'ga' zhig na rgyu ba dag cig yin zhes mngon par 'du bya ba med par dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba'i rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' zhig na rgyu ba dag cig yin zhes mngon par 'du bya ba med par dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung ba'i rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: Or do they move in one place?”

original: de 'jug pa na lkog ma dang / snying ga dang / lte ba dang / rked pa dang / brla dang / byin par 'jug pa ni rim gyis rkang pa gnyis kyi bar du rjes su 'gro la /
analyzed: de 'jug pa na lkog ma dang / snying ga dang / lte ba dang / rked pa dang / brla dang / byin par 'jug pa ni rim gyis rkang pa gnyis kyi bar du rjes su 'gro la /
translated: When they enter, they enter the throat, heart, navel, waist, thighs, and calves, and go down to the feet.

original: 'byung ba na mtho gang dang / 'dom gang ni bar du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ba na mtho gang dang / 'dom gang ni bar du 'byung ngo //
translated: When they exit, they go out a distance of one hand-span or one fathom.

original: gzhan dag na re rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / rnam par 'thor byed kyi rlung gi bar du'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang / rnam par 'thor byed kyi rlung gi bar du'o zhes zer te /
translated: Others say: from the wind maṇḍala up to the wind that scatters at the end of an eon.

original: 'di ni de kho na nyid yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //🔽'jog pa zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i thag pa bzhin du sna'i rtse mo nas rkang pa'i mthe bo'i bar du gnas par lta zhing ci 'di dag phan 'dogs par byed pa zhig gam /
analyzed: 'di ni de kho na nyid yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no // 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i thag pa bzhin du sna'i rtse mo nas rkang pa'i mthe bo'i bar du gnas par lta zhing ci 'di dag phan 'dogs par byed pa zhig gam /
translated: This is not correct, because it is the attention of reality.

original: gnod par byed pa zhig gam /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa zhig gam /
translated: Placing means to look at the body as if it were a rope of jewels, from the tip of the nose to the toes, and to investigate whether it is beneficial or harmful,

original: grang ngam dro ba dag cig ces rtog pa'o //🔽nye bar rtog pa ni 'di dag ni rlung 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: grang ngam dro ba dag cig ces rtog pa'o // nye bar rtog pa ni 'di dag ni rlung 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: whether it is cold or hot.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po 'di dag kyang 'byung ba dag la mngon par grub pas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / de dag las byung ba sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang yod do zhes phung po lngar nye bar brtag par byed pa'o //
