analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po 'di dag kyang 'byung ba dag la mngon par grub pas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / de dag las byung ba sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang yod do zhes phung po lngar nye bar brtag par byed pa'o //
translated: Investigating means to investigate the five aggregates, thinking: These are not just wind, but also the four great elements, and form derived from the great elements, and also mind and mental factors that arise from them.

original: bsgyur ba zhis pa ni rlung la dmigs pa'i blo sgyur te /
analyzed: bsgyur ba zhis pa ni rlung la dmigs pa'i blo sgyur te /
translated: Transformation is the transformation of the mind that observes the breath.

original: chos kyi mchog gi bar du gong nas gong du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la yang dag par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog gi bar du gong nas gong du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la yang dag par spyod pa'o //
translated: One practices the roots of virtue more and more, up to the supreme mundane state.

original: yongs su dag pa ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Purification is entry into the path of seeing and so on.

original: gzhan dag na re bsgyur ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bsgyur ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar yin la /
translated: Others say: Transformation is from the applications of mindfulness up to the vajra like concentration.

original: rnam par dag pa ni zad pa shes pa la sogs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni zad pa shes pa la sogs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Purification is the knowledge of elimination and so on.

original: de ltar mi sdug pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba dran pa bsgoms nas zhi gnas rdzogs pas lhag mthong bsgrub par bya ba'i don du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi sdug pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba dran pa bsgoms nas zhi gnas rdzogs pas lhag mthong bsgrub par bya ba'i don du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Thus, having cultivated the meditation on the unpleasant and mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation, one should cultivate the applications of mindfulness in order to accomplish insight by perfecting serenity.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, and the faculties.

original: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni @62a * //
analyzed: de la lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni @62a * //
translated: The application of mindfulness of the body is

original: lus la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: One practices with regard to the body by way of its own-character and its general character.

original: de la lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The own-character of the body is the elements and the derivative of the elements.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //🔽tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni tshor ba la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o // tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni tshor ba la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas spyod pa'o //
translated: The general character is impermanence, etc.🔽One practices with regard to feeling by way of its own-character and its general character.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The own-character of feeling is the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //🔽sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni sems la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o // sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni sems la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas spyod pa'o //
translated: The general character is impermanence, etc.🔽One practices with regard to the mind by way of its own-character and its general character.

original: de la sems kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni yul la so sor rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni yul la so sor rig pa'o //
translated: The own-character of the mind is the awareness of objects.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The general character is impermanence, etc.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni chos la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas spyod pa'o //
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni chos la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas spyod pa'o //
translated: The application of mindfulness to the dharmas is the practice with regard to the dharmas by way of their own characteristics and general characteristics.

original: de la chos ni 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos ni 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: Therein, the dharmas are the aggregate of perception, the aggregate of formation, non-informative form, space, analytical cessation, and non-analytical cessation.

original: de rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni mdzod las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni mdzod las shes par bya'o //
translated: Their own characteristics should be understood from the Abhidharma.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi stong pa dang / bdag med pa nyid do ;
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi stong pa dang / bdag med pa nyid do ;
translated: The general characteristics are the impermanence of all conditioned things, the emptiness and selflessness of all dharmas.

original: / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa 'di yang thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin can nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa 'di yang thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi rang bzhin can nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: This application of mindfulness should be understood as having the nature of the wisdom that arises from hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: gang gi tshe chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas lus la sogs pa rgyun gyi mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa bzhir lta ba de'i tshe drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas lus la sogs pa rgyun gyi mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa bzhir lta ba de'i tshe drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang /
translated: When one sees the body and so on as impermanent, painful, empty and selfless through the close placement of mindfulness of phenomena, one attains the four stages of heat, peak, acceptance and🔽

original: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog gi rang bzhin can nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog gi rang bzhin can nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye ba yin no //
translated: When one sees the body, etc., as impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial through the application of mindfulness to the factors of existence, then the factors conducive to penetration arise, which are of the nature of heat, summit, patience, and the highest mundane experience.

original: de thams cad kyang shes rab kyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de thams cad kyang shes rab kyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: All of these are of the nature of wisdom.

original: dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'o //
translated: Their object is the four noble truths.

original: rnam pa ni bcu drug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa ni bcu drug ste /
translated: Their aspects are the sixteen,

original: de rnams kyang sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de rnams kyang sngar bstan zin to //
translated: which have already been explained.

original: de la bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / chen po'i chen po'i dbye ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa la dmigs pa'i shes rab la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / chen po'i chen po'i dbye ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Therein, the wisdom that has the truths for its object is of four types, distinguished as small, middling, great, and great-great.

original: de la chung ni drod do //
analyzed: de la chung ni drod do //
translated: Heat is the small.

original: 'bring ni rtse mo'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni rtse mo'o //
translated: The summit is the middling.

original: chen po ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: chen po ni bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is the great.

original: chen po'i chen po ni chos @62b kyi mchog go //
analyzed: chen po'i chen po ni chos @62b kyi mchog go //
translated: The great of the great is the supreme quality.

original: de ltar nyan thos kyis nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skyes su zin kyang ji srid du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma skyes pa de srid du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyan thos kyis nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skyes su zin kyang ji srid du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma skyes pa de srid du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, even though the sravaka has already produced the aids to penetration, as long as the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering has not arisen, he should not be called one who has entered the result of stream-enterer.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'gyur ba yin te zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma skyes na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'gyur ba yin te zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ma skyes na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: And so it is for the bodhisattva, he should not be called one who has entered the result of stream-enterer as long as the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering has not arisen.

original: des na theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no snyam pa'i som nyi za bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no snyam pa'i som nyi za bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not doubt that the Mahayana is not the word of the Buddha.

original: don de nyid la dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid la dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of this meaning in the Ratnamegha-sutra,

original: dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, in the Ratnamegha-sutra, etc.

original: mos pa chen po'i yang chen pos spyod pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: mos pa chen po'i yang chen pos spyod pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs so //
translated: The phrase “with a very great degree of devotion” refers to the state of the supreme mundane state.

original: de'i chos nyid ni de kho na nyid la shin tu lhag par mos pas don 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba mi snang ba'i ye shes kyi snang ba 'grub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i chos nyid ni de kho na nyid la shin tu lhag par mos pas don 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba mi snang ba'i ye shes kyi snang ba 'grub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the nature of that” refers to the attainment of the light of the wisdom that is free of the distraction that consists of the apprehension of objects, due to the superior devotion to reality.

original: sa dang po de ma thag tu thob par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs ni sa dang po'i bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dang po de ma thag tu thob par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs ni sa dang po'i bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “immediately upon attaining that first stage” refers to the state of the supreme mundane state, because it is included within the uninterrupted path of the first stage.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems ma skyes pa'i sa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems ma skyes pa'i sa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The phrase “this is the bodhisattva’s stage of the enlightenment mind that has not yet arisen” means that the patience that is the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, etc., have not yet arisen.

original: de'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa ma yin pas byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa ma yin pas byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because he is not a stream-enterer, etc., the bodhisattva is not a result.

original: zhes gsungs pa de 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa de 'thad pa yin no //
translated: This is the correct explanation.

original: de ni rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this extensively, he says,

original: mos pas spyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of action in faith, etc.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i skad cig de la gnas pa yang zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs kyi mos pa chen po'i yang chen po'i skad cig ma la gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i skad cig de la gnas pa yang zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs kyi mos pa chen po'i yang chen po'i skad cig ma la gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of action in faith is in the moment of the supreme mundane state, in the moment of the great of the great faith.

original: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dpe bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this by way of an example, he says,

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this, etc.

original: mi'i mdog las ni 'das la zhes bya ba ni mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i gser gyi kha dog dang ldan pa yin pas so //
analyzed: mi'i mdog las ni 'das la zhes bya ba ni mtshan bzang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i gser gyi kha dog dang ldan pa yin pas so //
translated: He has surpassed the human stage, because he has the color of gold, endowed with the thirty-two auspicious signs.

original: lha'i mdog ni ma thob pa yin te zhes bya ba ni lha'i kha dog dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i mdog ni ma thob pa yin te zhes bya ba ni lha'i kha dog dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But he has not yet attained the divine stage, because he does not have the color of the gods.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po la @63a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po la @63a * //
translated: Mundane, sravakas, and pratyekabuddhas refers to the first absorption.🔽

original: sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i sa dang / sngar bstan pa'i nyan thos kyi sa brgyad dang / gang la gzung ba mi dmigs pa'i ye shes 'byung ba rang sangs rgyas kyi sa rnams so //
analyzed: sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i sa dang / sngar bstan pa'i nyan thos kyi sa brgyad dang / gang la gzung ba mi dmigs pa'i ye shes 'byung ba rang sangs rgyas kyi sa rnams so //
translated: The phrase “mundane, śrāvaka, and pratyekabuddha” refers to the mundane levels of the first meditative concentration and so forth, the eight śrāvaka levels that were presented earlier, and the pratyekabuddha levels, on which the gnosis that does not objectify the apprehended occurs.

original: shin tu 'das la zhes pa ni 'di rnams byang chub kyi sems dang / snying rje la sogs pa zil gyis mnan nas gnas pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu 'das la zhes pa ni 'di rnams byang chub kyi sems dang / snying rje la sogs pa zil gyis mnan nas gnas pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “far beyond” means that these levels are surpassed by the levels of the bodhisattva, which are characterized by the awakening mind and compassion.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni ma thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gis chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba de ni don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa yin la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni ma thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gis chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mthong ba de ni don dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa yin la /
translated: The phrase “the ultimate bodhisattva levels have not been attained” means that the ultimate bodhisattva levels are those on which the suchness of all phenomena is seen.

original: de yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is to be understood as referring to the acceptance of the truth of suffering.

original: 'dis ni chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa nyid ma yin par rgyas par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa nyid ma yin par rgyas par brjod pa yin no //
translated: This passage extensively explains that at the time of the supreme mundane state, one is not an enterer to the fruit of stream-entry.

original: de ltar sa dang pos bsdus pa'i sems bskyed pa dang po'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sa dang pos bsdus pa'i sems bskyed pa dang po'i mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the definition of the first generation of the mind of enlightenment included in the first stage,

original: yon tan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach its qualities,

original: yang gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Moreover, when,” and so on.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: “When” means at the time of the forbearance of the understanding of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: de nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems bskyed pa dang po nas brtsams nas so //🔽de ni zhes bya ba ni ye shes thob pa'o ;
analyzed: de nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sems bskyed pa dang po nas brtsams nas so // de ni zhes bya ba ni ye shes thob pa'o ;
translated: “From then on” means beginning from the first generation of the mind of enlightenment that has the nature of the forbearance of the understanding of the dharma with regard to suffering.🔽“Then” means having attained the gnosis.

original: / de thob gyur pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa mngon du byed pa'i ye shes thob pas so //
analyzed: / de thob gyur pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa mngon du byed pa'i ye shes thob pas so //
translated: “The stage of having attained that” means having attained the gnosis that realizes the ultimate.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la byang chub kyi sgra ni rtogs par bya ba'i stong pa nyid la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la byang chub kyi sgra ni rtogs par bya ba'i stong pa nyid la brjod par bya'o //
translated: The term “bodhisattva” is to be analyzed as follows: the term “bodhi” is to be understood as emptiness, which is the object of realization.

original: sems dpa' ni de la dmigs pa gang la yod pa de'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni de la dmigs pa gang la yod pa de'o //
translated: The term “sattva” is that which has as its object that emptiness.

original: don dam pa'i ye shes thob pas stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes thob pas stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the attainment of ultimate wisdom, emptiness is the object.

original: de la 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says,

original: sems de thob pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems de thob pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “The attainment of that mind” and so on.

original: sems de thob pa ni zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i sems de thob pa'o //
analyzed: sems de thob pa ni zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i sems de thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of that mind is the attainment of the ultimate mind.

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pa'i gnas skabs su zhes pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pa'i gnas skabs su zhes pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa las 'das pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: The state of having transcended the stage of ordinary beings is the state of having transcended the stage of devoted engagement.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'i sgras brjod par bya ba ma yin pas so //
translated: It is not by any other means is not to be expressed by the term “ordinary being.”

original: de'i tshe zhes pa ni sems bskyed pa dang po thob pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes pa ni sems bskyed pa dang po thob pa'i dus su'o //
translated: At that time is at the time of attaining the first generation of the mind.

original: de zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa dang po thob pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa dang po thob pa'o //
translated: “He” refers to one who has attained the first generation of the Thought.

original: 'phags pa yin no zhes bya @63b ba ni so so'i skye bo'i sa las ring du song ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa yin no zhes bya @63b ba ni so so'i skye bo'i sa las ring du song ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “He is a Saint” means that he has gone far from the stage of the common man.

original: sems bskyed pa dang po thob pa'i gnas skabs su byang chub sems dpa'i sgra kho nas brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa dang po thob pa'i gnas skabs su byang chub sems dpa'i sgra kho nas brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In the situation of attaining the first generation of the Thought, he is to be called by the name Bodhisattva. In order to show the source of the Perfection of Wisdom Sutras,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “As it is said,” etc.

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni gang la chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs pa'i bsam pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni gang la chos thams cad rang bzhin med par rtogs pa'i bsam pa yod pa'o //
translated: “The Bodhisattva who has realized” is one who has the intention of realizing that all things are without own-being.

original: tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
analyzed: tshig bla dags zhes bya ba ni ming ngo //
translated: “The appellation” is the name.

original: de nyid gsal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make that clear, he says,

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “By whom,” etc.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas so //
translated: “By whom” means by the Bodhisattva.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dag go //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dag go //
translated: “All phenomena” refers to the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: rjes su rtogs shing zhes pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs shing zhes pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: “Realizes” means knows.

original: so so'i skye bos kyang chos thams cad shes pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: so so'i skye bos kyang chos thams cad shes pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since ordinary beings also know all phenomena,

original: ji ltar shes she na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the root text asks, “How does he know?”

original: lan ni ma byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lan ni ma byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The answer is “not arisen” and so on.

original: rgyu re re la mi skye yang tshogs pa las skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu re re la mi skye yang tshogs pa las skye'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that things do not arise from each of the causes but arise from the collection of causes,

original: yang dag par byung ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang dag par byung ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the root text says “not truly arisen.”

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las kyang ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa las kyang ma byung ba'o //
translated: Things do not arise even from the collection of causes and conditions.

original: ji ltar mi skye ba de slob dpon gyis le'u drug pa las 'chad par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mi skye ba de slob dpon gyis le'u drug pa las 'chad par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: How they do not arise will be explained by the master in chapter 6.

original: gang gi phyir yang dag par mi 'byung ba de'i phyir log pa dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag par mi 'byung ba de'i phyir log pa dang zhes smos so //
translated: Since they do not truly arise, the root text says “not ceased.”

original: de bshad pa ni de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The explanation of that is “those” and so on.

original: byis pa rnams ni blun zhing thos pa dang mi ldan pas so //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni blun zhing thos pa dang mi ldan pas so //
translated: Since childish beings are ignorant and lack learning,

original: so so'i skye bo ni bden pa ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni bden pa ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The ordinary person is one who has not seen the truth.

original: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo chos rnams bden pa gnyis brtags pa de ltar ma yin pas log pa nyid yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo chos rnams bden pa gnyis brtags pa de ltar ma yin pas log pa nyid yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is not as the childish, ordinary person imagines things, by imputing the two truths. This is the meaning of “false.”

original: rnyed pa de ltar ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bos bden pa rnyed pa de ltar ma yin par zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnyed pa de ltar ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bos bden pa rnyed pa de ltar ma yin par zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is not as it is found, means: it is not as the childish, ordinary person finds the truth.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad yongs su ma byung ba'i rang bzhin yongs su mkhyen pa la byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad yongs su ma byung ba'i rang bzhin yongs su mkhyen pa la byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called a bodhisattva, means: he is called a bodhisattva because he fully knows the nature of the non-arising of all things.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la byang chub ces brjod cing dngos por gyur pa rnams ci'i phyir byang chub ma yin snyam nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid la byang chub ces brjod cing dngos por gyur pa rnams ci'i phyir byang chub ma yin snyam nas /
translated: Since enlightenment is said to be the emptiness of all things, why is it not enlightenment when things exist?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can byang chub yin pa de ci'i phyir zhes pa'o //🔽de la lan ni byang chub @64a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can byang chub yin pa de ci'i phyir zhes pa'o // de la lan ni byang chub @64a * //
translated: The nature of emptiness is enlightenment. Why is that?

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The answer is stated in the line beginning “Enlightenment is not a thing,” and so forth.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: Non-conceptual is not the domain of conceptualization.

original: ma bsgrubs pa ni rnam par rtog pas ma bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsgrubs pa ni rnam par rtog pas ma bskyod pa'o //
translated: Non-accomplished is not shaken by conceptualization.

original: dmigs pa med pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin pas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin pas so //
translated: Non-apprehended is not the domain of conceptual consciousness.

original: rnyed pa med pa nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnyed pa med pa nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the non-apprehension in an extensive way, the line beginning “Subhūti,” and so forth, is stated.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: “Subhūti” is a Tibetan word.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni byang chub brnyes pa med de zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni byang chub brnyes pa med de zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata does not apprehend enlightenment is the statement of the probandum.

original: chos thams cad ma brnyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma brnyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: Because all phenomena are non-apprehended is the reason.

original: 'dir yang dngos po'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin byang chub brnyes pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba yin la chos thams cad ma brnyes pa ni spyi'i gtan tshigs su bkod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos po'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin byang chub brnyes pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba yin la chos thams cad ma brnyes pa ni spyi'i gtan tshigs su bkod pa'o //
translated: Here, the attainment of enlightenment, which is the nature of a particular entity, is what is to be established, while the non-attainment of all phenomena is stated as the general reason.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa la sogs pa gsum po bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa la sogs pa gsum po bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the three, non-examination, etc.,

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “All phenomena, etc.”

original: gal te thams cad rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes pas dmigs par gyur na de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid dang / rnam par rtog pas bsgrubs pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid du gyur pa'i byang chub 'grub par 'gyur ba yin pa las de med pa'i phyir de yang med pa'o //
analyzed: gal te thams cad rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes pas dmigs par gyur na de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid dang / rnam par rtog pas bsgrubs pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid du gyur pa'i byang chub 'grub par 'gyur ba yin pa las de med pa'i phyir de yang med pa'o //
translated: If everything were the object of a conceptual or non-conceptual cognition, then at that time, enlightenment would be established as the object of conceptual cognition and as the object of non-conceptual cognition, but since that does not exist, it does not exist.

original: 'dir yang spyi grub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir yang spyi grub par byed pa yin la /
translated: Here, the general is established,

original: bye brag bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: but the particular is to be established.

original: ma brnyes pa dang ma dmigs pa de yang /🔽rang las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: ma brnyes pa dang ma dmigs pa de yang / rang las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: And that which is not found and not observed🔽is not from itself, not from another,🔽

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin dkag pa tsam gyis grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin dkag pa tsam gyis grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: That non-acquisition and non-observation is established by the mere negation of the intrinsic reality of things, as in “not from itself, not from another,” and so on.🔽That is called the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: de ltar bu ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ces bya ba ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid kho na la byang chub ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bu ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ces bya ba ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid kho na la byang chub ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: That is called enlightenment.🔽It is not as it is expressed.

original: ji skad brjod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rnam par rtog pas dngos po nyid du brtags nas brjod pa de lta bu ni byang chub ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rnam par rtog pas dngos po nyid du brtags nas brjod pa de lta bu ni byang chub ma yin no //
translated: It is not enlightenment as it is expressed by conceptualization, having imagined it to be a real thing.

original: de ltar byang chub stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bsgrubs nas byang chub dngos po nyid du khas len pa la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa snos te /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bsgrubs nas byang chub dngos po nyid du khas len pa la skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa snos te /
translated: Having thus established enlightenment as having the nature of emptiness, which is the non-observation of all phenomena, in order to show the fault in asserting that enlightenment is a real thing, [the Buddha] declares, “Subhūti, if a bodhisattva great being were to think, ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment and liberate sentient beings from cyclic existence,’ he would not be a bodhisattva.”

original: sems 'di byang chub tu bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang @64b chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rnam par bstan no //
analyzed: sems 'di byang chub tu bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang @64b chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rnam par bstan no //
translated: The phrase we should generate this mind for enlightenment indicates the generation of the mind of enlightenment.

original: gang du bdag cag ges zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub la mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang du bdag cag ges zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub la mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa yin te /
translated: The phrase wherever we might go and so on indicates the nature of attachment to enlightenment.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rlom pas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rlom pas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi byang chub sems dpa' med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase they are not called bodhisattvas means that because of the non-existence of a bodhisattva who is characterized by emptiness, all things which are the objects of the conceit of attachment to real substance do not exist.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one were to ask, What is a bodhisattva?

original: ji skad du brjod ce na /🔽lan ni de dag gis sems dpa' skye ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji skad du brjod ce na / lan ni de dag gis sems dpa' skye ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: what is the reply?🔽The phrase they are called 'generative minds' is the reply.

original: 'di dag la dngos po la mngon par zhen pa dang bcas pa'i bsam pa skyes pa'i phyir sems skye ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la dngos po la mngon par zhen pa dang bcas pa'i bsam pa skyes pa'i phyir sems skye ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because the mind which is generated in them is accompanied by the intention of attachment to real substance, it is called the generation of the mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa dang bcas pa'i bsam pa skye ba ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa dang bcas pa'i bsam pa skye ba ci'i phyir zhe na'o //
translated: Why is that? means “why does the thought that is accompanied by manifest clinging arise?”

original: de la lan ni 'di ltar skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la lan ni 'di ltar skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The answer to that is “because it arises in this way” and so on.

original: de la skye ba dang sems la mngon par zhen pa ni gong du bstan pa'i sems 'di byang chub tu bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'i tshig gis bstan no //
analyzed: de la skye ba dang sems la mngon par zhen pa ni gong du bstan pa'i sems 'di byang chub tu bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'i tshig gis bstan no //
translated: Therein, the manifest clinging to arising and mind is taught by the phrase “this mind should generate enlightenment.”

original: byang chub la mngon par zhen pa ni byang chub de ni yod do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan no //
analyzed: byang chub la mngon par zhen pa ni byang chub de ni yod do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan no //
translated: The manifest clinging to enlightenment is taught by the phrase “that enlightenment exists.”

original: gal te byang chub dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pas de la mngon par zhen pa la skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pas de la mngon par zhen pa la skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: If enlightenment has the nature of an entity, what is wrong with manifest clinging to it?

original: de la lan ni yang byang chub ni mtshan nyid med pa ste zhes bya ba smos te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la lan ni yang byang chub ni mtshan nyid med pa ste zhes bya ba smos te bstan pa'o //
translated: The answer to that is “enlightenment is without characteristics” and so on.

original: de bshad pa ni mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: That is explained by “it is free from the nature of characteristics.”

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: gang gis 'di ltar rjes su rtogs pa de ni byang chub ces bya'i zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa nyid du rtogs pa de la byang chub ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'di ltar rjes su rtogs pa de ni byang chub ces bya'i zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa nyid du rtogs pa de la byang chub ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Whoever realizes this is called ‘awakened’” means that the realization of all phenomena as devoid of characteristics should be called “awakening.”

original: rtogs pa de yang chos thams cad dmigs pa med pa de nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs pa de yang chos thams cad dmigs pa med pa de nyid do //
translated: That realization is precisely the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: yang ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: yang ji skad du brjod pa bzhin du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin no //
translated: “However, it is not as it is expressed” means as before.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming gi mdor bsdus te bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming gi mdor bsdus te bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the concise meaning of the name “bodhisattva,”

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa chos de rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa chos de rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Subhūti says, “Those phenomena” and so on.

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i rang bzhin du rjes su rtogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i rang bzhin du rjes su rtogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The realization of the nature of all phenomena as devoid of characteristics should be called “bodhisattva.”

original: gang la mngon par zhen pa yod pa de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod par mi bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma @65a * //
analyzed: gang la mngon par zhen pa yod pa de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod par mi bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma @65a * //
translated: Not only is it that one should not be called a bodhisattva who has any kind of attachment,

original: zad kyi ; byang chub sems dpa'i sa las kyang ring ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zad kyi ; byang chub sems dpa'i sa las kyang ring ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: but it is also taught that he is far from the bodhisattva stages.🔽To demonstrate this, it says, “Subhūti, if a bodhisattva, a great being, were to think, ‘I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and then liberate beings who are not liberated, free those who are not free,

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: encourage those who are discouraged, and bring to nirvana those who have not attained nirvana,’ he would not be called a bodhisattva.🔽”

original: chos 'di ma shes shing zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: chos 'di ma shes shing zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Not knowing this Dharma means not knowing it through listening.

original: rjes su ma rtogs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: rjes su ma rtogs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Not having realized it means not having realized it through reflection and meditation.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba ni khas 'ches pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba ni khas 'ches pa ste /
translated: Knowledge means claiming,

original: bdag nyid byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes khas len pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes khas len pa'o //
translated: claiming, “I am a bodhisattva.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las ring ba yin zhing zhes bya ba ni sa rab tu dga' ba las ring ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las ring ba yin zhing zhes bya ba ni sa rab tu dga' ba las ring ba yin te /
translated: Far from the bodhisattva stages means far from the bodhisattva stage of The Joyful.

original: phyin ci log nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log nyid kyis mthong ba'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of error, the path of seeing does not exist.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams las ring ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa las ring bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams las ring ba yin no zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa las ring bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: This shows that one is far from the generosity, etc., which is completely pure of the three spheres,

original: mngon par zhen pas sbyin pa la sogs pa phyin ci log tu 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pas sbyin pa la sogs pa phyin ci log tu 'gyur bas so //
translated: because generosity, etc. become distorted by the power of clinging.

original: lha la sogs pa bslus pa'i skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa bslus pa'i skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the fault of deceiving the gods, etc.,

original: de bzhin du de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, “In the same way, he is a liar to the world with its gods…”

original: phyin ci log gi dbang gis bdag nyid byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa la byang chub sems dpar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi dbang gis bdag nyid byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa la byang chub sems dpar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, under the power of distortion, he claims to be a bodhisattva, although he is not.

original: thams cad byang chub sems dpar thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad byang chub sems dpar thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the fault that everyone would absurdly become a bodhisattva,

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa de'i tshe tshig tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa de'i tshe tshig tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, “Subhūti, at that time, he is a liar to the world with its gods and humans, because he claims to be a bodhisattva through mere words…”

original: tshig tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i don gyis stong pa'i tshig tsam gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i don gyis stong pa'i tshig tsam gyi sgo nas so //
translated: “Merely in words” means merely in words that are empty of the meaning of the thought of awakening.

original: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: “Suvikrāntavikrāmin, this” and so on are easy to understand.

original: de ltar sems bskyed pa dang po'i phan yon byang chub sems dpa'i ming thob pa nyid bstan nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba'i mtshan nyid can yon tan gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed pa dang po'i phan yon byang chub sems dpa'i ming thob pa nyid bstan nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba'i mtshan nyid can yon tan gzhan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the benefits of the first generation of the thought of awakening, the attainment of the name “bodhisattva,” in order to teach other qualities that are characterized by being born into the family of the tathāgatas,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽byang chub sems dpa' gang las rab tu dga' bar zhugs pa de bsod nams kyi dbang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las shin tu 'das nas sangs rgyas kyi sar rjes su 'gro ba'i mthong ba'i lam skyes pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / byang chub sems dpa' gang las rab tu dga' bar zhugs pa de bsod nams kyi dbang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las shin tu 'das nas sangs rgyas kyi sar rjes su 'gro ba'i mthong ba'i lam skyes pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs
translated: [the Lord] declares, “The bodhisattva who has entered the Joyous” and so on.

original: su skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: su skyes pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who has entered the Joyous, by the power of his merit, having completely transcended the stages of the śrāvaka and the pratyekabuddha, by the arising of the path of seeing that leads to the stage of the buddhas, is born into the family of the tathāgatas.

original: de'i bdag @65b nyid kyi chos kyi sku rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag @65b nyid kyi chos kyi sku rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has realized the dharmakāya, which is their nature.

original: kun tu sbyor ba gsum po zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams kyi srid par kun du sbyor bas na kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba gsum po zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams kyi srid par kun du sbyor bas na kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: The three fetters: since they bind to existence, they are fetters.

original: de yang gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang gsum ste /
translated: There are three of them:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: the view of the transitory composite, doubt, and the belief in the efficacy of mere rites and rituals.

original: thams cad spangs par gyur pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sgo nas thams cad ma lus par log pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad spangs par gyur pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sgo nas thams cad ma lus par log pa'o //
translated: The complete abandonment of these is their complete cessation through the path of seeing.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams spangs su zin kyang bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams lhag ma lus pa'i phyir de rnams lhag ma lus par ma spangs pas spangs pa nyid du ma brjod do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams spangs su zin kyang bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams lhag ma lus pa'i phyir de rnams lhag ma lus par ma spangs pas spangs pa nyid du ma brjod do //
translated: Although attachment and so on have been abandoned, since the attachment and so on that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation remain, they are not described as abandoned, since their remainder remains.

original: gal te 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ma spangs pa'i phyir spangs pa nyid du mi brjod ce na /🔽'o na lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / log par lta ba dag rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa'i phyir de dag spangs pas ci'i phyir ma brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ma spangs pa'i phyir spangs pa nyid du mi brjod ce na / 'o na lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / log par lta ba dag rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa'i phyir de dag spangs pas ci'i phyir ma brjod ce na /
translated: But if attachment, anger, pride, ignorance and the view grasping at extremes are not abandoned by the path of meditation, why not say they are not abandoned?🔽But if the views grasping at the supreme and holding a view to be paramount are completely abandoned, why not say they are abandoned?

original: de dag la lan ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / the tshom dag spangs par brjod pas de dag kyang spangs par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag la lan ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / the tshom dag spangs par brjod pas de dag kyang spangs par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The answer is that since it is said that the views grasping at the supreme and holding a view to be paramount and doubt are abandoned, it is understood that they are abandoned.

original: 'di ltar lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin par 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin par 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The view grasping at the supreme engages the view grasping at the supreme through ethics and rituals.

original: de gang gi phyir lam ma yin pa la lam du 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: de gang gi phyir lam ma yin pa la lam du 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: Why? Because grasping a nonpath as a path is the overesteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: lta ba rnams mchog dang dag pa'i rgyu nyid du mthong ba'i lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: lta ba rnams mchog dang dag pa'i rgyu nyid du mthong ba'i lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: And because one sees views as the cause of purification and the highest, it is the overesteeming of views.

original: des na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa spangs pa brjod pas lta ba mchog dang dag pa'i rgyur 'dzin pa'i lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yang spangs par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa spangs pa brjod pas lta ba mchog dang dag pa'i rgyur 'dzin pa'i lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yang spangs par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by stating the abandonment of the overesteeming of morality and asceticism, one should understand that the abandonment of the overesteeming of views that grasps them as the cause of purification and the highest is also stated.

original: log par lta ba ni the tshom gyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba ni the tshom gyis 'jug ste /
translated: Wrong view arises from doubt,

original: 'di ltar bden pa dang / dkon mchog dang / las dang 'bras bu la the tshom gyi sgo nas med pa'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bden pa dang / dkon mchog dang / las dang 'bras bu la the tshom gyi sgo nas med pa'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: because doubt about the truths, the jewels, karma and its result gives rise to the cognition that they do not exist.

original: des na the tshom spangs par brjod pas log par lta ba yang spangs par rtogs pa yin pas log par lta ba spangs par ma brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na the tshom spangs par brjod pas log par lta ba yang spangs par rtogs pa yin pas log par lta ba spangs par ma brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by stating the abandonment of doubt, one should understand that the abandonment of wrong view is also stated, since it is not stated separately.

original: gzhan dag ni yul gzhan du 'gro ba la bar gcod gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni yul gzhan du 'gro ba la bar gcod gsum 'byung ste /
translated: Three obstacles arise for others who go to another place.

original: 'gro bar mi 'dod pa @66a * //
analyzed: 'gro bar mi 'dod pa @66a * //
translated: They do not wish to go,

original: dang ; lam gzhan la brten nas lam bor ba dang / lam la the tshom za ba'o //
analyzed: dang ; lam gzhan la brten nas lam bor ba dang / lam la the tshom za ba'o //
translated: they take a wrong path, and they doubt the path.

original: de bzhin du thar par 'gro ba la yang gsum po 'di rnams bar chad yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du thar par 'gro ba la yang gsum po 'di rnams bar chad yin te /
translated: Similarly, three are obstacles for those who go to liberation.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta bas gang der med par 'gyur ro snyam nas thal ba la skrag pas grol bar mi 'dod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta bas gang der med par 'gyur ro snyam nas thal ba la skrag pas grol bar mi 'dod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Here, due to the afflicted view of the self, one thinks “I will not exist there” and due to fear of annihilation, one does not wish to be liberated.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas lam gzhan la brten nas lam nor ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas lam gzhan la brten nas lam nor ba'o //
translated: Due to holding morality and asceticism as paramount, one takes a wrong path by relying on another path.

original: the tshom gyi lam la the tshom za'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi lam la the tshom za'o //
translated: Due to doubt, one doubts the path.

original: des na rgyun du zhugs pa la thar par 'gro ba'i bar chad 'di rnams spangs par bstan par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsum po de rnams spangs par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rgyun du zhugs pa la thar par 'gro ba'i bar chad 'di rnams spangs par bstan par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsum po de rnams spangs par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that stream enterers abandon these obstacles to going to liberation, the Bhagavān said that they abandon those three.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba dang / kun du sbyor ba gsum po spangs pa'i yon tan bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba dang / kun du sbyor ba gsum po spangs pa'i yon tan bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the qualities of being born into the Tathagata family and abandoning the three fetters,

original: rab tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi yon tan bstan pa'i sgo nas sa rab tu dga' ba'i nges tshig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi yon tan bstan pa'i sgo nas sa rab tu dga' ba'i nges tshig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the etymology of the ground Very Joyful by way of teaching the qualities of the nature of Very Joyful,🔽he says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni dga' ba mchog tu 'gyur 'chang zhing //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni dga' ba mchog tu 'gyur 'chang zhing // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: That bodhisattva comes to possess supreme joy.

original: mthong ba'i lam thob nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs ba dang / sangs rgyas brgya phrag gcig mthong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de ni dga' ba mchog tu gyur pa 'chang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam thob nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs ba dang / sangs rgyas brgya phrag gcig mthong ba la sogs pa'i yon tan thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de ni dga' ba mchog tu gyur pa 'chang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Having attained the path of seeing, he comes to possess supreme joy because he has abandoned the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing and has attained the qualities of seeing one hundred Buddhas and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir 'di'i gnas skabs na byang chub sems dpa' mchog tu gyur pa'i dga' ba 'chang ba de'i phyir sa rab tu dga' ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di'i gnas skabs na byang chub sems dpa' mchog tu gyur pa'i dga' ba 'chang ba de'i phyir sa rab tu dga' ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because at this stage the bodhisattva is endowed with supreme joy, this level is called the Joyous.

original: nus pa'i yon tan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nus pa'i yon tan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the qualities of ability,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya kun nas g-yo bar nus pa'ang yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya kun nas g-yo bar nus pa'ang yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said that he is able to cause a hundred world systems to quake.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya'i bar du g-yo ba'i nus pa skyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya'i bar du g-yo ba'i nus pa skyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: He has the ability to cause a hundred world systems to quake.🔽Thus, a sutra states:

original: de ltar yang mdo las skad cig ma gcig gis ting nge 'dzin brgya so sor thob cing snyoms par 'jug la /🔽sangs rgyas brgya phrag gcig kyang mthong la /
analyzed: de ltar yang mdo las skad cig ma gcig gis ting nge 'dzin brgya so sor thob cing snyoms par 'jug la / sangs rgyas brgya phrag gcig kyang mthong la /
translated: In a single instant, he attains and enters a hundred meditative concentrations,

original: de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs par yang 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs par yang 'gyur zhing /
translated: sees a hundred buddhas and recognizes their blessing,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo bar byed cing snang bar byed pa dang / zhing brgya las kun du 'da' bar byed pa dang / sems can brgya phrag gcig yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bskar ba brgyar @66b gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo bar byed cing snang bar byed pa dang / zhing brgya las kun du 'da' bar byed pa dang / sems can brgya phrag gcig yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bskar ba brgyar @66b gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He causes a hundred world-realms to quake, and to shine with light; he passes beyond a hundred world-realms, he matures a hundred sentient beings, he remains for a hundred eons, and so on.

original: tshigs su bcad pa de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that verse, he says:

original: so so'i skye bo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The stage of the ordinary man, the stage of the disciple, the stage of the isolated buddha, the stage of the bodhisattva, and the stage of the tathagata.

original: mthong ba'i lam thob pas mos pas spyod pa'i sa dor bas so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam thob pas mos pas spyod pa'i sa dor bas so so'i skye bo'i sa las 'das pa'o //
translated: The stage of the ordinary man is transcended by the bodhisattva through the attainment of the path of insight, because the stage of devoted conduct is left behind.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'das pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The stages of the disciple and the isolated buddha have been explained previously.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad nam mkha'i dkyil dang mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad nam mkha'i dkyil dang mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The stage of the tathagata is transcended by the bodhisattva through the perfection of the transcendences, because he sees all things as equal to the realm of space.

original: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the abandonment of the three fetters,

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang zag gi bdag med pa mngon sum du mthong bas zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i rtag pa nyid la sogs pa mu stegs pas sgro btags pa'i bdag med pa mngon sum du mthong
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang zag gi bdag med pa mngon sum du mthong bas zhes bya ba ni phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i rtag pa nyid la sogs pa mu stegs pas sgro btags pa'i bdag med pa mngon sum du mthong
translated: he says, “at that time,” etc. By directly seeing the selflessness of the person, one directly sees the non-existence of a self that is permanent, etc., and is imputed by the tīrthikas as being separate from the aggregates.

original: ba yin pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: ba yin pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba ldog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the view of the transitory collection is reversed.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, the view of the transitory collection is of two types:

original: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: that which arises from mental construction and that which is innate.

original: de dag kyang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag kyang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: These have already been explained above.

original: 'dir gnas skabs kyi stobs kyis mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gnas skabs kyi stobs kyis mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba ldog pa yin no //
translated: Here, by the power of the occasion, that which arises from mental construction is reversed.

original: gang gi phyir gang zag gi bdag med pa mngon sum du mthong ba dang de'i phyir the tshom med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zag gi bdag med pa mngon sum du mthong ba dang de'i phyir the tshom med pa yin no //
translated: Because one directly sees the selflessness of the person, therefore there is no doubt.

original: the tshom med pas lam gzhan la brten pa'i mtshan nyid can la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang med do //
analyzed: the tshom med pas lam gzhan la brten pa'i mtshan nyid can la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang med do //
translated: Since there is no doubt, there is also no overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices that are based on other paths.🔽Because there is no rebirth.

original: slar mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'ba' zhig ldog pa yang skye ba yang yod de /
analyzed: slar mi skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'ba' zhig ldog pa yang skye ba yang yod de /
translated: This means that there is no rebirth even for those who have only turned away from the lower realms, because they are reborn again.

original: dper na rims la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rims la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the case of fever and so on.

original: kun du sbyor ba gsum po 'di 'gags na yang skye ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum po 'di 'gags na yang skye ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no rebirth even when these three fetters have ceased.

original: de nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this very point by way of negation, he says,🔽One who has not seen the truth, etc.

original: de kho na nyid ma mthong ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de kho na nyid ma mthong ba ni bdag med pa nyid ma mthong nas so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma mthong ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de kho na nyid ma mthong ba ni bdag med pa nyid ma mthong nas so //
translated: One who has not seen the truth means one who has not seen selflessness.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid mthong na'o //🔽da ni dga' ba mchog tu 'gyur 'chang zhing //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid mthong na'o // da ni dga' ba mchog tu 'gyur 'chang zhing //
translated: The meaning is that there is no other.

original: zhes bya ba'i don bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to explain the meaning of the verse that goes,🔽One who has seen the truth, etc.,🔽he says,

original: nges pa la zhus pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nges pa la zhus pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase having attained certainty and so forth.

original: nges pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //🔽de'i rgyu can gyi yon tan thob pa dang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyu can gyi ting nge 'dzin brgya phrag gcig la @67a * //
analyzed: nges pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo // de'i rgyu can gyi yon tan thob pa dang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rgyu can gyi ting nge 'dzin brgya phrag gcig la @67a * //
translated: Certainty refers to the path of seeing.

original: sogs pa'i yon tan thob pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i yon tan thob pa'o //
translated: The phrase having attained the qualities that are its cause means that one attains the qualities of the one hundred concentrations that are the cause of the path of seeing and so forth.

original: sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi skyon dang bral bas zhes bya ba ni sa rab tu dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i skyon de rnams dang bral bas so //
analyzed: sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi skyon dang bral bas zhes bya ba ni sa rab tu dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i skyon de rnams dang bral bas so //
translated: The phrase being free of the faults that are the resistances to the spiritual levels means that one is free of the faults that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing and that are resistances to the Joyful stage.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The phrase the uncommon and so forth is easy to understand.

original: de ltar yon tan rnam pa bzhi bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar yon tan rnam pa bzhi bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the four qualities,

original: gong nas gong du rtogs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gong nas gong du rtogs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the qualities of realization and so forth that are higher than these,

original: sa nas sa gnon byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sa nas sa gnon byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [the text] says, ascending from spiritual level to spiritual level, and so forth.

original: sa nas sa gnon byed cing zhes bya ba ni sa dang po nas sa gnyis pa la sogs pa gnon par byed pa nas brtsams te ;
analyzed: sa nas sa gnon byed cing zhes bya ba ni sa dang po nas sa gnyis pa la sogs pa gnon par byed pa nas brtsams te ;
translated: means that he conquers the second stage, etc., beginning with the first stage,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du gnon par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du gnon par byed do //
translated: up to the stage of Buddhahood.

original: gong mar rab tu 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gong mar rab tu 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: He goes to the higher, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gror skye bar gyur pa'i las mi dge ba'i chos can du 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gror skye bar gyur pa'i las mi dge ba'i chos can du 'gyur bas so //
translated: means that at that time he does not have the non-virtuous dharmas which would cause him to be born in the hells, as a hungry ghost, or as an animal.

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa rnams thams cad zad //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa rnams thams cad zad //
translated: He exhausts all the stages of the common man,

original: ces bya ba ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dang / tshangs pa chen por skyes pa'i sa dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa rnams zad par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dang / tshangs pa chen por skyes pa'i sa dang / mos pas spyod pa'i sa rnams zad par gyur ba'o //
translated: means that he exhausts the stages of the beings in the state of no-thought, the Uttarakuru, the Great Brahma, and the stage of the practice of faith.

original: de nyid nyan thos rnams la the tshom bsal ba'i don du dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid nyan thos rnams la the tshom bsal ba'i don du dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that very thing by means of an example for the sake of dispelling the doubts of the Sravakas, he says:

original: 'di ni 'phags pa brgyad pa ji ltar nye bar bstan ;🔽/ zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa brgyad pa ji ltar nye bar bstan ;🔽/ zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is like the teaching of the noble Ashta.

original: brgyad pa ni yas bgrang ba'i dbang du byas nas brgyad pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa ni yas bgrang ba'i dbang du byas nas brgyad pa rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa ste /
translated: The eighth is the eighth stage of the path of preparation, which is the stage of entering the result of stream entry.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes brjod pa ni rgyu la 'bras bur btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes brjod pa ni rgyu la 'bras bur btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term stream enterer is a case of calling the cause by the name of the result.

original: de nas nyan thos rnams kyis brgyad pa ci ltar brjod pa de bzhin du 'di'i gnas skabs na byang chub sems dpa' yang yin te /
analyzed: de nas nyan thos rnams kyis brgyad pa ci ltar brjod pa de bzhin du 'di'i gnas skabs na byang chub sems dpa' yang yin te /
translated: Then, just as the listeners call it the eighth stage, so too it is the bodhisattva stage of the eighth stage.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos kyis rgyun du zhugs pa rnams la ngan song du 'gro ba dang / sgong dang / drod gsher gyi skye gnas dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang / tshangs pa chen por skye ba dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos kyis rgyun du zhugs pa rnams la ngan song du 'gro ba dang / sgong dang / drod gsher gyi skye gnas dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang / tshangs pa chen por skye ba dang /
translated: Just as noble listeners who are stream enterers do not go to the lower realms, do not take birth as an egg-born or womb-born being, do not take birth in the northern continent of Kuru, do not take birth as a being with no conception of the Buddha, Dharma and Sangha, do not take birth as a great Brahma and

original: za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa'i rten dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams mi skye ba'i chos nyid du 'gyur ba dang / yon tan zag pa med pa'i lam la sogs pa thob pa de bzhin du 'dir yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis pa'i rten dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams mi skye ba'i chos nyid du 'gyur ba dang / yon tan zag pa med pa'i lam la sogs pa thob pa de bzhin du 'dir yang shes par bya'o //
translated: and the non-arising of the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing, and the attainment of the qualities of the uncontaminated path, and so on.

original: der yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la las kyi dbang gis ngan song la sogs @67b par skye ba zad pa yin gyi snying rje'i dbang gis ngang pa padma'i tshal du 'jug pa ltar mnar med par yang 'jug par 'gyur ba yin zhes pa'i tshul gyis 'gal ba🔽med do // de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: der yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la las kyi dbang gis ngan song la sogs @67b par skye ba zad pa yin gyi snying rje'i dbang gis ngang pa padma'i tshal du 'jug pa ltar mnar med par yang 'jug par 'gyur ba yin zhes pa'i tshul gyis 'gal ba med do // de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: And there, for the bodhisattvas, the power of karma exhausts rebirth in the lower realms and so on, but through the power of compassion, they enter Avīci hell as if swans enter a lotus grove.🔽Thus there is no contradiction.🔽To demonstrate that very point, he says,

original: 'di ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is like this.

original: ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos la goms pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos kyi dbyings la glo bur ba'i bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i don du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos la goms pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos kyi dbyings la glo bur ba'i bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i don du spyod pa'o //
translated: Because of the cultivation of the Dharma as it is understood, means that one cultivates the Dharma-element as it is understood, in order to eliminate the object that is to be eliminated by the path of cultivation.

original: gal te ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa'i chos kyi dbyings la goms par ma gyur cing sngar ma rtogs pa'i khong du chud par bya ba yod par gyur na sngar med pa'i khong du chud par bya ba'i don du 'bad pa du ma'i sgo nas
analyzed: gal te ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa'i chos kyi dbyings la goms par ma gyur cing sngar ma rtogs pa'i khong du chud par bya ba yod par gyur na sngar med pa'i khong du chud par bya ba'i don du 'bad pa du ma'i sgo nas
translated: If one did not cultivate the Dharma-element as it is understood, and if there were something to be understood that was not previously understood, then one would strive in many ways to understand the object that was not previously understood.

original: ngal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sa gzhan nas gzhan gnon par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sa gzhan nas gzhan gnon par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, one would not progress from one stage to another, because one would be exhausted.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni ji ltar khong du chud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni ji ltar khong du chud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said: “Because of the cultivation of the Dharma as it is understood, and because there is nothing further to be understood beyond that understanding.”

original: ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos la spyod pa yin kyang phra rgyas lhag ma spang ba'i don du gal te brtson par mi byed nas gzhan gnon par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar khong du chud pa'i chos la spyod pa yin kyang phra rgyas lhag ma spang ba'i don du gal te brtson par mi byed nas gzhan gnon par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Even though one practices the Dharma as understood, if one does not strive to eliminate the remaining proclivities, how can one overcome others?

original: des na sa gnyis pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des na sa gnyis pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “on the second ground, etc.”

original: sa dang po la zhugs pa'i dus su sngar med pa'i rab tu dga' ba thob pas sa gnyis pa la sogs pa gnon pas spro ba chen po'i phyir ro ;
