analyzed: sa dang po la zhugs pa'i dus su sngar med pa'i rab tu dga' ba thob pas sa gnyis pa la sogs pa gnon pas spro ba chen po'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because one is enthusiastic about overcoming the second ground, etc., since one obtains the joy not previously present at the time of entering the first ground.

original: / gtan tshigs gnyis kyi sgo nas sa nas sa gnon par byed pa nyid bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: / gtan tshigs gnyis kyi sgo nas sa nas sa gnon par byed pa nyid bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is established that one overcomes the grounds through the two reasons.

original: de'i tshe 'di'i ngan 'gro'i lam rnams mtha' dag 'gag par 'gyur zhes smos pa de bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di'i ngan 'gro'i lam rnams mtha' dag 'gag par 'gyur zhes smos pa de bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: At that time, all the paths to miserable realms are blocked for him.

original: mdor na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mdor na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to explain that, it is said, “in brief, etc.”

original: de la ngan 'gro'i lam 'gag pa dang ; so so'i skye bo'i sa rnams zad par rgyun du zhugs pa'i dpe'i sgo nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ngan 'gro'i lam 'gag pa dang ; so so'i skye bo'i sa rnams zad par rgyun du zhugs pa'i dpe'i sgo nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: There, the blocking of the paths to miserable realms and the exhaustion of the stages of ordinary beings is taught by way of an example of a stream enterer.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rtogs pa las zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rjes su mthun pa'i mthong lam thob pa las so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rtogs pa las zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rjes su mthun pa'i mthong lam thob pa las so //
translated: From the realization of the Dharma of the noble ones means from the attainment of the path of seeing that is in accord with the śrāvakas.

original: skyon dang bral zhing zhes bya ba ni ngan song du 'gro ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: skyon dang bral zhing zhes bya ba ni ngan song du 'gro ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from faults means free from going to the lower realms and so on.

original: yon tan 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba bdun pa'i bar la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni skye ba bdun pa'i bar la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The arising of good qualities means attaining nirvāṇa within seven lifetimes.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //🔽de ltar sa nas sa gnon pa dang / ngan 'gro'i lam rnams 'gag pa dang / so so'i skye bo'i sa rnams zad par 'gyur ba'i yon tan @68a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o // de ltar sa nas sa gnon pa dang / ngan 'gro'i lam rnams 'gag pa dang / so so'i skye bo'i sa rnams zad par 'gyur ba'i yon tan @68a * //
translated: Thus and so on are easy to understand.

original: rnam pa gsum brjod nas /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum brjod nas /
translated: Thus, having described the three qualities of ascending from stage to stage, blocking the paths to the lower realms, and exhausting the stages of ordinary beings,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag zil gyis gnon pa'i yon tan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the quality of outshining the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says this bodhisattva and so on.

original: 'di zhes pa ni sems bskyed pa dang po pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni sems bskyed pa dang po pa'o //
translated: This refers to the first generation of the Thought.

original: khyad par de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that distinction,🔽he says,

original: thub dbang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thub dbang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The sons of the Lord of Sages' speech, etc.

original: thub dbang gsung skyes zhes bya ba ni thub pa'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: thub dbang gsung skyes zhes bya ba ni thub pa'i nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas so //
translated: The sons of the Lord of Sages' speech are the Sages' Hearers and Solitary Realizers.

original: de dag gi dbang po ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams so //
analyzed: de dag gi dbang po ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams so //
translated: Their Lord is the Lord Buddhas.

original: de'i gsung ni chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gsung ni chos bstan pa'o //
translated: His speech is the teaching of the Dharma.

original: de las skyes pa ni nyan thos te /
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni nyan thos te /
translated: Born from that is the Hearer.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams la rang byung ye shes skye bas so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams la rang byung ye shes skye bas so //
translated: The Solitary Realizers are born from the self-originated intuition.

original: bsod nams dag gi dbang gis pham byas rnam par 'phel //
analyzed: bsod nams dag gi dbang gis pham byas rnam par 'phel //
translated: Having been surpassed by the power of their merit, they increase.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa rnams la dus dpag tu med par phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa dpag tu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa rnams la dus dpag tu med par phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa dpag tu med pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because of the immeasurable intention to benefit and gladden the immeasurable realm of sentient beings for an immeasurable time.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi dbang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag zil gyis mnan nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi dbang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag zil gyis mnan nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva surpasses the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas by the power of his merit, and the bodhisattva increases.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of bodhisattva?

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems lta dang po la gnas kyang //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems lta dang po la gnas kyang //
translated: Even though he is in the first stage, he has the thought of enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: 'dir byang chub kyi sems ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub kyi sems ni gnyis te /
translated: Here, the thought of enlightenment is twofold:

original: brda las byung ba dang / don dam pa'i'o //
analyzed: brda las byung ba dang / don dam pa'i'o //
translated: conventional and ultimate.

original: de la brda las byung ba ni so so'i skye bo'i sa'i smon pa dang 'jug pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de la brda las byung ba ni so so'i skye bo'i sa'i smon pa dang 'jug pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The conventional is the aspiration and the engagement of the nature of the stage of the ordinary man.

original: don dam pa ni dang po'i chos nyid kyis thob pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni dang po'i chos nyid kyis thob pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is the attainment of the first stage.

original: gnyis ka la yang bsod nams kyi dbang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas zil gyis gnon pa'i nus pa yod de ;
analyzed: gnyis ka la yang bsod nams kyi dbang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas zil gyis gnon pa'i nus pa yod de ;
translated: In both cases, by the power of merit, there is the ability to surpass the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de lta bu'i byang chub sems las byung ba'i bsod nams nyan thos la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i byang chub sems las byung ba'i bsod nams nyan thos la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the merit arising from such a thought of enlightenment does not exist for the sravakas, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spyod pa la 'jug pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spyod pa la 'jug pa las /
translated: it says:🔽Even the mere headache

original: sems can rnams kyi glad nad tsam //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi glad nad tsam // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: of a sentient being.🔽In order to demonstrate that the bodhicitta derived from🔽verbal expression has the power to surpass the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas by virtue of its merit, as is taught in the source

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa'i khungs kyi sgo nas brda las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems la bsod nams kyi dbang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas zil gyis gnon pa'i nus pa yod pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa'i khungs kyi sgo nas brda las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems la bsod nams kyi dbang gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas zil gyis gnon pa'i nus pa yod pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: of the liberation of the noble Maitreya, it says

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “As it is said” and so forth.

original: rgyal ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dbu gdugs kyi rnam pa lta bu dang / @68b phyag ring ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dbu gdugs kyi rnam pa lta bu dang / @68b phyag ring ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: “Endowed with the characteristics of a victor” means having the characteristics of a head like a parasol, long arms, and so forth.

original: gtso bor gyur pa zhes bya ba ni thabs mthar thug par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa zhes bya ba ni thabs mthar thug par gyur pa'o //
translated: “The principal one” means the ultimate method.

original: rigs kyi bdag nyid che ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs kyi bdag nyid che ba'i dbang gis zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bdag nyid che ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs kyi bdag nyid che ba'i dbang gis zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “By virtue of the greatness of the nature of the lineage” means by virtue of the greatness of the nature of the royal lineage.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ring po ma lon pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni brda las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa bstan pa yin no //🔽de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ring po ma lon pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni brda las byung ba'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa bstan pa yin no // de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The phrase not long after he had generated the thought of enlightenment indicates the generation of the thought of enlightenment that is derived from signs.

original: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For this very reason, he says, the beginner bodhisattva.

original: yun ring du tshangs par spyad pa rnams zhes bya ba ni yun ring du thar pa'i lam bsgoms pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yun ring du tshangs par spyad pa rnams zhes bya ba ni yun ring du thar pa'i lam bsgoms pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase who have practiced pure conduct for a long time means who have cultivated the path of liberation for a long time.

original: mdo de nyid du dpe gnyis bstan pa ni rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mdo de nyid du dpe gnyis bstan pa ni rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In that very sutra, two examples are taught, beginning with the words Son of noble family.

original: mig yongs su dag pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni bya ba rnams kyi nang na des thag shin tu ring ba mthong ba yin pas so //
analyzed: mig yongs su dag pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba ni bya ba rnams kyi nang na des thag shin tu ring ba mthong ba yin pas so //
translated: The phrase whatever good qualities are of the eye's complete purity means that among the various activities, he sees what is very far away.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po'i rigs kyi rgyud du yang dag par byung ba rnams zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid nam mkha' lding gi dbang po yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po'i rigs kyi rgyud du yang dag par byung ba rnams zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid nam mkha' lding gi dbang po yin te /
translated: Those who have arisen in the lineage of the Tathagatas, who are the great kings of the garudas, means that the Tathagatas themselves are the kings of the garudas.

original: dper na bya rnams kyi nang na nam mkha' lding mchog tu gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: dper na bya rnams kyi nang na nam mkha' lding mchog tu gyur pa yin la /
translated: For example, among birds the garuda is supreme.

original: de bzhin du lha dang mi rnams kyi nang na de bzhin gshegs pa mchog tu gyur pa yin pas nam mkha' lding gi dbang po zhes brjod pa yin no ;
analyzed: de bzhin du lha dang mi rnams kyi nang na de bzhin gshegs pa mchog tu gyur pa yin pas nam mkha' lding gi dbang po zhes brjod pa yin no ;
translated: In the same way, among gods and humans the Tathagatas are supreme, and so they are called the kings of the garudas.

original: / de'i rigs rgyud du yang dag par byung ba ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs rgyud du skyes pa'o //
analyzed: / de'i rigs rgyud du yang dag par byung ba ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs rgyud du skyes pa'o //
translated: Those who have arisen in their lineage means that they have been born in the lineage of the Tathagatas because they have developed the mind of enlightenment.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i gshog pa'i stobs kyis pha rol gnon pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i gshog pa'i stobs kyis pha rol gnon pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The power of the wings of the generation of the mind of omniscience means that they have the power of the wings of the generation of the mind of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni byang chub bo ;
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni byang chub bo ;
translated: Omniscience is enlightenment.

original: / der sems bskyed pa ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: / der sems bskyed pa ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The generation of the Thought there is the generation of the Thought of enlightenment.

original: de'i stobs ni nus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs ni nus pa'o //
translated: Its strength is its power.

original: pha rol gnon pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag zil gyis gnon pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gnon pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag zil gyis gnon pa'o //
translated: The mastery is the mastery over the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The superior intention and so on.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las yang dag par 'dren par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las yang dag par 'dren par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The superior intention is the characteristic of the desire to lead sentient beings away from suffering and the causes of suffering.

original: de nyid yongs su dag pa'i mig gi yon tan no //
analyzed: de nyid yongs su dag pa'i mig gi yon tan no //
translated: That is the quality of the eye of purity.

original: de ltar brda las byung ba'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i stobs rnams kyi dbang gis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag zil gyis gnon pa'i nus pa yod pa 'grel @69a * //
analyzed: de ltar brda las byung ba'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i stobs rnams kyi dbang gis nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag zil gyis gnon pa'i nus pa yod pa 'grel @69a * //
translated: Thus, by the power of the generation of the Thought of enlightenment that arises from the sign, the power to master the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas exists. The mastery is the mastery over the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: pas ma bstan pa dang / de bzhin du gnas skabs gang na rtogs pa'i dbang gis byang chub sems dpas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas zil gyis gnon pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pas ma bstan pa dang / de bzhin du gnas skabs gang na rtogs pa'i dbang gis byang chub sems dpas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas zil gyis gnon pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and likewise, in order to demonstrate that the Bodhisattva surpasses the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas by the power of his realization in a certain situation,

original: de ni ring du song bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ring du song ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ring du song bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ring du song ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa'o //
translated: he says, “That one, on the Gone Afar ground, etc.” The Gone Afar is the seventh Bodhisattva ground.

original: blo zhes pa ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo zhes pa ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Intellect” is realization.

original: yang zhes pa ni bsod nams 'ba' zhig gis lhag pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang zhes pa ni bsod nams 'ba' zhig gis lhag pa ma yin gyi /
translated: “Also” means that he is not only superior in merit,

original: 'on kyang ye shes kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang ye shes kyis kyang ngo //
translated: but also in intuition.

original: lhag par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par gyur pa'o //
translated: He is superior.

original: 'di'i don ni 'dir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa rtogs pa mtshungs pa yod du zin kyang sa bdun pa'i snga rol du sa drug pa la sogs par byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mdo sde la sogs pa gang mtshan ma sngon du byas nas lam la
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'dir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa rtogs pa mtshungs pa yod du zin kyang sa bdun pa'i snga rol du sa drug pa la sogs par byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mdo sde la sogs pa gang mtshan ma sngon du byas nas lam la
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Although śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas are alike in realizing the selflessness of phenomena, prior to the seventh bodhisattva ground, bodhisattvas on the sixth ground and so on do not engage the path by way of the signs of the sūtras and so on.

original: 'jug pa'i mtshan ma de mngon du ma byas par sa bdun pa nas brtsams te lam la 'jug pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'jug pa'i mtshan ma de mngon du ma byas par sa bdun pa nas brtsams te lam la 'jug pa yin no ;
translated: They engage the path beginning from the seventh ground.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir de'i gnas skabs na kho bo lam la 'jug par bya'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod pa dang / mdo la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mngon du mi byed pa dang / rtsol ba dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i lam zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir de'i gnas skabs na kho bo lam la 'jug par bya'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa yod pa dang / mdo la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mngon du mi byed pa dang / rtsol ba dang bcas pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i lam zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, at that time, they have the thought “I will engage the path,” they do not manifest the signs of the sūtras and so on, they have exertion, and they are said to be on the signless path.

original: sa brgyad pa nas brtsams te lam la 'jug par bya'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang med pas rtsol ba med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i lam zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa nas brtsams te lam la 'jug par bya'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang med pas rtsol ba med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i lam zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since there is no conception of “I will enter the path” beginning from the eighth bhumi, it is said to be the path without exertion and the path without signs.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la rnam pa de lta bu'i mtshan ma med pa'i lam med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la rnam pa de lta bu'i mtshan ma med pa'i lam med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since sravakas and pratyekabuddhas do not have such a path without signs,

original: de ni ring du song bar blo yang lhag par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ring du song bar blo yang lhag par 'gyur //
translated: their intelligence is not superior.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa rab tu spang bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag gi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa rab tu spang bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, sravakas and pratyekabuddhas do not eliminate the affliction that is the habitual tendency of conception.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni sa brgyad pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni sa brgyad pa nas brtsams te /
translated: However, beginning from the eighth bhumi,

original: rtsol ba med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa zad par 'gyur bas sangs rgyas nyid thob pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsol ba med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i lam gyi stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa zad par 'gyur bas sangs rgyas nyid thob pa yin no //
translated: and by the power of the path of no-more-learning, the afflictions whose nature is the habitual propensities are exhausted, and so Buddhahood is attained.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la de med pas bag chags zad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la de med pas bag chags zad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But since they do not have that, the Sravakas and so on do not have the exhaustion of the habitual propensities.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon ma khol zhabs kyis /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon ma khol zhabs kyis /
translated: For that very reason, Master Matrceta said:

original: bag chags dang bcas skyon de rnams //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas skyon de rnams //
translated: Those faults, along with their habitual propensities,

original: skyob pa gcig pu la ni med //🔽ces gsungs @69b so ;🔽/ de nyid kyi phyir de rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa rdzogs pa med pa yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyob pa gcig pu la ni med // ces gsungs @69b so ; / de nyid kyi phyir de rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa rdzogs pa med pa yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: do not exist for the Protector alone.🔽And for that very reason, it is said that they do not have the complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena,

original: rtsol ba med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rtsol ba med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: because they do not have the complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena, which is of the nature of no-more-learning and signlessness.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas zil gyis gnon pa'i nus pa yod pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas zil gyis gnon pa'i nus pa yod pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the ultimate thought of awakening has the power to surpass the disciples and solitary buddhas,

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “In the noble Ten Stages…” and so on.

original: sa bcu pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir don dam pa kho na gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir don dam pa kho na gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the stage of the tenth stage, he speaks only of the ultimate.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: “Thus” and so on are easy to understand.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i che ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni khyad par du gyur pa'i bsod nams kyi rgyu byang chub kyi sems dang / snying rje'i stobs kyis bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i che ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni khyad par du gyur pa'i bsod nams kyi rgyu byang chub kyi sems dang / snying rje'i stobs kyis bya ba'i don to //
translated: “By the greatness of his superior intention” means by the power of the merit that is the cause of his special awakening mind and compassion.

original: rang gi blo'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni rang gi shes rab kyi stobs kyis mdo la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la mi ltos pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang gi blo'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni rang gi shes rab kyi stobs kyis mdo la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la mi ltos pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “By the power of his own mind” means by the power of his own wisdom, without relying on the signs of the sūtras and so on.

original: rnam par dpyad pas ni zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pas ni zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “By analysis” means by engaging in the realm of phenomena.

original: rang gi yul shes pa'i che ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi yul shes pa'i che ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Abiding in the greatness of knowing one's object.

original: rang gi yul ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: rang gi yul ni chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: One's object is the reality realm.

original: de'i shes pa ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i shes pa ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: Its knowledge is realization.

original: de'i che ba ni mdo la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mngon du byed par mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i che ba ni mdo la sogs pa'i mtshan ma mngon du byed par mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Its greatness is not engaging in the manifestation of the signs of sutras and so forth.

original: sa 'og ma rnams su zhes bya ba ni sa drug pa dang lnga pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //🔽da ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: sa 'og ma rnams su zhes bya ba ni sa drug pa dang lnga pa la sogs pa rnams su'o // da ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams la yang chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa yin no //
translated: In the lower levels means in the sixth level, the fifth level, and so forth.

original: zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that even the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas have a complete knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena,🔽he says,

original: lung 'di las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lung 'di las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In this scripture, etc.

original: gzhan dag na re nyan thos rnams la gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa kho na yod la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re nyan thos rnams la gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa kho na yod la /
translated: Others say that the sravakas have a complete knowledge of the selflessness of the person,

original: gzung ba rang bzhin med pa tsam du rtogs pas rang sangs rgyas rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gzung ba rang bzhin med pa tsam du rtogs pas rang sangs rgyas rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa yod pa yin la /
translated: and the pratyekabuddhas have a partial knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena, since they realize that the object is merely essenceless.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bdag gnyis med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa yin no zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bdag gnyis med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa yin no zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattvas have the complete knowledge of the nonexistence of the two selves.

original: de ni mi 'thad par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad par ston pa yin te /
translated: This is not tenable.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa de lung las sam /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa de lung las sam /
translated: That the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas do not have the complete knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena is either from scripture or from reasoning.🔽Is it from scripture?

original: 'on te rigs pa las yin /
analyzed: 'on te rigs pa las yin /
translated: Or is it from reasoning?

original: de la lung las ma yin te /🔽sa bcu pa'i mdo nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa la @70a * //
analyzed: de la lung las ma yin te / sa bcu pa'i mdo nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa la @70a * //
translated: It is not from scripture.

original: chos kyi bdag med pa rtogs pa yod par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi bdag med pa rtogs pa yod par bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: The Dasabhumika itself proves that sravakas and so on do have the realization of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gang gi phyir sa bcu pa'i mdo las rang gi blo'i stobs kyis rnam par dpyod pas sa bdun par zil gyis gnon par gsungs la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bcu pa'i mdo las rang gi blo'i stobs kyis rnam par dpyod pas sa bdun par zil gyis gnon par gsungs la /
translated: For the Dasabhumika says that by the power of their own intellect they analyze and thereby surpass the seventh level,

original: sa dang po la sogs par ma gsungs so //
analyzed: sa dang po la sogs par ma gsungs so //
translated: but it does not say that they do so on the first level and so on.

original: gal te nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa med par 'gyur nas dang por yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag las byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa lhag par yod
analyzed: gal te nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa med par 'gyur nas dang por yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag las byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa lhag par yod
translated: If the sravakas and so on did not have an understanding of the selflessness of phenomena, then even from the beginning bodhisattvas would have had a superior understanding of the selflessness of phenomena to that of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: pa'i phyir rtogs pa che ba'i bdag nyid can du ci ltar mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir rtogs pa che ba'i bdag nyid can du ci ltar mi 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: If the sravakas and so on would not have the full understanding of the selflessness of phenomena, then first of all, how could the bodhisattvas have a superior full understanding of the selflessness of phenomena to the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas, since they have a greatness of realization?🔽This is how it is.

original: lung 'di las na zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i mdo las so //
analyzed: lung 'di las na zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i mdo las so //
translated: From this scripture,

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ltar zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ltar zhes bya ba la /
translated: like the mundane free from attachment,

original: 'jig rten pa ni zag pa med pa'i lam ma thob pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni zag pa med pa'i lam ma thob pas so //
translated: mundane refers to those who have not obtained the uncontaminated path.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pas brgyad la 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pas brgyad la 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: Free from attachment refers to those free from attachment to the eight, such as the desire realm and so on.

original: 'dir 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi'i dbye bas sa dgu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi'i dbye bas sa dgu yod pa yin te /
translated: Here there are nine levels, divided into the desire realm, the four absorptions and the four formless states.

original: de la gang 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba de 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar sa brgyad la sa 'og ma 'og mas rags pa nyid du dmigs shing /
analyzed: de la gang 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba de 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar sa brgyad la sa 'og ma 'og mas rags pa nyid du dmigs shing /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the world view the eight levels from the desire realm up to the base of nothingness as progressively grosser.🔽

original: sa gong ma gong mas phra ba nyid du dmigs pa'i sgo nas 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa yin no //🔽yod min med min skye mched kyi sa las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: sa gong ma gong mas phra ba nyid du dmigs pa'i sgo nas 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa yin no // yod min med min skye mched kyi sa las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi 'thob ste /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the desire realm and so on up to the base of nothingness obtain freedom from attachment through observing the coarseness of lower levels and the calmness of higher levels.

original: de'i gong nas sa gzhan med pas so //
analyzed: de'i gong nas sa gzhan med pas so //
translated: They do not obtain freedom from attachment to the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment because there is no higher level above it.

original: de'i phyir 'di rnams la khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba rnams yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di rnams la khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba rnams yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is said that those who abide in the formless realm do not abandon afflictions that occur in the three realms.

original: des ni ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: des ni ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: How do they surpass those free from attachment to the desire realm?

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zil gyis gnon te /
translated: They surpass bodhisattvas who have generated the first level of the mind of enlightenment.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa med pas so ;
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa med pas so ;
translated: Because those who are free from mundane attachment do not have complete knowledge of the absence of nature.

original: / de bzhin du sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas zil gyis gnon par 'gyur te //
analyzed: / de bzhin du sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas zil gyis gnon par 'gyur te //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva who has generated the first stage of the mind of enlightenment surpasses the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa med pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa med pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Because they do not have complete knowledge of the absence of nature.

original: rang gi blos rnam par dpyad pas kyang zhes bya ba ni rang gi shes rab kyis rang bzhin med par yongs su @70b shes pa'i sgo nas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi blos rnam par dpyad pas kyang zhes bya ba ni rang gi shes rab kyis rang bzhin med par yongs su @70b shes pa'i sgo nas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “By the power of their own intellect” means by their own wisdom, through complete knowledge of the absence of nature.

original: de ltar lung gi sgo nas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar lung gi sgo nas ma yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is not by scripture.

original: 'o na lung du ma las nyan thos la sogs pa las gang zag gi bdag med pa kho na yod pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa de ji ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na lung du ma las nyan thos la sogs pa las gang zag gi bdag med pa kho na yod pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa de ji ltar drang zhe na /
translated: Well, if that is so, how do you interpret the statements in the scriptures that say that śrāvakas and so on have only the selflessness of persons?

original: 'o na de ltar na lung gzhan las /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na lung gzhan las /
translated: Well, in that case, how do you interpret the other scriptures that say:

original: khur khyer ba yi gang zag yod //
analyzed: khur khyer ba yi gang zag yod //
translated: There is a person who bears the burden.

original: rtag gam mi rtag brjod mi bya //
analyzed: rtag gam mi rtag brjod mi bya //
translated: One should not say whether it is permanent or impermanent.

original: zhes gsungs pas gang zag kyang yod pa nyid du gsungs par 'gyur bas de ji ltar drang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas gang zag kyang yod pa nyid du gsungs par 'gyur bas de ji ltar drang /
translated: Thus, since it would be said that the person also exists, how could this be interpreted?

original: gal te gang zag yod do zhes gsungs pa de bdag tu lta ba la mngon par zhen pa rnams gzhug pa'i don du gsungs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang zag yod do zhes gsungs pa de bdag tu lta ba la mngon par zhen pa rnams gzhug pa'i don du gsungs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the person exists, it is said for the purpose of introducing those who are attached to the view of self.

original: 'o na rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa la 'jug pa la skrag pa'i nyan thos la sogs pa rnams gzhug pa'i don du gang zag la bdag med pa gsungs pa yin pas gang zag gi bdag med pa gsungs pa de dgongs pa can yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa la 'jug pa la skrag pa'i nyan thos la sogs pa rnams gzhug pa'i don du gang zag la bdag med pa gsungs pa yin pas gang zag gi bdag med pa gsungs pa de dgongs pa can yin gyi /
translated: Well then, since the selflessness of the person is taught for the purpose of introducing those such as sravakas who are frightened of engaging in the understanding of the absence of nature, the teaching of the selflessness of the person is provisional.

original: don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not ultimate, there is not the slightest contradiction.

original: gal te 'di ni dgongs pa can ma yin no zhes rigs pa'i sgo nas shes pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'di ni dgongs pa can ma yin no zhes rigs pa'i sgo nas shes pa yin la /
translated: If it is known through reasoning that this is not provisional,

original: des nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa la rig pa gang zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: des nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa la rig pa gang zhig yod ce na /
translated: what is the knowledge that sravakas and so on have the understanding of selflessness?

original: de la lan du rigs pa'i sgo nas bdag med pa nyid yongs su shes pa yod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la lan du rigs pa'i sgo nas bdag med pa nyid yongs su shes pa yod pa bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In response to that, in order to prove that the understanding of selflessness exists,

original: phyi rol pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Like the non-Buddhists,” and so on.

original: phyi rol pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba bzhin du ste /🔽ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa med pa de bzhin du nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la yang khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa yod
analyzed: phyi rol pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba bzhin du ste / ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa med pa de bzhin du nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la yang khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa yod
translated: “ Like the non-Buddhists” means like those who are free from worldly attachment.

original: par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as those who are free from worldly attachment do not abandon the afflictions that are to be abandoned during the three realms, in the manner explained earlier, in the same way, the śrāvakas and so on do not abandon the afflictions that are to be abandoned during the three realms.

original: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bsten par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bsten par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for that, he says,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “The form and so on that are the objects of the afflictions,” and so on.

original: 'di'i don ni gal te nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la bdag med pa gnyis yongs su shes pa med la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la bdag med pa gnyis yongs su shes pa med la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows. If the śrāvakas and so on do not understand the two forms of selflessness,

original: bdag med pa tsam shes pa yod pa yin na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bdag med pa tsam shes pa yod pa yin na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: If there were knowledge of mere selflessness, then there would be no adherence to form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa yang phyin ci log yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa yang phyin ci log yin te /
translated: And adherence to form, etc. is a misconception.

original: rang las ma yin gzhan las ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mi 'thad @71a * //
analyzed: rang las ma yin gzhan las ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin mi 'thad @71a * //
translated: Since the nature of form, etc. is untenable, as will be explained by the reasoning in such passages as “Not from itself, nor from another,” etc.,

original: pas so // phyin ci log kyang log pa'i shes pa yin la log pa'i shes pas nyon mongs pa spong bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pas so // phyin ci log kyang log pa'i shes pa yin la log pa'i shes pas nyon mongs pa spong bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: and since misconception is a mistaken consciousness, it is not tenable that afflictions are abandoned by a mistaken consciousness.

original: gal te log pa'i shes pas nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur na phyi rol pa bdag tu smra ba bdag la mngon par zhen pas phyin ci log pa rnams kyis kyang nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te log pa'i shes pas nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur na phyi rol pa bdag tu smra ba bdag la mngon par zhen pas phyin ci log pa rnams kyis kyang nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If afflictions were abandoned by a mistaken consciousness, then non-Buddhists who propound a self and who are mistaken due to their adherence to a self would also abandon afflictions.

original: des na 'di ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ltar ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: des na nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa spong bar khas len na bdag med pa gnyis yongs su shes pa khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: des na nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa spong bar khas len na bdag med pa gnyis yongs su shes pa khas blang dgos so //
translated: Therefore, if one accepts that the afflictions of the śrāvakas and so on are eliminated, one must accept that they thoroughly know the two forms of selflessness.🔽Thus, if one does not thoroughly know the selflessness of phenomena, the afflictions will not be eliminated.

original: de ltar na chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa med na nyon mongs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod nas da ni chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa med na gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa nyid kyang med🔽pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa med na nyon mongs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod nas da ni chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa med na gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa nyid kyang med pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that if one does not thoroughly know the selflessness of phenomena, one will not even thoroughly know the selflessness of persons,

original: gang zag gi bdag med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “The selflessness of persons,” and so on.

original: gang zag gi bdag med pa ni bdag gi rang bzhin med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag med pa ni bdag gi rang bzhin med pa nyid yin la /
translated: The selflessness of persons is the absence of a self-nature of persons.

original: de rtogs pa ni yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The realization of that is thorough knowledge.

original: chos kyi bdag med ma rtogs na gang zag gi bdag med pa yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi bdag med ma rtogs na gang zag gi bdag med pa yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not realize the selflessness of phenomena, one will not realize the selflessness of persons.

original: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for that, he says,🔽“Because the selflessness of phenomena is more sublime.”

original: bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu phung po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu phung po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: Because the cause for designating a self focuses on the aggregates.

original: bdag tu tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba'i phung po gang yin pa de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di'i don ni 'dir gang bdag tu mngon par zhen pa 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ba'i phung po gang yin pa de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // 'di'i don ni 'dir gang bdag tu mngon par zhen pa 'jug pa ste /
translated: Because it focuses on the aggregates, which are the reason for designating a self.

original: mu stegs pas yongs su btags pa'i phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag rtag pa la dmigs nas 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mu stegs pas yongs su btags pa'i phung po las tha dad du gyur pa'i bdag rtag pa la dmigs nas 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Here, the conception of a self engages in relation to the aggregates, not in relation to a self that is different from the aggregates, as imagined by the tīrthikas.

original: bstan bcos mi shes pa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyang bdag tu zhen pa mi 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos mi shes pa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyang bdag tu zhen pa mi 'jug par thal bar 'gyur ba las /
translated: This is because it would follow that even foolish ordinary beings who do not know the treatises would not engage in the conception of a self.

original: 'on kyang phung po la mngon par zhen pa mngon du 'gro ba can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phung po la mngon par zhen pa mngon du 'gro ba can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis 'jug pa yin no //
translated: However, the conception of a self engages in relation to the aggregates due to the latent propensities for the conception of a self.

original: des na ji srid du phung po la mngon par zhen pa yod pa de srid du bdag la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags mi ldog pas bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na ji srid du phung po la mngon par zhen pa yod pa de srid du bdag la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags mi ldog pas bdag tu mngon par zhen pa ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, as long as there is manifest clinging to the aggregates, the habitual propensities of manifest clinging to a self will not be reversed, and thus manifest clinging to a self will not be reversed.

original: gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one will not understand the selflessness of the person.

original: des na gal te nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod par khas len na de'i tshe phung po rang bzhin med pa nyid du shes pa med na de 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la gang zag gi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod par khas len na de'i tshe phung po rang bzhin med pa nyid du shes pa med na de 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if one accepts that sravakas and so on understand the selflessness of the person, then, if they do not understand the aggregates to be essenceless, they will not accomplish that.

original: des na chos @71b kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa nyid du 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na chos @71b kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa nyid du 'grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that they understand the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnam pa gnyis khas len dgos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnam pa gnyis khas len dgos te /
translated: Moreover, one must accept that there are two kinds of views of the perishing aggregates:

original: kun tu brtags pa'i bdag la dmigs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i bdag la dmigs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: the imputed and the innate.

original: de la kun tu brtags pa'i bdag la dmigs pa gang yin pa de mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs su gang zag gi bdag med pa rtogs pas spong ba yin no //
analyzed: de la kun tu brtags pa'i bdag la dmigs pa gang yin pa de mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs su gang zag gi bdag med pa rtogs pas spong ba yin no //
translated: The self that is imagined is eliminated at the time of the path of seeing by the realization of the selflessness of persons.

original: gang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba de ni rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa med par ji ltar spong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba de ni rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa med par ji ltar spong bar 'gyur /
translated: How can the innate view of the transitory collection be eliminated without the realization of the absence of intrinsic existence?

original: gang la mi rtag pa la sogs pa bsgom pas spong zhe na /
analyzed: gang la mi rtag pa la sogs pa bsgom pas spong zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is eliminated by meditating on impermanence and so on,

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas phung po rang bzhin med pa mngon du byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa bsgoms pas phung po rang bzhin med pa mngon du byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Meditating on impermanence and so on does not make the aggregates’ lack of intrinsic existence manifest.

original: 'on kyang skad cig ma so so la mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang skad cig ma so so la mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: Rather, it is impermanence in the sense of momentariness.

original: des na bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu phung po yod pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na bdag tu gdags pa'i rgyu phung po yod pa'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since the aggregates, which are the basis for the designation of the self, exist, how can the innate view of the transitory collection be stopped?

original: gal te lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba yod du zin kyang thar pa thob par 'dod na 'o na mthong ba'i lam thob pa nyid kyis grol bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba yod du zin kyang thar pa thob par 'dod na 'o na mthong ba'i lam thob pa nyid kyis grol bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that one obtains liberation even though the innate view of the transitory aggregates exists, then it follows that one would be liberated merely by obtaining the path of seeing.

original: des na lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba spang ba'i don du chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa khas len dgos so //
analyzed: des na lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba spang ba'i don du chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa khas len dgos so //
translated: Therefore, one must accept that in order to abandon the innate view of the transitory aggregates, one must comprehend the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de ltar rigs pa'i sgo nas nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la bdag med pa gnyis yongs su shes pa yod par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa'i sgo nas nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la bdag med pa gnyis yongs su shes pa yod par grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, through reasoning, it is established that śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas comprehend the two types of selflessness.

original: bdag med pa gnyis yongs su shes pa la rin po che'i phreng ba'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis yongs su shes pa la rin po che'i phreng ba'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source for the comprehension of the two types of selflessness, he says

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “As it is said” and so on.

original: ji srid phung po la mngon par zhen pa yod pa de srid du bdag tu mngon par zhen pa yod de /
analyzed: ji srid phung po la mngon par zhen pa yod pa de srid du bdag tu mngon par zhen pa yod de /
translated: As long as there is manifest clinging to the aggregates, there is manifest clinging to a self,

original: phung po la mngon par zhen pas kun nas slong ba yin pas so //
analyzed: phung po la mngon par zhen pas kun nas slong ba yin pas so //
translated: because it is motivated by manifest clinging to the aggregates.

original: ngar 'dzin yod na yang las te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin yod na yang las te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is self-grasping, there is karma.

original: bdag yod na ni gzhan du shes //
analyzed: bdag yod na ni gzhan du shes //
translated: If there is self, there is the knowledge of other.🔽From the division of self and other, there is attachment and hostility.

original: bdag gzhan cha las chags dang sdang // de gnyis dang ni 'brel pa yi //
analyzed: bdag gzhan cha las chags dang sdang // de gnyis dang ni 'brel pa yi //
translated: From the connection with those two,

original: nyes pa thams cad rab tu 'byung //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad rab tu 'byung //
translated: all faults arise.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i tshul gyis ngar 'dzin yod na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa kun nas slong ba'i las byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i tshul gyis ngar 'dzin yod na 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa kun nas slong ba'i las byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is self-grasping, karma that motivates attachment, hostility, and so on arises.🔽From that, there is birth.

original: de las yang ni skye ba yin zhes bya ba ni las kyi stobs de las 'gro ba rnams su skye mched drug gi mtshan nyid can du skye ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de las yang ni skye ba yin zhes bya ba ni las kyi stobs de las 'gro ba rnams su skye mched drug gi mtshan nyid can du skye ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: From the power of karma, birth having the characteristics of the six bases arises in the various realms.🔽The wheel of samsara

original: lam gsum zhes bya ba ni dar @72a * //
analyzed: lam gsum zhes bya ba ni dar @72a * //
translated: has three paths:

original: 'dzin pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam gsum 'khor ba'i 'khor lo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi lam gsum 'khor ba'i 'khor lo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: the path of becoming, the path of karma, and the path of birth.

original: thog mtha' dbus med la zhes bya ba ni gang la dang po med pa de la thog ma med pa zhes bya la gang la tha ma med pa de la tha ma med pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: thog mtha' dbus med la zhes bya ba ni gang la dang po med pa de la thog ma med pa zhes bya la gang la tha ma med pa de la tha ma med pa zhes bya la /
translated: The phrase “without beginning, end, or middle” means that which has no beginning is said to be “without beginning,” and that which has no end is said to be “without end.”

original: de dag gi bar la dbus zhes bya bas de rnams 'di la don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi bar la dbus zhes bya bas de rnams 'di la don dam par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The interval between them is called the “middle.” They do not exist in this [samsara] ultimately,

original: phung po rnams rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aggregates are essenceless.

original: kun rdzob tu yang so so'i skye bo'i dbang du byas nas thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang so so'i skye bo'i dbang du byas nas thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, conventionally, from the perspective of ordinary beings, beginning, end, and middle do not exist.

original: 'di ltar thog ma yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar thog ma yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, there is no beginning,

original: rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because it would follow that there would be no cause.

original: tha ma yang med de /
analyzed: tha ma yang med de /
translated: There is also no end,

original: 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the noble path has not arisen.

original: thog mtha' med pa'i phyir dbus kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thog mtha' med pa'i phyir dbus kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no beginning or end, there is also no middle.

original: 'khor ba'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan du 'khor ba'i phung po lnga la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan du 'khor ba'i phung po lnga la brjod par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “the wheel of samsara” and so on refers to the five aggregates that transmigrate from one life to another.

original: de nyid 'khor lo ste 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan du 'khor ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de nyid 'khor lo ste 'gro ba nas 'gro ba gzhan du 'khor ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is a wheel because it revolves from one life to another.

original: / mgal me'i 'khor lo lta bu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / mgal me'i 'khor lo lta bu zhes bya ba la /
translated: Like a firebrand🔽The wheel of cyclic existence is like a firebrand🔽Because it is a false perception, like a firebrand

original: shing phyed tshig pa kun du bskor ba las 'khor lo'i rnam pa bzhin du 'khor ba'i 'khor lo yang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: shing phyed tshig pa kun du bskor ba las 'khor lo'i rnam pa bzhin du 'khor ba'i 'khor lo yang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: That is whirled around.

original: 'di'i don ni mgal me kun du bskor ba las 'khrul nas 'khor lor snang ba de bzhin du 'khor ba'i 'khor lo med du zin kyang ye shes kyi mig bgag pa dang / lta ba ngan par ltung ba la snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni mgal me kun du bskor ba las 'khrul nas 'khor lor snang ba de bzhin du 'khor ba'i 'khor lo med du zin kyang ye shes kyi mig bgag pa dang / lta ba ngan par ltung ba la snang ba yin no //
translated: The meaning is as follows: Just as a firebrand appears as a wheel due to delusion from whirling it around, likewise, although the wheel of cyclic existence does not exist, it appears to the eye of wisdom that is obstructed by the eye of ignorance and falls into bad views.

original: phan tshun gyi rgyu can 'di ni 'khor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni phung po la brten nas ngar 'dzin 'byung la ngar 'dzin la brten nas phung po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi rgyu can 'di ni 'khor bar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di ni phung po la brten nas ngar 'dzin 'byung la ngar 'dzin la brten nas phung po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is cyclic existence, which is mutually caused, because the apprehension of “I” arises in dependence on the aggregates and the aggregates arise in dependence on the apprehension of “I.”

original: phan tshun gyi rgyus 'gro ba lngar yongs su 'khor ba yin no /
analyzed: phan tshun gyi rgyus 'gro ba lngar yongs su 'khor ba yin no /
translated: Through mutual causality, one cycles in the five realms of sentient beings.

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo dang 'dra ba de nyid kyis 'khor ba'i 'khor lo yod pa ma yin pa nyid du brjod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo dang 'dra ba de nyid kyis 'khor ba'i 'khor lo yod pa ma yin pa nyid du brjod pa ma yin la /
translated: mere fact that it is like a firebrand wheel.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it says:🔽It is not arisen from itself, nor from another,🔽nor from other, nor from other and itself.

original: de ni rang bzhin gnyis ka dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gnyis ka dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is not without cause.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: “ It” refers to the wheel of cyclic existence.

original: rang zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams rang las skye ba nyid du ma dmigs te /
analyzed: rang zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams rang las skye ba nyid du ma dmigs te /
translated: “ Itself” refers to the fact that the aggregates are not observed to arise from

original: gang gi phyir rang las skyes na rang yod pa las skye ba yin nam /🔽'on te med pa las skye ba yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang las skyes na rang yod pa las skye ba yin nam / 'on te med pa las skye ba yin /
translated: themselves. If they arose from themselves, would they arise from themselves

original: yod pa las ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa las ma yin te /
translated: as existent or as nonexistent?🔽They do not arise from themselves as existent, because if they already exist🔽by way of their own natures, they do not need to arise again, and because it

original: rang gi rang bzhin yod pa yin na skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / rang gi bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro //🔽med pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin yod pa yin na skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / rang gi bdag nyid la bya ba 'gal ba'i phyir ro // med pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: is contradictory for something to act on itself.🔽They do not arise from themselves as nonexistent, because it is not tenable

original: med pa rgyu nyid du mi @72b 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rang las skye ba'i phyogs nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa rgyu nyid du mi @72b 'thad pa'i phyir dang / rang las skye ba'i phyogs nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that a nonexistent is a cause, and because this position contradicts the position🔽that they arise from themselves.

original: gzhan las kyang phung po skye ba ma dmigs te /🔽gang gi phyir gzhan las skye na rgyu las skye'am /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang phung po skye ba ma dmigs te / gang gi phyir gzhan las skye na rgyu las skye'am /
translated: Also, the aggregates do not arise from another, because

original: rgyu ma yin pa las skye /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa las skye /
translated: if they arose from another, would they arise from a cause or from a noncause?

original: gal te rgyu ma yin pa las skye na thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rgyu ma yin pa las skye na thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they arose from a noncause, then everything would arise from everything.

original: gal te rgyu las skye na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rgyu las skye na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If they arose from a cause, that also is not logical,

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu la ltos nas rgyu nyid du 'jog pa yin pas ji srid du 'bras bu ma skyes pa de nyid du rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu la ltos nas rgyu nyid du 'jog pa yin pas ji srid du 'bras bu ma skyes pa de nyid du rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu las 'bras bu skye ba ma yin no //
translated: because a cause is posited in dependence on an effect. As long as the effect has not arisen, it is not a cause, so the effect does not arise from a cause.

original: gnyis ka dang zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan dag las phung po skye ba ma dmigs te /
analyzed: gnyis ka dang zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan dag las phung po skye ba ma dmigs te /
translated: The aggregates do not arise from both self and another, because

original: phyogs gnyis ga la brjod pa'i skyon 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ga la brjod pa'i skyon 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the errors already mentioned would apply to both sides.

original: de ltar rang dang gzhan las skye ba bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang dang gzhan las skye ba bkag nas /
translated: Having thus refuted arising from self and from another,

original: dus gsum du skye ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dus gsum du skye ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to refute arising in the three temporal periods,🔽he says,

original: dus gsum nyid du'ang ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: dus gsum nyid du'ang ma mthong phyir //
translated: Because it is not seen in the three temporal periods.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su dngos su mi dmigs te med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus su dngos su mi dmigs te med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, the past and future times are not directly perceived, because they do not exist.

original: da ltar gyi dus du ma dmigs te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus du ma dmigs te /
translated: The present time is not perceived,

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from one and many.

original: ngar 'dzin pa ni zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa ni zad par 'gyur //
translated: The grasping of “I” is exhausted.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan dang / gnyis ka dang / dus gsum du phung po skye ba ma dmigs pa de'i tshe phun po la mngon par zhen pa log par gyur pas ngar 'dzin pa zad par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan dang / gnyis ka dang / dus gsum du phung po skye ba ma dmigs pa de'i tshe phun po la mngon par zhen pa log par gyur pas ngar 'dzin pa zad par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: When the arising of the aggregates in oneself, in another, in both, and in the three times is not perceived, then the adherence to the aggregates is reversed, and the grasping of “I” is exhausted.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa zad pa las so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni ngar 'dzin pa zad pa las so //
translated: Then, from the exhaustion of the grasping of “I,”

original: las dang skye ba'ang zhes bya ba ni las dang skye ba'ang zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las dang skye ba'ang zhes bya ba ni las dang skye ba'ang zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: karma and birth are also exhausted.

original: des na rin po che'i phreng ba las //
analyzed: des na rin po che'i phreng ba las //
translated: Therefore, in the Ratnavali,🔽it says:

original: phung po la mngon par zhen pa la ngar 'dzin pa 'byung la /
analyzed: phung po la mngon par zhen pa la ngar 'dzin pa 'byung la /
translated: The grasping of “I” arises from the adherence to the aggregates.

original: phung po la mngon par zhen pa zad nas ngar 'dzin pa zad par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phung po la mngon par zhen pa zad nas ngar 'dzin pa zad par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: and when attachment to the aggregates is exhausted, grasping “I” is exhausted.

original: de'i phyir gal te nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la ngar 'dzin pa zad par 'dod na phung po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med par khas blang dgos la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la ngar 'dzin pa zad par 'dod na phung po la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med par khas blang dgos la /
translated: Therefore, if one asserts that the śrāvakas and so on exhaust grasping “I,” one must accept that they do not have attachment to the aggregates and so on.

original: phung po la mngon par zhen pa med pas yang phung po rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: phung po la mngon par zhen pa med pas yang phung po rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pas so //
translated: And because they do not have attachment to the aggregates, they also fully understand that the aggregates lack intrinsic existence.

original: des na nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la yang chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod par khas len dgos so //
analyzed: des na nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la yang chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod par khas len dgos so //
translated: Therefore one must accept that even the śrāvakas and so on have the full understanding of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni rin po che'i phreng ba nyid las nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa nyid kyang gsungs so zhes @73a * //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni rin po che'i phreng ba nyid las nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa nyid kyang gsungs so zhes @73a * //
translated: “ Also” means that it is also taught in the Precious Garland that the śrāvakas and so on do have the full understanding of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, the text says:

original: mig ni 'khrul pa yis zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu yul la yod pa'i stobs kyis mig 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig ni 'khrul pa yis zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu yul la yod pa'i stobs kyis mig 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “The eye is deluded” means that the eye is deluded because of the power of the cause of delusion, the object.

original: dbang po rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “By the senses” means by the eye and so on.

original: da lta'i yul dag ces bya ba ni da ltar gyi gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da lta'i yul dag ces bya ba ni da ltar gyi gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The present objects” means present forms, sounds, and so on.

original: 'dzin par byed ces bya ba ni mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du ste /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed ces bya ba ni mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du ste /
translated: “Seizes” means like a whirling firebrand.

original: yul rnams rang bzhin med pa la da ltar gyi rang bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul rnams rang bzhin med pa la da ltar gyi rang bzhin du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it apprehends objects that are essenceless as present.

original: yul dang dbang po dag rang bzhin med pa la rigs pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dag rang bzhin med pa la rigs pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show by reasoning that objects and the senses are essenceless,

original: dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dbang po dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, “The senses and their objects,” and so on.

original: khyed kyis dbang po rnams dang / de'i yul du gyur pa'i don rnams 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: khyed kyis dbang po rnams dang / de'i yul du gyur pa'i don rnams 'byung ba rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: You accept that the senses and the objects that are their objects are forms that are derived from the elements.

original: gal te dbang po rnams dang / dbang po rnams kyi yul du gyur pa'i don gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gal te dbang po rnams dang / dbang po rnams kyi yul du gyur pa'i don gzugs la sogs pa rnams 'byung ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: If you maintain that the faculties and the objects of the faculties, such as form, etc. , have the nature of the elements,

original: sa dang / chu dang ; me dang / rlung gi rgyu can du 'dod na'o //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang ; me dang / rlung gi rgyu can du 'dod na'o //
translated: earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: 'byung ba so sor don med pas zhes bya ba ni re re zhing rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba so sor don med pas zhes bya ba ni re re zhing rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since each of the elements is meaningless, that is, since each is essenceless.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni 'byung ba la brten pa'i dbang po dang don rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni 'byung ba la brten pa'i dbang po dang don rnams so //
translated: These, that is, the faculties and objects that are based on the elements.

original: don du zhes bya ba ni don dam par te /
analyzed: don du zhes bya ba ni don dam par te /
translated: Are meaningless, that is, are ultimately.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad tsam du dbang po dang don dag 'dod pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad tsam du dbang po dang don dag 'dod pas so //
translated: Since the faculties and objects are accepted as mere worldly conventions.

original: don med do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: don med do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: Meaningless means essenceless.

original: rten med pa'i phyir brten pa med pas so //
analyzed: rten med pa'i phyir brten pa med pas so //
translated: Since there is no basis, there is no that which is based.

original: ji ltar rang bzhin med pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽'byung ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin med pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir / 'byung ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate how they are essenceless, he says:🔽The elements do not exist individually.

original: 'dir 'byung ba rnams so sor grub pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'dir 'byung ba rnams so sor grub pa yin nam /
translated: Here, are the elements individually established?

original: 'dres par gyur pa yin /
analyzed: 'dres par gyur pa yin /
translated: They are mixed.🔽🔽

original: de la so sor grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la so sor grub pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not established as distinct.

original: 'byung ba rnams so sor tha dad par grub pa yin na /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams so sor tha dad par grub pa yin na /
translated: If the elements were established as distinct,

original: bud shing med pa'i me thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bud shing med pa'i me thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: fire would exist without fuel,

original: bud shing la sogs pa la yod pa'i sa la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa nyid du grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bud shing la sogs pa la yod pa'i sa la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa nyid du grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would be established without depending on earth, etc., which exist in fuel.

original: gal te 'dres pas grub na de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te 'dres pas grub na de yang mi rigs te /
translated: If they were established as mixed, that also is not tenable.

original: 'byung ba rnams 'dres par gyur na so so'i mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams 'dres par gyur na so so'i mtshan nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the elements were mixed, it follows that they would not have their own characteristics.

original: de ltar na 'byung ba so so'i mtshan nyid med par 'dres par gyur pa ji lta ba yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na 'byung ba so so'i mtshan nyid med par 'dres par gyur pa ji lta ba yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that if the elements were mixed without their own characteristics, they would not exist.

original: lhag ma la yang de ltar nges //
analyzed: lhag ma la yang de ltar nges //
translated: The rest are also ascertained in the same way.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar me la so sor ma 'dres par ma grub pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar me la so sor ma 'dres par ma grub pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as fire is not established as distinct or unmixed,

original: sa la sogs pa lhag @73b ma rnams la yang so so 'am 'dres pa ma grub pa nyid du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa lhag @73b ma rnams la yang so so 'am 'dres pa ma grub pa nyid du nges pa yin te /
translated: the rest, such as earth, are also ascertained as not established as distinct or mixed.

original: 'di ltar gal te so so grub par gyur na de'i tshe sa sra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rlan pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can chu la sogs pa la mi ltos par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te so so grub par gyur na de'i tshe sa sra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rlan pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can chu la sogs pa la mi ltos par grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: As such, if they were to exist individually, then at that time, since earth would be solidity, it would not depend on the nature of water, etc., which are wetness, etc.

original: des na so sor grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na so sor grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they do not exist individually.

original: 'dres par grub na ;
analyzed: 'dres par grub na ;
translated: If they were to exist in combination,

original: 'dus na mtshan nyid med 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'dus na mtshan nyid med 'gyur te //
translated: then they would lack defining characteristics.

original: zhes sngar bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes sngar bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: As before, this should be stated.

original: de bzhin du chu'i khams la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i khams la sogs pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, this should be stated for the water element, etc.

original: de ltar 'byung ba rnams rang bzhin med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba rnams rang bzhin med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having demonstrated that the elements are essenceless,
