original: 'byung ba rnams rang bzhin med par mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas dbang po rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams rang bzhin med par mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas dbang po rnams rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate that the faculties are essenceless by way of a summary of the essencelessness of the elements,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Just like the elements,” and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “ In that way” refers to the method of demonstration above.

original: 'byung ba rnams gnyis su yang don med pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams so so dang 'dres par ma grub pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pas so //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams gnyis su yang don med pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams so so dang 'dres par ma grub pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pas so //
translated: The expression “the elements are also meaningless as a duality” means that the elements are devoid of intrinsic reality because they are not established either individually or in combination.

original: 'dus pa don med ces bya ba ni 'byung ba bzhi po rnams rang bzhin med pa'i phyir 'byung ba bzhi po rnams 'dus pa rang bzhin med pa'o //🔽'dus pa don med nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: 'dus pa don med ces bya ba ni 'byung ba bzhi po rnams rang bzhin med pa'i phyir 'byung ba bzhi po rnams 'dus pa rang bzhin med pa'o // 'dus pa don med nyid kyi phyir //
translated: The expression “the combination is meaningless” means that the combination of the four elements is devoid of intrinsic reality because the four elements are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa rang bzhin med pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dus pa rang bzhin med pas so //
translated: The expression “because of the meaninglessness of the combination” means that the combination is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: gzugs kyang zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba bzhi la brten pa'i gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang ; reg bya'i bdag nyid can rgyur byas pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyang zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba bzhi la brten pa'i gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang ; reg bya'i bdag nyid can rgyur byas pa'i gzugs so //
translated: The expression “form also” refers to derivative form, which has the nature of color, odor, taste, and contact, and which is based on the four elements.

original: don du zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin du'o //
analyzed: don du zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin du'o //
translated: The expression “in reality” has the same meaning as before.

original: don med do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa la brten pa la rang bzhin yod pa nyid du ji ltar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don med do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa la brten pa la rang bzhin yod pa nyid du ji ltar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The expression “is meaningless” means that it is meaningless for that which is devoid of intrinsic reality to be based on that which is not devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: de ltar gzugs kyi phung po rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs kyi phung po rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the aggregate of form to be essenceless,

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the aggregates of consciousness and so on to be essenceless,

original: rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Consciousness,” and so on.

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i yul so sor rig pa tsam ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i yul so sor rig pa tsam ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The mere awareness of individual objects such as blue and yellow is the aggregate of consciousness.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / btang snyoms nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / btang snyoms nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba'i phung po'o //
translated: The experience of pleasure, pain, and neutrality is the aggregate of feeling.

original: sems las byung ba sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa de ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa de ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: The mental factor that apprehends the signs of blue, yellow, and so on is the aggregate of discrimination.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa las tha dad du gyur pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems @74a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa las tha dad du gyur pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems @74a * //
translated: The aggregate of compositional factors is the mental factors that are different from form, feeling, discrimination, and consciousness, and are concomitant with the mind.

original: pa la sogs pa dang / sems dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i thob pa la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa dang / sems dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i thob pa la sogs pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: and so on, and the obtainment of the aggregates of form and so on, and the obtainment of the aggregates of feeling and so on, and the obtainment of the aggregates of discrimination and so on, and the obtainment of the aggregates of compositional factors that are not concomitant with the mind, such as memory and so on, are the aggregate of compositional factors.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan la sogs pa las skye ba med pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan la sogs pa las skye ba med pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: “ In all ways” means from the perspective of not arising from self, other, and so on.

original: so sor zhes pa ni phung po re re la'o //
analyzed: so sor zhes pa ni phung po re re la'o //
translated: “ Individually” means for each of the aggregates.

original: bdag nyid don med phyir zhes bya ba ni phung po so so la rang bzhin med pas so //🔽dam pa'i don du don med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid don med phyir zhes bya ba ni phung po so so la rang bzhin med pas so // dam pa'i don du don med do //
translated: “ Because each of the selves is meaningless” means that each of the aggregates lacks intrinsic existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam par phung po bzhi po rnams la rang bzhin med de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam par phung po bzhi po rnams la rang bzhin med de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ In reality, they are meaningless” means that ultimately the four aggregates lack intrinsic existence.

original: de ltar phung po rnams rang bzhin med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phung po rnams rang bzhin med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that the aggregates lack intrinsic existence,

original: da ni phung po rnams rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis ka med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni phung po rnams rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis ka med pa'i phyir /
translated: now, through the understanding that the aggregates lack intrinsic existence, because neither pleasure nor suffering exist,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang bral ba'i sred pa log pas grol bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang bral ba'i sred pa log pas grol bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one is liberated by the cessation of craving for pleasure and for separation from pain,

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Just as one who is hungry and thirsty, etc.”

original: rigs pas tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pas tshor ba bde ba dang sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa ste /
translated: By reason of the non-existence of pleasure and pain, one is proud of satisfaction, etc., which is the remedy for the pain of hunger, thirst, etc.,

original: kha zas la sogs pas byas pa'i tshim pa la sogs pa la nga rgyal byed pa'o //
analyzed: kha zas la sogs pas byas pa'i tshim pa la sogs pa la nga rgyal byed pa'o //
translated: and which is produced by food, drink, etc.

original: don du zhes bya ba ni rigs pas so //🔽de bzhin du tshim pa la sogs pa'i bde ba 'joms /
analyzed: don du zhes bya ba ni rigs pas so // de bzhin du tshim pa la sogs pa'i bde ba 'joms /
translated: “In reality” means by reason.🔽Similarly, one is proud of the pain of the destruction of satisfaction, etc.,

original: bkres pa la sogs pa las sdug bsngal du nga rgyal rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pa las sdug bsngal du nga rgyal rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: and of the pain from hunger, etc.

original: bde dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa las bdag bde ba dang ldan par gyur cig snyam pa'i bde ba dang phrad pa'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: bde dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa las bdag bde ba dang ldan par gyur cig snyam pa'i bde ba dang phrad pa'i srid pa'o //
translated: “One who is happy” is the craving for contact with pleasure, thinking, “May I be happy!”

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis phung po rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pas so //
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis phung po rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pas so //
translated: Thus, because of the lack of intrinsic reality, by the knowledge of the aggregates as essenceless in the manner previously explained,

original: sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i sred pa spong zhes bya ba ni bdag sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar gyur cig snyam pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i sred pa rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i sred pa spong zhes bya ba ni bdag sdug bsngal ba dang bral bar gyur cig snyam pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i sred pa rab tu spong ngo //
translated: one abandons the craving for freedom from suffering, i.e., the craving for freedom from suffering, thinking, “May I be free from suffering!”

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of the discrimination of pleasure and suffering.

original: de ltar mthong bas zhes bya ba ni srid pa rnam pa gnyis rang bzhin med pa nyid du yongs su shes pas spong bar 'gyur pa nyid du yongs su mthong bas so //
analyzed: de ltar mthong bas zhes bya ba ni srid pa rnam pa gnyis rang bzhin med pa nyid du yongs su shes pas spong bar 'gyur pa nyid du yongs su mthong bas so //
translated: Thus, by seeing, i.e., by seeing that the two kinds of existence are abandoned by the thorough knowledge of their lack of intrinsic reality,

original: grol zhes bya ba ni sred pa las byung ba'i skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grol zhes bya ba ni sred pa las byung ba'i skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one is liberated, i.e., because there is no birth that arises from craving.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag dang rang bzhin med par rtogs nas 'di dag ni mngon par zhen pa yin no snyam du yongs su shes nas /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag dang rang bzhin med par rtogs nas 'di dag ni mngon par zhen pa yin no snyam du yongs su shes nas /
translated: Having realized that pleasure and pain are essenceless, one fully understands that they are just misapprehensions.

original: de dag la srid pa log pas skye ba zad @74b nas grol bar 'gyur ro zhes pas so //
analyzed: de dag la srid pa log pas skye ba zad @74b nas grol bar 'gyur ro zhes pas so //
translated: Since one reverses the process of becoming in regard to them, birth is exhausted and one is liberated.

original: gang gis mthong bar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba 'dis gzhan gyi dogs pa bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis mthong bar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba 'dis gzhan gyi dogs pa bsdu ba ste /
translated: This is the reply to the question, “By what means will one see?”

original: 'di ltar khyed kyis sa rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pas sred pa gnyis spong bar 'gyur bas grol bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed kyis sa rang bzhin med par yongs su shes pas sred pa gnyis spong bar 'gyur bas grol bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: In this way, you have said that by fully understanding that the earth is essenceless, one abandons the two cravings and is liberated.

original: khyod kyis 'dod pas shes pa po med pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: khyod kyis 'dod pas shes pa po med pa'i phyir ;
translated: But since you assert that there is no knower,

original: gang gis mthong ba yin snyam nas 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis mthong ba yin snyam nas 'dri ba'o //
translated: we ask, “By what means will one see?”

original: de la lan ni tha snyad du ni sems la brjod ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la lan ni tha snyad du ni sems la brjod ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The reply to that is “Conventionally, it is said to be the mind.”

original: 'jig rten pa la ltos nas sems kyis mthong ngo zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la ltos nas sems kyis mthong ngo zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: In dependence on the world, it is said that the mind sees.

original: ci'i phyir don dam par sems kyis mthong ngo zhes mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir don dam par sems kyis mthong ngo zhes mi brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it not said that ultimately mind sees?

original: sems phyung med par sems med de //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems phyung med par sems med de // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because without the mind, there is no mental activity.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams med na sems kyang med do //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa sems las byung ba rnams med na sems kyang med do //
translated: If there is no mental activity such as feeling, there is no mind.

original: des na sems las byung ba la ltos nas sems yod par 'jog pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gcig tu grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sems las byung ba la ltos nas sems yod par 'jog pa yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis gcig tu grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, mind is posited as existent in dependence on mental activity, but it is not established as one by virtue of its own nature.

original: gang ltos pa'i rang bzhin can de ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang ltos pa'i rang bzhin can de ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which has a nature that depends on another does not exist by virtue of its own nature.

original: chu'i dro ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chu'i dro ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the heat of water.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: rang bzhin bcos ma ma yin zhing gzhan la ltos pa'ang ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin bcos ma ma yin zhing gzhan la ltos pa'ang ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that nature is not fabricated and does not depend on another.

original: don med phyir na zhes bya ba ni sems rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med phyir na zhes bya ba ni sems rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is meaningless means because mind is essenceless.

original: yod mi 'dod ces bya ba ni don dam par sems yod pa nyid du mi 'dod pas don dam par na mthong bar mi 'dod do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yod mi 'dod ces bya ba ni don dam par sems yod pa nyid du mi 'dod pas don dam par na mthong bar mi 'dod do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is not asserted to exist means that because it is not asserted that mind ultimately exists, it is not asserted that ultimately it sees.

original: rgol ba'i lan btab nas /
analyzed: rgol ba'i lan btab nas /
translated: Having responded to the objections,

original: sngar bstan pa'i grol ba rgyas par bshad pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i grol ba rgyas par bshad pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the extensive explanation of the previously taught liberation,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Thus, etc.”

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: “ Thus” means in the manner previously taught.

original: yang dag ji bzhin du zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro //
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin du zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro //
translated: “ Just as it is” means in the ultimate sense.

original: 'gro ba don med ces bya ba ni 'gro ba rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs nas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba don med ces bya ba ni 'gro ba rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs nas so //
translated: “ The world is meaningless” means that having realized the world to be essenceless.

original: rgyu med pa'i me bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bud shing log pas me ldog pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i me bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bud shing log pas me ldog pa bzhin du'o //
translated: “ Like a fire without a cause” means just as fire is stopped by the cessation of fuel.

original: gnas med ces bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten rang bzhin med pas so //
analyzed: gnas med ces bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten rang bzhin med pas so //
translated: “ Without a location” means that the world of the environment is essenceless.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: gang phyir dngos dang dngos med pa //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos dang dngos med pa //
translated: since neither entity nor nonentity

original: blo yi mdun na mi gnas pa //
analyzed: blo yi mdun na mi gnas pa //
translated: remain before the mind,

original: de tshe dmigs pa gzhan med pas //🔽dmigs pa med par rab tu zhi //
analyzed: de tshe dmigs pa gzhan med pas // dmigs pa med par rab tu zhi //
translated: at that time, since there is no other object,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is pacified without an object.

original: 'di'i don ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la yang chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sred pa zad pas grol bar 'gyur ba nyid du brjod pa yin no //🔽des na nyan thos la sogs pa la yang @75a * //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la yang chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba la sred pa zad pas grol bar 'gyur ba nyid du brjod pa yin no // des na nyan thos la sogs pa la yang @75a * //
translated: The meaning of this is that even the śrāvakas and so on are liberated by the extinction of craving for pleasure and pain through the complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa nyid du 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa nyid du 'grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is established that even the śrāvakas and so on have the complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de la gzhan gyi rgol ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi rgol ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To present the opponent’s response to that, it says:🔽“But if you say that the complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena🔽is taught for the bodhisattvas,🔽how is it established that the śrāvakas and so on have the complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena?”

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is as follows:🔽“The complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena🔽is taught for the bodhisattvas,

original: rin po che'i phreng ba las rang bzhin med par mthong ba gang gsungs pa de byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rin po che'i phreng ba las rang bzhin med par mthong ba gang gsungs pa de byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: but the complete understanding of the selflessness of persons

original: nyan thos la sogs pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa la ma yin no //
translated: is taught for the śrāvakas and so on.”🔽The complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena🔽is taught for the bodhisattvas,🔽but the complete understanding of the selflessness of persons

original: des na nyan thos la sogs pa la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod par ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: des na nyan thos la sogs pa la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod par ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: is taught for the śrāvakas and so on.

original: de la lan ni de yang yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la lan ni de yang yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is “That also does not exist” and so on.

original: de skad du gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /🔽ji ltar mig ni 'khrul pa yis //
analyzed: de skad du gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni / ji ltar mig ni 'khrul pa yis //
translated: “Because it is said” means

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: “Just as the eye is deluded” and so on.

original: 'di ji ltar shes she na zhes bya ba ni nyan thos pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin par ji ltar shes she na'o //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes she na zhes bya ba ni nyan thos pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin par ji ltar shes she na'o //
translated: How do we know that?

original: lan ni brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te'o //
analyzed: lan ni brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te'o //
translated: The response is “It should be stated” and so on.

original: mjug thogs kho nar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mjug thogs kho nar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Immediately after” means

original: rgyu med pa ni me bzhin du //
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni me bzhin du //
translated: “Without a cause, like fire,

original: gnas med len med mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: gnas med len med mya ngan 'da' //
translated: without a basis, without appropriation, nirvana.”

original: zhes gsungs pa de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa de ma thag tu'o //
translated: This is stated immediately after.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpas kyang mthong nas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis rang bzhin med pa nyid du mthong nas so //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpas kyang mthong nas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis rang bzhin med pa nyid du mthong nas so //
translated: “In that way, the bodhisattva also sees” means that he sees the absence of intrinsic existence in the way that was explained above.

original: byang chub nges par 'dod ces bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar nges par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub nges par 'dod ces bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar nges par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “They definitely desire enlightenment” means they definitely desire nirvana.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi mdzad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi mdzad ce na /
translated: Why then do they not attain nirvana?🔽The answer is:

original: lan ni / de ni 'on kyang snying rje yis //
analyzed: lan ni / de ni 'on kyang snying rje yis //
translated: But they are reborn in existence through compassion

original: byang chub bar du srid mtshams sbyor //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: byang chub bar du srid mtshams sbyor // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: until they attain enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la skye ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa'i snying rjes sems can gyi don du 'khor bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la skye ba thog ma med pa nas goms pa'i snying rjes sems can gyi don du 'khor bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas remain in cyclic existence for the welfare of living beings through their compassion, which they have cultivated from beginningless time.

original: gal te sngar gsungs pa'i gzhung byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin na de'i tshe de ltar byang chub sems dpas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bye brag tu gsungs pa don med par 'gyur ro
analyzed: gal te sngar gsungs pa'i gzhung byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin na de'i tshe de ltar byang chub sems dpas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bye brag tu gsungs pa don med par 'gyur ro
translated: If the above passage was spoken with reference to the bodhisattvas, then it would be meaningless to specify the bodhisattvas in the passage, “In that case, the bodhisattvas . . .”

original: // kyang gi sgra yang don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // kyang gi sgra yang don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word “also” would be meaningless.

original: de'i phyir sngar gsungs pa'i gzhung ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar gsungs pa'i gzhung ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the former passage was spoken with reference to the śrāvakas, etc.,

original: phyis gsungs pa'i gzhung ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyis gsungs pa'i gzhung ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and the latter passage was spoken with reference to the bodhisattvas.

original: de na nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la yang chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes @75b pa yod pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de na nyan thos la sogs pa rnams la yang chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes @75b pa yod pa nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is established that even the śrāvakas, etc., have the complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: rin po che'i phreng ba kho na las nyan thos la sogs pa la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod par gsungs par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rin po che'i phreng ba kho na las nyan thos la sogs pa la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod par gsungs par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it stated in the Precious Garland that the śrāvakas, etc., have the complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena,🔽but it is also stated in the sūtras of the śrāvakas.

original: 'on kyang nyan thos kyi mdo las kyang mthong ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang nyan thos kyi mdo las kyang mthong ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,

original: nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “In the Śrāvaka-piṭaka,” and so on.

original: ji ltar dbu brdos par snang gi de'i nang na snying po yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu brdos par snang gi de'i nang na snying po yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du gzugs kyi phung por rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as a lump of foam appears but has no essence, so should you understand the aggregate of form.

original: ci ltar chu'i nang du chu bur skad cig ma dang po snying po med par mthong ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phung por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ltar chu'i nang du chu bur skad cig ma dang po snying po med par mthong ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phung por rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as a water bubble is seen to be without any core in the water, so should the aggregate of consciousness be understood.

original: ci ltar chu ltar snang ba'i smig rgyu de thag ring po nas mthong gi nye ba nas mi mthong ba de bzhin du 'du shes kyi phung por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ltar chu ltar snang ba'i smig rgyu de thag ring po nas mthong gi nye ba nas mi mthong ba de bzhin du 'du shes kyi phung por rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as a mirage that appears as water is seen from a distance but not when one gets close, so should the aggregate of perception be understood.

original: ci ltar chu shing gi sdong po rnam par phye na snying po cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'du byed kyi phung por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ltar chu shing gi sdong po rnam par phye na snying po cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'du byed kyi phung por rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as a plantain tree is seen to have no core when it is cut open, so should the aggregate of compositional factors be understood.

original: ci ltar sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam pa mthong ba yin la de yang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phung por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ltar sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam pa mthong ba yin la de yang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i phung por rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as the appearance of an illusory elephant, etc. is seen but does not exist, so should the aggregate of consciousness be understood.

original: 'du byed rnams nges par dpyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnam par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams nges par dpyad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnam par dpyad pa'o //
translated: The analysis of compositional factors is finished. The analysis of the aggregate of form, etc. is finished.

original: yang na rin po che'i phreng ba'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na rin po che'i phreng ba'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Or else, in order to indicate the source of the Ratnāvalī,

original: don 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says this very meaning, etc.

original: don 'di nyid ces bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ces bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: This very meaning is the characteristic of the existence of the understanding of objective selflessness by śrāvakas, etc.

original: theg pa chen po dbu ma pas gang dngos po rnams gdod ma nas skye ba med pa de kho na la stong pa nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po dbu ma pas gang dngos po rnams gdod ma nas skye ba med pa de kho na la stong pa nyid ces brjod do //
translated: The Mādhyamikas of the Mahāyāna call that very non-arising of things from the beginning emptiness.

original: nyan thos pa rnams kyis dngos po rnams rang bzhin la mi gnas pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do zhes brjod cing zad pa la stong pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: nyan thos pa rnams kyis dngos po rnams rang bzhin la mi gnas pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do zhes brjod cing zad pa la stong pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: The śrāvakas say that things are empty because they do not abide in their nature, and they say that exhaustion is emptiness.

original: zad dang mi skye don du ni //
analyzed: zad dang mi skye don du ni //
translated: In reality, exhaustion and non-arising

original: gcig pa de'i phyir bzod par gyis //
analyzed: gcig pa de'i phyir bzod par gyis //
translated: are the same. Therefore, be patient.

original: zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa dang zad pa dang gcig pa ma yin par yid la gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa dang zad pa dang gcig pa ma yin par yid la gyis shig pa'o //
translated: This means that one should not think that non-arising and exhaustion are not the same.

original: gal te rang bzhin yod na de la zad pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin yod na de la zad pa mi rigs te /
translated: If there were intrinsic nature, exhaustion would be illogical.

original: me'i rang bzhin dro ba de nam yang zad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: me'i rang bzhin dro ba de nam yang zad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The nature of fire, heat, never ceases.

original: me la dro ba ma yin pa med pas so //
analyzed: me la dro ba ma yin pa med pas so //
translated: Because fire is never not hot.

original: des na dngos po zad par khas len na de'i tshe dngos po rnams dang po nas rang bzhin med par khas len dgos so //
analyzed: des na dngos po zad par khas len na de'i tshe dngos po rnams dang po nas rang bzhin med par khas len dgos so //
translated: Therefore, if one accepts that things cease, then at that time one must accept that things are essenceless from the beginning.

original: des na zad pa dang mi skye ba dag don gcig yin no //🔽des na nyan thos pa rnams kyis kyang zad pa khas len na chos thams cad rang bzhin med par @76a * //
analyzed: des na zad pa dang mi skye ba dag don gcig yin no // des na nyan thos pa rnams kyis kyang zad pa khas len na chos thams cad rang bzhin med par @76a * //
translated: Therefore, cessation and nonarising are synonyms.

original: khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the sravakas accept cessation, then they accept that all phenomena are essenceless.

original: yang nyan thos kyi mdo tshad ma nyid du 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi tshigs su bcad pa'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang nyan thos kyi mdo tshad ma nyid du 'phags pa klu sgrub zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i dbu ma rtsa ba'i shes rab kyi tshigs su bcad pa'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the sravakas' scriptures are valid by means of the verses of the noble Nagarjuna's Fundamental Treatise on the Middle Way, he says:

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Bhagavan said,

original: k'a ty'a ya na'i gdams ngag las ni zhes bya ba ni dge slong k'a ty'a ya na'i gdams ngag gnas pa las /
analyzed: k'a ty'a ya na'i gdams ngag las ni zhes bya ba ni dge slong k'a ty'a ya na'i gdams ngag gnas pa las /
translated: In the instructions of Katyayana,

original: yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka dgag par mdzad ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag dgag par mdzad de /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka dgag par mdzad ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag dgag par mdzad de /
translated: The statement “He refutes both existence and nonexistence” means that the Bhagavān refutes the conception of existence and the conception of nonexistence.

original: 'di ltar k'a ty'a yan la gdams ngag gsungs pa'i mdo las ;
analyzed: 'di ltar k'a ty'a yan la gdams ngag gsungs pa'i mdo las ;
translated: Thus, the Sūtra of Instruction to Kātyāyana says:

original: k'a ty'a ya na gang gi phyir 'jig rten 'di phal cher yod pa de nyid dang med pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa des skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang /
analyzed: k'a ty'a ya na gang gi phyir 'jig rten 'di phal cher yod pa de nyid dang med pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa des skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang /
translated: Kātyāyana, because this world is mostly attached to existence and nonexistence, it is not liberated from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i sgo nas yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur ba dang / 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur ba dang / pha ma 'chi ba la gdung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba'i sgo nas yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur ba dang / 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba las kyang yongs su grol bar mi 'gyur ba dang / pha ma 'chi ba la gdung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: suffering, unhappiness, and agitation, and it is not liberated from the cycle of the five types of living beings, and it is not liberated from the suffering of the death of parents and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: mdo 'di sde pa thams cad kyis khas len pa yin la /
analyzed: mdo 'di sde pa thams cad kyis khas len pa yin la /
translated: This sutra is accepted by all schools.

original: des na nyan thos rnams kyis yod pa dang / med pa dgag pa khas len na chos kyi bdag med pa nyid khas len dgos so //
analyzed: des na nyan thos rnams kyis yod pa dang / med pa dgag pa khas len na chos kyi bdag med pa nyid khas len dgos so //
translated: Therefore, if the sravakas accept the refutation of existence and nonexistence, they must accept the selflessness of dharmas.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it for the Lord?

original: dngos dang dngos po med mkhyen pas //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos dang dngos po med mkhyen pas // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He is the knower of things and nonthings.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa mkhyen pa ni bcom ldan 'das kho na la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa mkhyen pa ni bcom ldan 'das kho na la brjod par bya'o //
translated: The knower of things and nonthings as they are should be said to be the Lord alone.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mkhyen pa yang de dag la rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mkhyen pa yang de dag la rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The knower of things and nonthings is also nonconceptual with regard to them.

original: de ltar nyan thos la sogs pa la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa yin no zhes rab tu bsgrubs nas gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar nyan thos la sogs pa la chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa yin no zhes rab tu bsgrubs nas gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having proven that the sravakas and so on have the understanding of the selflessness of phenomena, in order to anticipate another qualm, he says,

original: gang zhig gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If someone should say,

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'o //
translated: The someone is the sravaka vehicle.

original: theg pa chen po bstan pa don dam par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa las chos la bdag med pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bstan pa don dam par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa las chos la bdag med pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of the Great Vehicle is ultimate, because the selflessness of phenomena is taught in the Vehicle of the Listeners.

original: theg pa chen po bstan pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po bstan pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod ces pa'i don to //
translated: What is the purpose of teaching the Great Vehicle?

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: de'i lugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i lugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “That system” and so on.

original: de'i zhes bya @76b ba ni theg pa chen po bstan pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya @76b ba ni theg pa chen po bstan pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de'i'o //
translated: “That” refers to the statement that the teaching of the Great Vehicle would be pointless.

original: rigs pa dang lung dang 'gal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung dang 'gal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the contradiction with reasoning and scripture,

original: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽sa dang zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa bcu'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / sa dang zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa bcu'o //
translated: he says “the Great Vehicle” and so on.🔽“The stages” are the ten such as the Joyous.

original: pha rol phyin pa dang zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'o //
analyzed: pha rol phyin pa dang zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'o //
translated: “The perfections” are the ten perfections such as generosity.

original: smon lam dang zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i mdo la sogs pa las gsungs pa'i 'di ltar gyur cig /'di ltar gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa 'gro ba'i don gyi 'dod pa khyad par can no //
analyzed: smon lam dang zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i mdo la sogs pa las gsungs pa'i 'di ltar gyur cig /'di ltar gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs pa 'gro ba'i don gyi 'dod pa khyad par can no //
translated: Aspiration is the special wish for the welfare of beings, such as May this be! May this not be! as taught in the Sutra on the Ten Stages and so forth.

original: snying rje chen po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the objective support of all sentient beings.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nyams su blangs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nyams su blangs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word and so forth includes the practice of the perfections.

original: yongs su bsngo ba dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: Dedication is the dedication of the roots of virtue to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: tshogs gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The two collections are the collection of merit and the collection of wisdom.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos nyid dang zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang yin te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos nyid dang zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi chos nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang yin te /
translated: The inconceivable reality is the inconceivable reality of phenomena.

original: dper na / chu bo gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed pa //
analyzed: dper na / chu bo gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed pa //
translated: “As many grains of sand as there are in the river Ganges,

original: skra gcig khyon la ji snyed sangs rgyas mang po bzhugs //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: skra gcig khyon la ji snyed sangs rgyas mang po bzhugs // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: so many Buddhas reside in the space of a single hair.”

original: 'di'i don ni gal te theg pa chen po la chos kyi bdag med pa tsam bstan par gyur na de'i tshe theg pa chen po bstan pa don med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gal te theg pa chen po la chos kyi bdag med pa tsam bstan par gyur na de'i tshe theg pa chen po bstan pa don med par 'gyur la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the Mahayana were to teach only the selflessness of phenomena, then the teaching of the Mahayana would be pointless.

original: 'on kyang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa gzhan yang bsten pa yin pas rigs pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa gzhan yang bsten pa yin pas rigs pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: But since it also teaches the levels, the perfections, and so on, it contradicts reason.

original: don 'di mdo las kyang mthong ba'i phyir mdo dang yang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: don 'di mdo las kyang mthong ba'i phyir mdo dang yang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Since this meaning is also seen in the sutras, it also contradicts the sutras.

original: don 'di la rgyal po la gdams pa rin po che'i phreng ba'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di la rgyal po la gdams pa rin po che'i phreng ba'i khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the source of this meaning in the Instructions to a King,

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says “as it is said,” and so on.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pas nyan thos kyi theg pa'i sangs rgyas nyid thob pa yin pas theg pa chen pos ci zhig bya zhes 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pas nyan thos kyi theg pa'i sangs rgyas nyid thob pa yin pas theg pa chen pos ci zhig bya zhes 'dri ba yin no //
translated: The question is: “Why the Mahāyāna? Since one attains the enlightenment of the śrāvaka vehicle by means of the śrāvaka vehicle, what is the use of the Mahāyāna?”

original: de la lan ni /
analyzed: de la lan ni /
translated: The answer to that is:

original: nyan thos theg pa de las ni //
analyzed: nyan thos theg pa de las ni //
translated: In that śrāvaka vehicle

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.🔽The śrāvaka vehicle does not teach the bodhisattva’s aspirational prayers that were taught above,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa sngar bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rnams ma bshad pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa @77a * //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa sngar bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rnams ma bshad pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa @77a * //
translated: it does not teach the practice of the perfections,

original: yang ma bshad pa dang / sngar bstan pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yang ma bshad do //
analyzed: yang ma bshad pa dang / sngar bstan pa'i yongs su bsngo ba yang ma bshad do //
translated: and it does not teach the dedication that was taught above.

original: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pas byang chub sems dpar ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pas byang chub sems dpar ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how can one become a bodhisattva by means of the śrāvaka vehicle?

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' yang mi thob na de'i tshe sangs rgyas nyid ji ltar thob /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' yang mi thob na de'i tshe sangs rgyas nyid ji ltar thob /
translated: If one does not even attain the state of a bodhisattva, then how can one attain buddhahood?

original: theg pa chen po la thams cad yod pa'i phyir de kho na sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la thams cad yod pa'i phyir de kho na sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Since everything is in the Mahāyāna, only by means of that will one attain buddhahood.

original: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽byang chub spyod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir / byang chub spyod la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach that in detail, he says:

analyzed: byang chub kyi don du spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la 'jug pa'i bya ba'o // de la gnas pa ni rgyun gyis gnas pa'o // de'i don du nyan thos kyi theg par ma gsungs la /
translated: The wise who are engaged in the practice of enlightenment,🔽who are endowed with the means, who are skilled in the methods,

analyzed: theg pa chen por ni gsungs pa'i phyir theg pa chen po mkhas pa ste /
translated: who are steadfast in the Great Vehicle,🔽who are endowed with the knowledge of the scriptures,🔽who are skilled in the methods of the stages,🔽who are endowed with the knowledge of the stages,🔽who are skilled in the knowledge of the stages,

analyzed: blang dor ldan pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi gsung nyid du gzung ba yin no zhes pa'i don to // 'dis ni theg pa chen pos smon lam la sogs pa lhag pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: who are endowed with the knowledge of the stages,🔽who are skilled in the knowledge of the stages,🔽who are endowed with the knowledge of the stages,🔽who are skilled in the knowledge of the stages,🔽who are endowed with the knowledge of the stages,🔽who are skilled in the knowledge of the stages,

analyzed: da ni chos kyi bdag med pa 'ba' zhig gsal bar bya ba'i phyir theg pa chen po bstan par rigs pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

original: chos kyi bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: chos kyi bdag med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “The selflessness of phenomena,” and so on.

original: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason for that, he says,

original: theg pa chen po thams cad gtso bor chos kyi bdag med pa ston pa yin la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po thams cad gtso bor chos kyi bdag med pa ston pa yin la /
translated: “The Mahāyāna primarily teaches the selflessness of phenomena.”

original: gzhan du ni zur tsam ston pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni zur tsam ston pa yin te /
translated: Elsewhere, it teaches only a part of it.

original: nyan thos kyi theg par ni /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg par ni /
translated: In the Śrāvakayāna,

original: gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa 'dra //
translated: Form is like a mass of foam,

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos kyi bdag med pa zur tsam ston pa yin no //
translated: and so on. This teaches only a part of the selflessness of phenomena.
