analyzed: des na chos kyi bdag med pa rgyas par brjod par bya ba'i phyir theg pa chen po bstan pa yang rigs pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the Mahāyāna was taught in order to extensively explain the selflessness of phenomena.

original: chos kyi bdag med pa rgyas par bstan pa la /
analyzed: chos kyi bdag med pa rgyas par bstan pa la /
translated: In order to extensively teach the selflessness of phenomena,

original: slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub zhabs kyi khungs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he teaches the source of the master Nāgārjuna.

original: ji skad du slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji skad du slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “As the master himself said,” and so on.

original: mtshan ma med par ma rtogs par //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par ma rtogs par //
translated: Without realizing the absence of features,

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams la sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang bral bar ma shes na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams la sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang bral bar ma shes na'o //
translated: This is because if one does not understand that things are devoid of the signs of blue, yellow, etc.

original: thar pa med ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa med ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spong ba med pa'o //
translated: There is no liberation means that there is no abandonment of the afflictions.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mtshan ma med pa ma rtogs na thar pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mtshan ma med pa ma rtogs na thar pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore means that because there is no liberation if one does not understand signlessness,

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa'o //
translated: this refers to the selflessness of phenomena.

original: tshang bar zhes bya ba ni @77b ji ltar de'i rang bzhin dang / sgrib pa dang / de spangs pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: tshang bar zhes bya ba ni @77b ji ltar de'i rang bzhin dang / sgrib pa dang / de spangs pa'i rnam pas so //
translated: In its entirety means in terms of its nature, obscuration, and abandonment.

original: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg par chos kyi bdag med pa bstan pa la rtsod pa dang / lan brgyud mar zhar la 'ongs pas chog pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pas chog go zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg par chos kyi bdag med pa bstan pa la rtsod pa dang / lan brgyud mar zhar la 'ongs pas chog pa nyid do //
translated: Enough with the digression means that the discussion of the selflessness of phenomena in the Sravakayana and the refutation and rebuttals that ensue are enough.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir nyan thos kyi theg par yang chos kyi bdag med pa bstan pa la skyon med pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir nyan thos kyi theg par yang chos kyi bdag med pa bstan pa la skyon med pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because there is no fault in teaching objective selflessness in the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: blo ma dkrugs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni shes rab rnam par ma yengs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: blo ma dkrugs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni shes rab rnam par ma yengs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Those whose minds are not confused means those whose wisdom is not distracted.

original: rang nyid kyis don gyi de kho na nyid khong du chud par nus pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos pa rnams la yang chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa nyid yin no zhes khong du chud pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin gyi
analyzed: rang nyid kyis don gyi de kho na nyid khong du chud par nus pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos pa rnams la yang chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa yod pa nyid yin no zhes khong du chud pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa yin gyi
translated: Capable of understanding the reality of the meaning by themselves means that śrāvakas have the ability to understand that the knowledge of objective selflessness exists.

original: // blo dman pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: // blo dman pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: But it is not for those of inferior intellect.

original: dkyus ma nyid brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sa dang po'i rnam gzhag nyid rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: dkyus ma nyid brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sa dang po'i rnam gzhag nyid rtsom pa'o //
translated: The basic text should be stated means that the presentation of the first ground is begun.

original: de nyid ston pa ni de tshe de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni de tshe de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That is taught by the passage beginning with “at that time, with regard to that.”

original: de tshe zhes bya ba ni sa dang po rtogs pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: de tshe zhes bya ba ni sa dang po rtogs pa'i dus su'o //
translated: At that time means at the time of understanding the first ground.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' la'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is referred to by the pronoun “that”.

original: dang po sbyin pa nyid ni lhag par 'gyur //
analyzed: dang po sbyin pa nyid ni lhag par 'gyur //
translated: The first is generosity itself.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi nang nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyin pa la 'jug pa sla ba'i phyir sbyin pa la bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs pa'i sgo nas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyu dang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi nang nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyin pa la 'jug pa sla ba'i phyir sbyin pa la bsod nams kyi tshogs sogs pa'i sgo nas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rgyu dang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Among all the perfections, generosity is the first cause of perfect enlightenment, in terms of the accumulation of merit, because it is easy for bodhisattvas to engage in generosity.

original: de yang lhag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de yang lhag pa nyid yin te /
translated: And that is superior.

original: gang gi phyir sa dang po byang chub sems dpas chos kyi dbyings kun tu rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa dang po byang chub sems dpas chos kyi dbyings kun tu rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Because the bodhisattva on the first stage realizes the dharmadhatu.

original: de la kun tu 'gro ba nyid ni ci ltar dngos po gcig la stong pa nyid yod pa de bzhin du thams cad kyi yang yin te ;🔽chos kyi dbyings dang bral ba yi //
analyzed: de la kun tu 'gro ba nyid ni ci ltar dngos po gcig la stong pa nyid yod pa de bzhin du thams cad kyi yang yin te ; chos kyi dbyings dang bral ba yi //
translated: Therein, omnipresence is such that just as emptiness exists in one thing, so it exists in everything.🔽Because of the reasoning that goes:🔽There is no dharma whatsoever

original: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin no //🔽zhes pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin no //🔽zhes pa'i rigs pas so //
translated: That is not empty.

original: gang gi tshe kun tu 'gro ba rtogs pa de'i tshe bdag dang gzhan dag mnyam pa nyid thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun tu 'gro ba rtogs pa de'i tshe bdag dang gzhan dag mnyam pa nyid thob pa yin no //
translated: When one realizes the all-pervading, then one attains the sameness of oneself and others.

original: de thob nas bdag dang gzhan dag la khyad par du mi rtog go //
analyzed: de thob nas bdag dang gzhan dag la khyad par du mi rtog go //
translated: Having attained that, one does not conceive of any difference between oneself and others.

original: des na 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag gi don bzhin du gzhan gyi don la yang 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag gi don bzhin du gzhan gyi don la yang 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this case, the bodhisattvas engage in the welfare of others just as they do in their own welfare.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The bodhisattva, etc.

original: sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Giving refers to the three types of giving:

original: zang zing dang / chos dang / mi 'jigs pa'i @78a * //
analyzed: zang zing dang / chos dang / mi 'jigs pa'i @78a * //
translated: material things, the Dharma, and protection.

original: sbyin pa'o // de la mchod pa dang / rjes su 'dzin pa 'dod pas phyi dang nang gi kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dngos po kha lan dang rnam par smin pa la mi ltos par sems gang gis yongs su gtong ba dang / lus dang ngag gi las gang gis ster ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i zang zing gi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'o // de la mchod pa dang / rjes su 'dzin pa 'dod pas phyi dang nang gi kha na ma tho ba med pa'i dngos po kha lan dang rnam par smin pa la mi ltos par sems gang gis yongs su gtong ba dang / lus dang ngag gi las gang gis ster ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i zang zing gi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity of a bodhisattva is the mental state and the physical and verbal karma by which one gives without regard for cost or reward, with a mind free from inner or outer faults, desiring to worship and to care for others.

original: 'dis ni bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bsal nas sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal bsal nas sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: This is because it cares for sentient beings by removing the suffering of hunger, thirst, and so on.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni sems can rnams la gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i 'tsho ba dang / bstan bcos dang / sgyu rtsal dang / gtsug lag gi mtshan nyid can gyi las kyi man ngag sngon du 'gro ba'i bde 'gro dang mthong ba'i lam ston pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni sems can rnams la gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i 'tsho ba dang / bstan bcos dang / sgyu rtsal dang / gtsug lag gi mtshan nyid can gyi las kyi man ngag sngon du 'gro ba'i bde 'gro dang mthong ba'i lam ston pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity of Dharma is the teaching of the path of seeing preceded by the instructions on the characteristics of the treatises, arts, and crafts, which are a livelihood that does not harm sentient beings.

original: 'dis kyang 'tsho ba dang / ngan 'gro dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal bzlog nas sems can rnams la rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis kyang 'tsho ba dang / ngan 'gro dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal bzlog nas sems can rnams la rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: This also protects sentient beings from the sufferings of life, bad destinies, and cyclic existence, and it takes care of sentient beings.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni rgyal po dang / chom rkun pa dang / dgra dang / gcan gzan la sogs pas skrag par gyur pa de rnams las grol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni rgyal po dang / chom rkun pa dang / dgra dang / gcan gzan la sogs pas skrag par gyur pa de rnams las grol bar byed pa'o //
translated: The giving of fearlessness is the liberation of those who are frightened by kings, thieves, enemies, wild animals, and so on.

original: 'dis kyang srog dang / longs spyod dang / bu dang chung ma la sogs pa dang bral ba'i 'jigs pa las bzlog pa'i phyir sems can rjes su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang srog dang / longs spyod dang / bu dang chung ma la sogs pa dang bral ba'i 'jigs pa las bzlog pa'i phyir sems can rjes su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: This also protects sentient beings from the fear of being separated from life, wealth, children, spouses, and so on.

original: tshul khrims ni rnam pa gnyis te /🔽ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'jug pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni rnam pa gnyis te / ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / 'jug pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is of two kinds:🔽morality of restraint and morality of undertaking virtue.

original: de ldog pa'i tshul khrims ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de ldog pa'i tshul khrims ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of restraint is the morality of vow.

original: 'jug pa'i tshul khrims la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i tshul khrims la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The morality of undertaking virtue is of two kinds:

original: dge ba chos sdud kyi tshul khrims dang / sems can don byed kyi tshul khrims so //
analyzed: dge ba chos sdud kyi tshul khrims dang / sems can don byed kyi tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of gathering virtue and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de la sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni so sor thar pa rigs bdun len pa ste /
analyzed: de la sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni so sor thar pa rigs bdun len pa ste /
translated: The morality of restraint is the taking up of the seven kinds of pratimoksa vows.

original: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / bar slob ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'o //
analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / bar slob ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'o //
translated: They are those of the monk, nun, male and female novice, male and female candidate, layman and laywoman.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni bdag nyid la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa'i don du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni bdag nyid la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa'i don du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The morality of acquiring virtue is for the sake of perfecting the qualities of a Buddha in oneself.

original: sems can don byed kyi tshul khrims ni sems can smin par byed pa'i don du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can don byed kyi tshul khrims ni sems can smin par byed pa'i don du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings is for the sake of maturing sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims de rnams la gnas na srog gi ched du yang sems can rnams la gnod par mi byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims de rnams la gnas na srog gi ched du yang sems can rnams la gnod par mi byed do //
translated: If one abides in these moralities, one will not harm sentient beings even for the sake of one's life.

original: byed du yang mi 'jug go //
analyzed: byed du yang mi 'jug go //
translated: One will not even cause others to do so.

original: bzod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bzod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Patience is threefold:

original: gzhan gyi @78b gnod pa la ji mi snyam ba'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi @78b gnod pa la ji mi snyam ba'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: patience in withstanding the harm done by others, patience in accepting suffering, and patience in discerning the Dharma.

original: de la dran pa dang / bar ma chad pa dang / yun ring ba gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal mngon du byas pa las so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bzod pa de ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa dang / bar ma chad pa dang / yun ring ba gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal mngon du byas pa las so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bzod pa de ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is the non-retaliation towards the harm inflicted by others, through the power of reflection on the suffering of harm inflicted by others.

original: gang chos gos dang / bsod snyoms tshol ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pa pa ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gang chos gos dang / bsod snyoms tshol ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pa pa ni sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is the acceptance of all the sufferings that arise from seeking robes and alms-food.

original: gang yang dag par chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i legs par dpyad pa'i blos lhag par mos pa'i gnas rnam pa brgyad la lhag par mos pa de ni chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang dag par chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i legs par dpyad pa'i blos lhag par mos pa'i gnas rnam pa brgyad la lhag par mos pa de ni chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is the firm conviction in the eight objects of conviction, through the intellect that is well-disposed towards the thorough analysis of the Dharma.

original: de la lhag par mos pa'i gnas brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la lhag par mos pa'i gnas brgyad ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The eight objects of conviction are:

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang / de kho na nyid kyi don dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / thob par bya ba'i don dang / de thob pa'i thabs dang / shes par bya ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang / de kho na nyid kyi don dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / thob par bya ba'i don dang / de thob pa'i thabs dang / shes par bya ba'i yul lo //
translated: The qualities of the Three Jewels, the meaning of reality, the power of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas, cause and effect, the goal to be attained, the means of attaining it, and the object of knowledge.

original: brtson 'grus ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Diligence is threefold:

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can don byed pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba chos sdud pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can don byed pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: armor-like diligence, diligence in accumulating virtuous qualities, and diligence in acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de la brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i sbyor ba'i sngar sems spro ba sngon du 'gro ba'i byang chub kyi ched du sems mi ldog pa'i phyir brtan pa nyid gang yin pa de ni go cha'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i sbyor ba'i sngar sems spro ba sngon du 'gro ba'i byang chub kyi ched du sems mi ldog pa'i phyir brtan pa nyid gang yin pa de ni go cha'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: Here, armor-like diligence is the steadfastness that precedes the application of undertaking diligence, which is the non-retreating of the mind for the sake of enlightenment, preceded by mental enthusiasm.

original: gang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba byed pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: gang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba byed pa ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort that is applied to the perfections in order to perfect generosity and the other perfections is the effort of accumulating virtue.

original: gang don dang bcas pa'i sems can gyi don nye bar gnas pa la grogs byed pa la sogs pa ni sems can don byed kyi brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: gang don dang bcas pa'i sems can gyi don nye bar gnas pa la grogs byed pa la sogs pa ni sems can don byed kyi brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort that assists those who are engaged in the welfare of sentient beings who are worthy of being spiritually tamed is the effort of accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings.

original: brtson 'grus 'dis ni yon tan 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus 'dis ni yon tan 'phel bar byed do //
translated: By means of this effort, one increases one's good qualities.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan goms pa las yon tan khyad par can 'grub pa dang / 'phel bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan goms pa las yon tan khyad par can 'grub pa dang / 'phel bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: One accomplishes and increases special good qualities through the practice of generosity and the other qualities.

original: bsam gtan ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of meditative absorption:

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yon tan nges par bsgrub pa'i @79a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / yon tan nges par bsgrub pa'i @79a * //
translated: meditative absorption that is conducive to the happiness of abiding in this life, the meditative absorption of bodhisattvas, and the meditative absorption that is conducive to the attainment of good qualities.🔽The meditative absorption that is conducive to the happiness of abiding in this life is the meditative absorption that is conducive to the happiness of this life for bodhisattvas themselves.

original: bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The meditative absorption of bodhisattvas is the meditative absorption that is conducive to the attainment of the bodhisattvas' own special good qualities.

original: de la gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba lus dang sems kyi bsrabs pa skyed par byed pa mchog tu zhi ba mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba ro myang bar bya ba ma yin pa de ni mthong ba'i
analyzed: de la gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba lus dang sems kyi bsrabs pa skyed par byed pa mchog tu zhi ba mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba ro myang bar bya ba ma yin pa de ni mthong ba'i
translated: The supreme peace that generates the physical and mental pliancy free from all thoughts of bodhisattvas, which is free from clinging and not to be savored, is seeing.🔽

original: chos la bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: chos la bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The concentration of abiding in bliss in this very life is the concentration that generates physical and mental pliancy free from all discursive thoughts, which is the supreme pacification free from attachment and not to be savored.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gang la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang ming yang mi shes na snyoms par 'jug pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gang la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang ming yang mi shes na snyoms par 'jug pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is such that even the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas do not know the names of their concentrations, let alone their equipoise.

original: stobs bcu'i rigs kyis bsdus pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa'i don du 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / zad par gyi skye mched dang /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i rigs kyis bsdus pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa'i don du 'gyur ba'i bsam gtan gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / zad par gyi skye mched dang /
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is the concentration that is included in the ten powers and that serves as the basis for the accomplishment of the various inconceivable concentrations.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa la sogs pa'i nyan thos la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa la sogs pa'i nyan thos la sogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the concentrations are also the means of accomplishing the special qualities of the bodhisattvas, such as the correct and discerning awareness, the absence of the afflictions, and the knowledge through vows.

original: de la gang byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la brten nas sems can gyi don du grogs byed pa ni sems can don byed kyi bsam gtan du rig par bya'o//
analyzed: de la gang byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan la brten nas sems can gyi don du grogs byed pa ni sems can don byed kyi bsam gtan du rig par bya'o//
translated: The concentration of working for the benefit of sentient beings is the concentration by which the bodhisattva, on the basis of the concentrations, works for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bsam gtan 'dis ni sems can rnams bstan pa la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: bsam gtan 'dis ni sems can rnams bstan pa la 'jug par byed de /
translated: This concentration introduces sentient beings to the teaching,

original: bsam gtan gyi stobs kyi rdzu 'phrul gyis mgu bar gyur pa rnams bstan pa la 'jug pas so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi stobs kyi rdzu 'phrul gyis mgu bar gyur pa rnams bstan pa la 'jug pas so //
translated: because those who are attracted by the concentration's power of magical transformation enter the teaching.

original: shes rab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Wisdom is threefold:

original: shes bya'i de kho na nyid rjes su rtogs pa dang / so sor rtogs pa'i shes rab dang / rig pa'i gnas lnga dang / phung po gsum la mkhas par byed pa'i shes rab dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i shes rab bo //🔽de la gang brjod du med pa'i chos kyi bdag med pa khong du chud nas bden pa rtogs pa'i ched du 'am /🔽bden pa rtogs pa'i dus su'am /
analyzed: shes bya'i de kho na nyid rjes su rtogs pa dang / so sor rtogs pa'i shes rab dang / rig pa'i gnas lnga dang / phung po gsum la mkhas par byed pa'i shes rab dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i shes rab bo // de la gang brjod du med pa'i chos kyi bdag med pa khong du chud nas bden pa rtogs pa'i ched du 'am / bden pa rtogs pa'i dus su'am /
translated: It is the wisdom that realizes the suchness of objects of knowledge, the wisdom that discerns things, the wisdom that is skilled in the five sciences and the three collections of scriptures, and the wisdom that accomplishes the welfare of sentient beings.

original: bden pa rtogs pa'i phyir gyi byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab mchog tu zhi bar gyur pa nye bar gnas pa rnam par mi rtog pa /
analyzed: bden pa rtogs pa'i phyir gyi byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab mchog tu zhi bar gyur pa nye bar gnas pa rnam par mi rtog pa /
translated: With regard to that, the wisdom of bodhisattvas that is directed toward realizing the truth or that is present at the time of realizing the truth or that is for the sake of realizing the truth is the supreme wisdom of bodhisattvas that is utterly peaceful, that is present in a nonconceptual way,

original: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba chos thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid pa nyid du rjes su 'gro ba dang / spyi chen po'i mtshan nyid can /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad dang bral ba chos thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid pa nyid du rjes su 'gro ba dang / spyi chen po'i mtshan nyid can /
translated: that is free from all elaborations, that is in accord with the sameness of all phenomena, and that has the defining characteristic of the great generality.

original: shes bya'i mthar thug pa sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs @79b pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de kho na nyid rjes su rtogs pa'i shes rab dang /🔽so sor rtogs pa'i shes rab tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i mthar thug pa sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs @79b pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba de ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de kho na nyid rjes su rtogs pa'i shes rab dang / so sor rtogs pa'i shes rab tu rig par bya'o //
translated: Because it is free from the two extremes of superimposition and denial with respect to the limit of knowable objects, this is the wisdom that realizes suchness and the wisdom of discernment of bodhisattvas, which is the path of the middle way that follows the middle way.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga ni nang rig pa dang / gtan tshigs rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / sgra rig pa dang / bzo'i gnas rig pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga ni nang rig pa dang / gtan tshigs rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / sgra rig pa dang / bzo'i gnas rig pa'o //
translated: The five sciences are the inner science, the science of logic, the science of healing, the science of grammar, and the science of artistic crafts.

original: phung po gsum ni don dang bcas pa'i chos kyi phung po dang / don dang mi ldan pa'i chos kyi phung po dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa'i chos kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: phung po gsum ni don dang bcas pa'i chos kyi phung po dang / don dang mi ldan pa'i chos kyi phung po dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa'i chos kyi phung po'o //
translated: The three baskets are the basket of the sūtras, the basket of the vinaya, and the basket of the abhidharma.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga dang phung po gsum po 'di rnams la mkhas pa'i shes rab ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rig pa'i gnas lnga dang / phung po gsum la mkhas pa'i shes rab tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga dang phung po gsum po 'di rnams la mkhas pa'i shes rab ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rig pa'i gnas lnga dang / phung po gsum la mkhas pa'i shes rab tu shes par bya'o //
translated: The wisdom of skill in these five sciences and three collections is to be known as the bodhisattvas' wisdom of the five sciences and of the three collections.

original: gnas 'di rnams nyid la dmigs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i shes rab ces bya ste /
analyzed: gnas 'di rnams nyid la dmigs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i shes rab ces bya ste /
translated: The wisdom that focuses on these very topics is called the wisdom that acts for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: gnas 'di rnams la mkhas pa'i phyir sems can gyi don la grogs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnas 'di rnams la mkhas pa'i phyir sems can gyi don la grogs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because of being skilled in these topics, it is a companion for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: 'dis gdams ngag yang dag par sbyin pa'i sgo nas sems can rnams grol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis gdams ngag yang dag par sbyin pa'i sgo nas sems can rnams grol bar byed pa'o //
translated: Through this, one liberates sentient beings by means of perfectly bestowing instructions.

original: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The perfection of skillful means and so forth have already been explained.

original: da ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yon tan nges pa'i rtags su bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yon tan nges pa'i rtags su bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the hidden qualities of the perfection of generosity as a sign of certainty,

original: rang sha ster la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang sha ster la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said giving one's own flesh and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rang gi sha ster ba la yang gus par byas pa'i rang gi sha ster ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rang gi sha ster ba la yang gus par byas pa'i rang gi sha ster ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva's giving of his own flesh is also done with respect.

original: snang du mi rung ba'i sa rtogs pa la sogs pa'i rtags su gyur pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: snang du mi rung ba'i sa rtogs pa la sogs pa'i rtags su gyur pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The realization of the stage that is not visible, etc., is the sign.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: at that time, etc.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gtong ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni gtong ba'i dus na'o //
translated: At that time is at the time of giving.

original: sa rtogs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa rtogs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The realization of the stage, etc. refers to the stage of the joyous, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo ba la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo ba la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The word etc. should be understood as referring to the shaking of a hundred world systems, and so on.

original: phyi dang zhes bya ba nor dang bu dang chung ma la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: phyi dang zhes bya ba nor dang bu dang chung ma la sogs pa'o ;
translated: External refers to wealth, children, wife, etc.

original: / nang zhes bya ba ni rkang pa dang lag pa nas brtsams te rkang gi bar ro //
analyzed: / nang zhes bya ba ni rkang pa dang lag pa nas brtsams te rkang gi bar ro //
translated: Internal refers to the feet, hands, etc., up to the brain.

original: de nyid dang po ste /
analyzed: de nyid dang po ste /
translated: That is the first,

original: don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is for the sake of benefit.

original: de gtong ba'i khyad par ni dmigs pa med pa'i sbyor bas stong pa'o //
analyzed: de gtong ba'i khyad par ni dmigs pa med pa'i sbyor bas stong pa'o //
translated: The difference in the giving of that is emptiness by the application of non-objectification.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: That is the inference.

original: 'dis rjes su dpog pas na rjes su dpog pa ste rtags so //
analyzed: 'dis rjes su dpog pas na rjes su dpog pa ste rtags so //
translated: It is an inference because it infers by this; that is, it is a logical mark.
The meaning of this is as follows.

original: don ni byang chub sems dpas sa dang po rtogs pa'i tshe chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro bar rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: don ni byang chub sems dpas sa dang po rtogs pa'i tshe chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro bar rtogs pa yin la /
translated: When the bodhisattva realizes the first stage, he realizes the all-pervasiveness of the dharma-dhātu.

original: de yang rang gi sha la sogs pa gtong ba'i sgo nas shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang gi sha la sogs pa gtong ba'i sgo nas shes pa yin no //
translated: And that is known through the giving of his flesh, etc.

original: de ltar gal te byang chub sems dpas chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro bar ma rtogs na sha la sogs pa gtong bar ci ltar nus par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar gal te byang chub sems dpas chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro bar ma rtogs na sha la sogs pa gtong bar ci ltar nus par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, if the bodhisattva did not realize the all-pervasiveness of the dharma-dhātu, how could he be able to give his flesh, etc.?

original: des na rang gi sha la sogs pa gtong bas chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro bar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang gi sha la sogs pa gtong bas chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro bar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, through the giving of his flesh, etc., he realizes the all-pervasiveness of the dharma-dhātu.

original: de bzhin du yon tan gzhan rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan gzhan rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: And so it should be stated for the other virtues as well.

original: sngar dang phyis kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: sngar dang phyis kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir ;
translated: In order to demonstrate the two verses above and below,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Just as . . .” and so on.

original: sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa gtan du bde ba thob pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa kho na gtan du bde ba yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa gtan du bde ba thob pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa kho na gtan du bde ba yin par 'dod kyi /
translated: The cause of attaining happiness forever, which is the remedy for suffering, is generosity. The remedy for suffering is asserted to be happiness forever.

original: dngos po la bde ba ni yod pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la bde ba ni yod pa ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: Happiness does not exist in things.

original: sbyin pa de bde ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyin pa de bde ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that generosity is the cause of happiness,

original: skye bo 'di kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skye bo 'di kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “All these people . . .” and so on.

original: longs spyod ces bya ba ni longs spyad par bya bas na longs spyod do //
analyzed: longs spyod ces bya ba ni longs spyad par bya bas na longs spyod do //
translated: “ Enjoyment” is that which is to be enjoyed.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is form, sound, and so on.

original: dang por zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi gtam la sogs pa'i sngar ro //
analyzed: dang por zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims kyi gtam la sogs pa'i sngar ro //
translated: “ First” means before the talk on morality and so on.

original: gzhan ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain just that, he says,

original: sdug bsngal phyir bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa tsam zhes bya ba ni bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyir bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa tsam zhes bya ba ni bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa ste /
translated: The phrase “merely a remedy for suffering” means that it is a remedy for the suffering of hunger, etc.

original: bkres pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: It is characterized by hunger, etc.

original: srid pa'i bde ba 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i bde ba bkres pa la sogs pa log pa'i mtshan nyid can de'i rgyun skye ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i bde ba 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i bde ba bkres pa la sogs pa log pa'i mtshan nyid can de'i rgyun skye ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase “the cause for the occurrence of worldly pleasure” means that it is the cause for the arising of the continuum of that worldly pleasure which is characterized by the cessation of hunger, etc.

original: phyin ci log tsam gyis bdag nyid kyi rgyun nye bar brtags pas zhes bya ba ni bde ba ma yin pa la bde bar zhen pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log tsam gyis bdag nyid kyi rgyun nye bar brtags pas zhes bya ba ni bde ba ma yin pa la bde bar zhen pa ste /
translated: The phrase “merely a mistaken notion” means that it is an attachment to pleasure in what is not pleasure.

original: 'di ltar gal te bde ba'i rang bzhin can yin na dus nam yang ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te bde ba'i rang bzhin can yin na dus nam yang ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if it were of the nature of pleasure, it would never cease at any time,

original: rang bzhin ldog par rigs pa dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin ldog par rigs pa dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reasonable for a nature to cease, and because it would be suffering due to the suffering of change.

original: bkres pa dang skom pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po zas dang skom la sogs pa nye bar 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po zas dang skom la sogs pa nye bar 'tsho ba ste /
translated: Hunger, thirst, etc. are the antidotes to hunger, thirst, etc.

original: gnod pa bsal ba gang yin pa de @80b la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa bsal ba gang yin pa de @80b la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The removal of harm is called that.

original: shin tu ches mngon par zhen la zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i bkres pa la sogs pa'i phyir bcos pa la bde ba nyid du ches mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu ches mngon par zhen la zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i bkres pa la sogs pa'i phyir bcos pa la bde ba nyid du ches mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Excessively attached to is excessively attached to the remedy of hunger, etc. which is not itself happiness, as happiness.

original: gzhung 'dis ni slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhabs la sogs pa rnams kyis kun rdzob tu bde ba la skur ba btab pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhung 'dis ni slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhabs la sogs pa rnams kyis kun rdzob tu bde ba la skur ba btab pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This passage does not deny the existence of happiness in the conventional sense, as the master Candrakirti and others have done.

original: 'o na bde ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid la zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na bde ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid la zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then how can it be said that it is not itself happiness?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is intended figuratively.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa rnams 'khor ba'i bde ba las yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bde ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa zhes gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa rnams 'khor ba'i bde ba las yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir bde ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa zhes gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, in order to cause worldly beings to turn away from the happiness of cyclic existence, he said, “It is not the nature of happiness.”

original: 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob tu bde ba med do zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob tu bde ba med do zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But he did not say that happiness does not exist in worldly convention.🔽Therefore, in the Catuh-s-t states:

original: de nyid kyi phyir bzhi brgya pa las zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bshad pa rdzogs par mdzad nas rnam par gzhag pa mdzad de /🔽'di ltar khams gsum pa thams cad kyi skye ba la phun sum tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gtam gyis gdul bya'i skye bo rnams 'khor ba'i btson ra'i tshogs la yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa skye
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bzhi brgya pa las zhes bya ba ni 'di'i bshad pa rdzogs par mdzad nas rnam par gzhag pa mdzad de / 'di ltar khams gsum pa thams cad kyi skye ba la phun sum tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gtam gyis gdul bya'i skye bo rnams 'khor ba'i btson ra'i tshogs la yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa skye
translated: Having completed the explanation of this, he makes the following presentation:

original: ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal kho na sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin can no zhes 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal kho na sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin can no zhes 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in order to cause beings to be trained to turn away from the prison of cyclic existence through the discourse on the suffering of being devoid of the excellence of birth in all three realms, the venerable Āryadeva states that birth and so on are by nature suffering alone.

original: des na ma rig pa'i mun pas blo gros kyi mig ldongs par byas pa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pas brtags pa yod pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i bde ba dang /
analyzed: des na ma rig pa'i mun pas blo gros kyi mig ldongs par byas pa'i byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log gi rnam par rtog pas brtags pa yod pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i bde ba dang /
translated: Therefore, for childish ordinary beings whose eyes of intelligence are blinded by the darkness of ignorance, the happiness and mental pleasure that are imputed by the conception of error that does not exist are not a nature that exists.

original: yid bde ba dang / lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye dang / grub pa thob pa dang / rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gnas su de'i rtogs pa tshad ma'i dbang du byas nas bde ba dang yid bde ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang / lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye dang / grub pa thob pa dang / rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gnas su de'i rtogs pa tshad ma'i dbang du byas nas bde ba dang yid bde ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the abodes of gods, demigods, humans, kinnaras, mahoragas, siddhas, and vidyadharas, happiness and mental pleasure do not exist from the perspective of their valid cognition.

original: dper na rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na mngon par 'dod pa'i yul nye bar longs spyod pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba bzhin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na mngon par 'dod pa'i yul nye bar longs spyod pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba bzhin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the happiness and mental pleasure of enjoying desired objects in the context of a dream.

original: de la tshig snga ma rnams kyis bde ba sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du bstan pa de dgongs pa can no zhes gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de la tshig snga ma rnams kyis bde ba sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin du bstan pa de dgongs pa can no zhes gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: The earlier statements clarify that the teaching of happiness as the nature of suffering is a provisional meaning.

original: ngag phyi mas kun rdzob tu bde ba yod pa nyid yin no zhes gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: ngag phyi mas kun rdzob tu bde ba yod pa nyid yin no zhes gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: The latter statement clarifies that, conventionally, pleasure does exist.

original: des na slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhabs la sogs pas kyang kun rdzob tu bde ba la skur ba 'debs par bzhed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na slob dpon zla ba grags pa'i zhabs la sogs pas kyang kun rdzob tu bde ba la skur ba 'debs par bzhed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the venerable Candrakirti and others do not accept that one should repudiate pleasure conventionally.

original: @81a * // tshig rkang gnyis pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @81a * // tshig rkang gnyis pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir / de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To explain the second line, he says:🔽Since they desire pleasure,🔽the world pursues only the pacification of pain.

original: bde ba mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa tsam bde ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid la mngon par zhen nas bde ba mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa tsam bde ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid la mngon par zhen nas bde ba mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Since they desire pleasure means that, having become attached to the mere pacification of pain, they desire pleasure.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: The world means the world of sentient beings.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen por gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen por gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Since they pursue only the pacification of pain means that they pursue only the pacification of pain, which is the antidote to pain.

original: sdug bsngal ni bkres pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni bkres pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Pain refers to hunger, etc.

original: de'i gnyen por gyur pa de'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gyur pa de'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: The antidote to that is its pacification.

original: 'dod pa brdzun pa'i rang bzhin yin pas phyin ci log gi rang bzhin bdag nyid can gang longs spyod pa ste ;
analyzed: 'dod pa brdzun pa'i rang bzhin yin pas phyin ci log gi rang bzhin bdag nyid can gang longs spyod pa ste ;
translated: Since desire is false by nature, one who has a nature that is mistaken enjoys

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa rnams la longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa rnams la longs spyod pa ste /
translated: the objects of enjoyment, such as form, sound, and so on.

original: nyams su myong ba de las so //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba de las so //
translated: From that experience,

original: tshig rkang gsum pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig rkang gsum pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the third line,

original: sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “the antidote to suffering” and so on.

original: de dag kyang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ma bsags pa zhes bya ba ni de la kun nas slong ba sems dang bcas pa'i lus dang ngag gi las la sbyin pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: de dag kyang sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po ma bsags pa zhes bya ba ni de la kun nas slong ba sems dang bcas pa'i lus dang ngag gi las la sbyin pa zhes bya la /
translated: Moreover, “the accumulation of the bases of meritorious action that arise from generosity” is the body and speech karma that is accompanied by the motivating mind called “generosity.”

original: de dge ba yin pa'i phyir bsod nams yin la /
analyzed: de dge ba yin pa'i phyir bsod nams yin la /
translated: Since that is virtuous, it is meritorious.

original: las kyi bdag nyid yin pas byas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: las kyi bdag nyid yin pas byas pa yang yin la /
translated: Since it is the nature of karma, it is action.

original: de kun nas slong ba'i sems pa'i rten yin pas na dngos po'o //
analyzed: de kun nas slong ba'i sems pa'i rten yin pas na dngos po'o //
translated: Since it is the basis of the intention that motivates that, it is a thing.

original: de gang gis ma bsags pa de la longs spyod 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de gang gis ma bsags pa de la longs spyod 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Enjoyment does not arise from that which does not accumulate that.

original: tshig rkang bzhi bshad par bya ba'i phyir snyam du mkhyen nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshig rkang bzhi bshad par bya ba'i phyir snyam du mkhyen nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The four lines beginning with “the Bhagavān, knowing that…” are stated in order to explain this.

original: 'di'i don ni 'jig rten bde ba don du gnyer ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'jig rten bde ba don du gnyer ba yin la /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: worldly beings strive for happiness.

original: bde ba ni yul gzugs la sogs pa med na mi 'byung la /
analyzed: bde ba ni yul gzugs la sogs pa med na mi 'byung la /
translated: And happiness does not occur without objects such as form.

original: yul gzugs la sogs pa yang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: yul gzugs la sogs pa yang sbyin pa'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: And objects such as form are the result of generosity.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul khrims la sogs pa'i dang por sbyin pa'i gtam mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul khrims la sogs pa'i dang por sbyin pa'i gtam mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān first taught the discourse on generosity, such as morality.

original: des na sbyin pa bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na sbyin pa bde ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, generosity is the cause of higher rebirth because it is the cause of happiness.

original: gal te so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir snying rje dang bral ba de rnams kyis sbyin pa longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can du ci ltar 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: gal te so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir snying rje dang bral ba de rnams kyis sbyin pa longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can du ci ltar 'gyur zhe na //
translated: If ordinary beings, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas are devoid of compassion because they do not engage in benefiting others, how could their generosity have the result of enjoyment?

original: de la lan du da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtong ba po'i sems tshul dang mi mthun pa yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni snying rje med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lan du da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtong ba po'i sems tshul dang mi mthun pa yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni snying rje med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In response to that, now and so on. Even if the mind of the giver is not in accord with the method, means that it lacks compassion.

original: gang gi bya ba dang rjes su @81b mthun pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i rang bzhin gyi bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyu longs spyod 'byung bar byed pa rjes su mthun pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gang gi bya ba dang rjes su @81b mthun pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i rang bzhin gyi bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyu longs spyod 'byung bar byed pa rjes su mthun pa yin pas so //
translated: What is in accord with the action is the action that has the nature of giving, which is in accord with the arising of enjoyments that are the cause of happiness.

original: bdag nyid chen po zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i longs spyod 'byung ba'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i longs spyod 'byung ba'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The great being has the nature of arising from desired enjoyments.

original: de nyid rtsa bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rtsa bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that with a root,

original: snying rje dman zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: snying rje dman zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, with little compassion, and so on.

original: shin tu rtsub sems can zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i chus brlan par byed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don la sems rtsub pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu rtsub sems can zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i chus brlan par byed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don la sems rtsub pa ste /
translated: Having a very rough mind means that the mind is rough with regard to the benefit of others, because it is moistened by the water of compassion.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi dngos po chus bran pa brlan pa chu med na rtsub pa bzhin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi dngos po chus bran pa brlan pa chu med na rtsub pa bzhin no zhes pa'o //
translated: For example, external things, when moistened by water, become soft; without water, they become hard.🔽Therefore,

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: he says,

original: rang don lhur len nyid du gyur pa gang //
analyzed: rang don lhur len nyid du gyur pa gang //
translated: “Whoever is intent only on his own aim”

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: rang gi don kho na don du gnyer ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don kho na don du gnyer ba'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: Because he is intent only on his own aim.

original: sdug bsngal nyer zhi'i rgyur gyur zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa tsam gyi bde ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyer zhi'i rgyur gyur zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal phyir bcos pa tsam gyi bde ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: “The cause of the pacification of suffering” means the cause of the happiness that is the mere cessation of suffering.

original: 'di'i don ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod yin la /
translated: The meaning of this verse is as follows. The result of generosity is wealth.

original: 'on kyang snying rjes brlan pa'i sems kyis btang na 'bras bu chen po 'byung bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: 'on kyang snying rjes brlan pa'i sems kyis btang na 'bras bu chen po 'byung bar 'gyur te ;
translated: However, if one gives with a mind moistened by compassion, a great result will occur.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe snying rjes brlan pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa btang na de'i 'bras bu dang bcas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe snying rjes brlan pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa btang na de'i 'bras bu dang bcas te /
translated: Thus, when one gives with a mind moistened by compassion, it is accompanied by a result.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du yongs su bsngo ba yin la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du yongs su bsngo ba yin la /
translated: It is dedicated to the welfare of all beings.

original: des na sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir sbyin pa yang mtha' yas pas sbyin pas 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na sems can mtha' yas pa'i phyir sbyin pa yang mtha' yas pas sbyin pas 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, since the generosity is infinite because of the infinity of sentient beings, the result of generosity becomes great.

original: gang gi tshe snying rjes brlan pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa kun nas ma blangs na de'i tshe sems can la phan pa tsam yin pa'i phyir longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe snying rjes brlan pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa kun nas ma blangs na de'i tshe sems can la phan pa tsam yin pa'i phyir longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can du 'gyur gyi /
translated: When generosity is not undertaken with a mind moistened by compassion, then it becomes the result of enjoyment because it is merely for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: mi zad pa'i phyir 'bras bu chen por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi zad pa'i phyir 'bras bu chen por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not become the result of great because it is not inexhaustible.

original: des na gtong ba po'i sems rtsub tu zin kyang longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can nyid du 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na gtong ba po'i sems rtsub tu zin kyang longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can nyid du 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, even if the mind of the giver is hard, there is no contradiction in its being the result of enjoyment.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:🔽Those who give with a mind moistened by compassion,

original: ji ltar tshong pa dag nor shin tu chung ngu yongs su btang bas nor shin tu mang po 'dod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rang gi don lhur len cing nor shin tu nyung ba yongs su btang bas 'jig rten pha rol tu longs spyod chen po 'dod🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar tshong pa dag nor shin tu chung ngu yongs su btang bas nor shin tu mang po 'dod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rang gi don lhur len cing nor shin tu nyung ba yongs su btang bas 'jig rten pha rol tu longs spyod chen po 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Just as merchants, by giving up a very small amount of wealth, desire a great deal of wealth, so too here, by giving up a very small amount of wealth, one who is intent on one's own aim desires great wealth in a future life.

original: de'i phyir / 'dod pa don du gnyer babs kyang ches lhag par don du gnyer bar 'gyur zhing zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'dod pa don du gnyer babs kyang ches lhag par don du gnyer bar 'gyur zhing zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “even though one seeks pleasure, one seeks it excessively.”

original: slong ba pos kyang ches lhag par gtong ba por 'gyur te /
analyzed: slong ba pos kyang ches lhag par gtong ba por 'gyur te /
translated: The petitioner becomes excessively generous.

original: slong ba po ni kha zas la sogs pa tsam gyis tshim la /
analyzed: slong ba po ni kha zas la sogs pa tsam gyis tshim la /
translated: The petitioner is satisfied with just food and so on,

original: 'di ni longs spyod chen po 'dod @82a * //
analyzed: 'di ni longs spyod chen po 'dod @82a * //
translated: but the bodhisattva desires great wealth.

original: pas so // de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa la brten nas kyang sbyin pa mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: pas so // de ltar byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa la brten nas kyang sbyin pa mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that generosity is the cause of high status even in dependence on those who are not bodhisattvas,

original: nges par legs pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par legs pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that it is the cause of definite goodness,

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is the verse.

original: nam zhig tshe zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa gtong ba'i gnas skabs kyi tshe na'o //
analyzed: nam zhig tshe zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa gtong ba'i gnas skabs kyi tshe na'o //
translated: When is the time? It is the time when one is engaged in giving.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs tsam ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs tsam ma yin pa'o //
translated: This refers to the bodhisattva lineage itself.

original: yang gi sgras ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can 'ba' zhig ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can 'ba' zhig ma yin pa'o //
translated: The word also indicates that it is not only those who possess the bodhisattva lineage.

original: 'phags pa'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'di sbyin pa la rab tu 'jug pa de'i tshe zhing dam pa spyan drangs pas 'phags pa'i skye bo dang phrad par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe 'di sbyin pa la rab tu 'jug pa de'i tshe zhing dam pa spyan drangs pas 'phags pa'i skye bo dang phrad par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Noble persons refers to the fact that when one engages in giving, one meets with noble persons by inviting them to a holy place.

original: des na srid rgyun yang dag bcad de zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i skye bo dang phrad pa las de'i gdams ngag gis lam thob nas 'khor ba'i brgyud pa bcad nas so //
analyzed: des na srid rgyun yang dag bcad de zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i skye bo dang phrad pa las de'i gdams ngag gis lam thob nas 'khor ba'i brgyud pa bcad nas so //
translated: Therefore, having properly severed the continuum of existence, refers to the fact that having obtained the path through the instructions of those noble persons, one severs the continuum of samsara.

original: de'i rgyu can zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i rgyu can no //
translated: Having that as a cause refers to having giving as a cause.

original: zhi bar zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: zhi bar zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Peace refers to nirvana.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from birth, etc.

original: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: sbyin bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sbyin bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived.🔽The giver is the one who gives.🔽The gift is the object given.

original: sbyin bdag gi bshad pa ni gtong ba po'o //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gi bshad pa ni gtong ba po'o //
translated: The recipient is the one to whom it is given.🔽The giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived means that the giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived as being ultimate.

original: thams cad du dam pa dag gis bgrod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni des dam pa rnams spyan 'dren gyi dam pa rnams de la brten pa ni ma yin no //🔽'khor ba la yon tan med par rig cing zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: thams cad du dam pa dag gis bgrod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni des dam pa rnams spyan 'dren gyi dam pa rnams de la brten pa ni ma yin no // 'khor ba la yon tan med par rig cing zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pas so //

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dri ma med pa mngon du byas pas zhes bya ba ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i zag pa med pa'i lam mngon du byas pas so // ma rig pa spangs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived means that the giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived as being ultimate.🔽The giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived means that the giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived as being ultimate.🔽The giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived means that the giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived as being ultimate.🔽The giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived means that the giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived as being ultimate.🔽The giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived means that the giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived as being ultimate.🔽The giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived means that the giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived as being ultimate.🔽The giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived means that the giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived as being ultimate.🔽The giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived means that the giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived as being ultimate.

original: de ltar na re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The giver, the gift, and the recipient are not conceived means that the giver, the gift

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa mthong ba'i chos la bde ba'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa mthong ba'i chos la bde ba'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the generosity of the bodhisattvas is the cause of happiness in this very life,

original: 'gro la phan par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'gro la phan par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “for the benefit of the world,” and so on.

original: 'gro la phan pa'i mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro la phan pa'i mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa thob pa'o //
translated: The benefit of the world is the attainment of high status and certain goodness.

original: de'i don du sems dam bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don du sems dam bcas pa ste /
translated: For that purpose, he has made the resolve,🔽“May I attain buddhahood for the benefit of the world.”

original: 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / ces byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gro la phan phyir sangs rgyas 'grub par shog / ces byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is a bodhisattva who has generated the resolve for enlightenment.

original: @82b sbyin pas ring por mi thogs dga' ba 'thob //
analyzed: @82b sbyin pas ring por mi thogs dga' ba 'thob //
translated: “Through generosity, he quickly attains happiness”

original: ces bya ba ni longs spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni longs spyod pa yin te /
translated: is the enjoyment.

original: sbyin pa'i de ma thag tu don gnyer ba po'i yid yongs su tshim nas dga' ba thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i de ma thag tu don gnyer ba po'i yid yongs su tshim nas dga' ba thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Immediately after the generosity, the mind of the one who seeks the benefit is completely satisfied and he attains happiness.
