original: de la brten pa med pa'i shes pa ni de kho na nyid shes pas so //
analyzed: de la brten pa med pa'i shes pa ni de kho na nyid shes pas so //
translated: The knowledge that they are groundless is by the knowledge of reality.

original: de ni snying rjes 'jig rten sdug / ces bya ba ni snying rje'i stobs kyis gzhan sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: de ni snying rjes 'jig rten sdug / ces bya ba ni snying rje'i stobs kyis gzhan sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: He suffers with compassion for the world means that he suffers because others suffer, by the power of compassion.

original: de nyid kyis ni yun ring gnas //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni yun ring gnas //
translated: By that, he remains for a long time.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'di 'khor ba thog mtha' med par gnas so ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'di 'khor ba thog mtha' med par gnas so ;
translated: By the suffering of others, the bodhisattva remains in the samsara that is without beginning or end.

original: /'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: /'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje'i stobs kyis gzhan sdug bsngal ba nyid kyi phyir ji srid du gzhan gyi sdug bsngal ma bsal ba de srid du de gnas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje'i stobs kyis gzhan sdug bsngal ba nyid kyi phyir ji srid du gzhan gyi sdug bsngal ma bsal ba de srid du de gnas pa yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, by the power of compassion, remains for as long as others’ suffering is not removed, because of the suffering of others.

original: 'dir de la lus kyi sdug bsngal med ces bya ba ni skabs su bab pa'i shes byed do //
analyzed: 'dir de la lus kyi sdug bsngal med ces bya ba ni skabs su bab pa'i shes byed do //
translated: Here, “he has no physical suffering” is the scriptural reference that is relevant.

original: gal te 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i dus su lus gcod pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal med pa yin no zhes pa'i gnas skabs yin pas /
analyzed: gal te 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i dus su lus gcod pa la sogs pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal med pa yin no zhes pa'i gnas skabs yin pas /
translated: If here the bodhisattva, at the time of generosity, has no suffering that arises from cutting up the body and so on, then this is the context.

original: rin po che'i phreng ba las /
analyzed: rin po che'i phreng ba las /
translated: In the Precious Garland it says:

original: de la lus kyi sdug bsngal med //
analyzed: de la lus kyi sdug bsngal med //
translated: He has no physical suffering.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gis bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i stobs kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ngan song gis byas pa'i lus kyi sdug bsngal med do zhes gsungs pa 'di shes byed du ci ltar rung zhen ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gis bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa'i stobs kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ngan song gis byas pa'i lus kyi sdug bsngal med do zhes gsungs pa 'di shes byed du ci ltar rung zhen ma yin te /
translated: How could this statement be a scriptural reference for the claim that “by the power of accumulating the collection of merit, bodhisattvas have no physical suffering created by the lower realms”?

original: lus kyi sdug bsngal med ces bya ba'i tshig 'di nyid la don gnyis te /
analyzed: lus kyi sdug bsngal med ces bya ba'i tshig 'di nyid la don gnyis te /
translated: This very statement, “there is no suffering of the body,” has two meanings.

original: chags pa med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ltos dang ; chags pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ltos nas so //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ltos dang ; chags pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ltos nas so //
translated: In relation to the bodhisattva who is free of attachment and in relation to the bodhisattva who is not free of attachment.

original: gang gi tshe chags pa med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chags pa med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is explained in terms of the bodhisattva who is free of attachment,

original: de la lus kyi sdug bsngal med //
analyzed: de la lus kyi sdug bsngal med //
translated: then it is said, “there is no suffering of the body for him.”

original: ces bya ba ni lus rang bzhin med par mngon du byas pa'i phyir de la lus kyi sdug bsngal med pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni lus rang bzhin med par mngon du byas pa'i phyir de la lus kyi sdug bsngal med pa'o //
translated: This means that there is no suffering of the body for him because he has realized the essencelessness of the body.

original: chags pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ltos nas bshad pa snga ma'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ltos nas bshad pa snga ma'o //
translated: The previous explanation is in terms of the bodhisattva who is not free of attachment.

original: des na 'dir chags pa med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ltos nas bshad pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: des na 'dir chags pa med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ltos nas bshad pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Therefore, here the explanation is in terms of the bodhisattva who is free of attachment.

original: shes byed kyi khungs de drangs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes byed kyi khungs de drangs pa yin no //
translated: This is the source that proves this.

original: yang na / 'di ni snying rje 'jig rten sdug / ce @84b bya ba 'di shes byed du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na / 'di ni snying rje 'jig rten sdug / ce @84b bya ba 'di shes byed du bstan pa yin te /
translated: this is taught as the proof of the statement, “Compassion is the world’s sorrow.”

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that bodhisattvas have physical and mental suffering, as was previously explained.

original: rang la sdug bsngal med kyang 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas lag pa dang / rkang pa la sogs pa gcod pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba yin la /
analyzed: rang la sdug bsngal med kyang 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas lag pa dang / rkang pa la sogs pa gcod pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba yin la /
translated: Even though they do not have suffering themselves, they experience the suffering of having their hands, feet, and so on cut off on account of the world’s suffering.

original: de la gal te 'jig rten pa'i rgyu can gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can rkang lag la sogs pa gcod pa'i sdug bsngal dga' ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba yin na de rnams 'khor ba ji srid du ji ltar gnas par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la gal te 'jig rten pa'i rgyu can gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can rkang lag la sogs pa gcod pa'i sdug bsngal dga' ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba yin na de rnams 'khor ba ji srid du ji ltar gnas par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: If the suffering of having their hands, feet, and so on cut off, which is caused by the world’s suffering, were not the cause of their joy, how could they remain in saṃsāra for as long as it lasts?

original: da ni chags pa med pa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig la spyod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal de yang snying rje'i stobs kyis sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: da ni chags pa med pa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig la spyod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal de yang snying rje'i stobs kyis sems can gyi don la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir
translated: for a bodhisattva who has not attained the stage of nonattachment becomes the very cause of engaging in the welfare of sentient beings by the power of compassion, he says,

original: / yang chags pa med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: / yang chags pa med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, for one who has not attained the stage of nonattachment, etc.

original: chags pa med pa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa gang zhig la zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro bar ma rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa gang zhig la zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro bar ma rtogs pa la'o //
translated: One who has not attained the stage of nonattachment means one who has not realized the all-pervading dharmadhatu.

original: lus gnas pa dang 'gal ba'i yul yang dag par babs pas zhes bya ba ni lus gnas pa ste /
analyzed: lus gnas pa dang 'gal ba'i yul yang dag par babs pas zhes bya ba ni lus gnas pa ste /
translated: The object that is contrary to the stability of the body is the object that is actually present.

original: lus rgyun gyis rab tu 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: lus rgyun gyis rab tu 'jug pa yin la /
translated: The stability of the body is the engagement of the body through continuity.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i yul mtshon la sogs pa babs pa ste /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i yul mtshon la sogs pa babs pa ste /
translated: The object that is contrary to that is a weapon, etc.

original: bsnun pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsnun pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That is the strike.

original: gzhan ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: don de nyid rtsa bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid rtsa bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that meaning with a root text, he says,

original: lus bcad ster zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lus bcad ster zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase cutting up one's body and giving it away and so on.🔽

original: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is easy to understand.

original: 'di'i ngag gi don ni gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' lus gtong ba'i dus na rkang lag la sogs pa gcod pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe bdag gi sdug bsngal gyis dmyal ba'i sems can gyi sdug bsngal rang rig pa bzhin du🔽nyams su myong ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i ngag gi don ni gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' lus gtong ba'i dus na rkang lag la sogs pa gcod pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe bdag gi sdug bsngal gyis dmyal ba'i sems can gyi sdug bsngal rang rig pa bzhin du nyams su myong ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of this verse is that when a bodhisattva is giving away his body, he experiences the suffering of having his arms and legs cut off. At that time, he experiences the suffering of the hell beings as if it were his own.

original: gang gi phyir de'i gnas skabs na bdag nyid kyi rkang lag la sogs pa gcod pa'i sdug bsngal ci ltar 'byung ba de bas stong 'gyur bas kyang de rnams kyi sdug bsngal che ba yin no zhes rnam par dpyod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i gnas skabs na bdag nyid kyi rkang lag la sogs pa gcod pa'i sdug bsngal ci ltar 'byung ba de bas stong 'gyur bas kyang de rnams kyi sdug bsngal che ba yin no zhes rnam par dpyod pa yin no //
translated: This is because at that time, he analyzes the situation, thinking, “The suffering of having my arms and legs cut off is a thousand times less than the suffering of those beings.”

original: des na yang rang gi bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i sgo de rnams kyi sdug bsngal shes pa yin pas rang rig pa bzhin du nyams su myong ba yin no zhes pa'o //🔽des na rang gi sdug bsngal khyad du bsad nas gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gcad par bya ba'i @85a * //
analyzed: des na yang rang gi bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i sgo de rnams kyi sdug bsngal shes pa yin pas rang rig pa bzhin du nyams su myong ba yin no zhes pa'o // des na rang gi sdug bsngal khyad du bsad nas gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gcad par bya ba'i @85a * //
translated: Therefore, since one knows the suffering of those very ones through the door of one's own experience of suffering, it is experienced like self-awareness.

original: phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
translated: Therefore, disregarding one's own suffering, one should strive to eliminate the suffering of others.

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni yi dags kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni yi dags kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The world of Yama is the world of hungry ghosts.

original: sogs pa'i sgras mi'i 'gro ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras mi'i 'gro ba la sogs pa bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: The word etc. includes the world of humans and so on.

original: de rnams kyang sdug bsngal yin pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyang sdug bsngal yin pas so //
translated: Those are also suffering.

original: de rnams nyid mi zad pa ste thar par dka' pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams nyid mi zad pa ste thar par dka' pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those very ones are inexhaustible, difficult to escape.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: da ni sbyin pa la sogs pa ci ltar 'gyur ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sbyin pa la sogs pa ci ltar 'gyur ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show how generosity and so on are,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says as explained and so on.

original: ji skad bshad pa zhes pa ni sngar bstan pa'i phan yon dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa zhes pa ni sngar bstan pa'i phan yon dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The phrase as previously explained refers to the benefits that were previously described.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sbyin pa tsam la tha dad du dbye ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis sbyin pa tsam la tha dad du dbye ba'o //
translated: The phrase the classification of the perfections refers to the fact that the perfections are differentiated from one another by their very nature as perfections, and not merely by their names.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The phrase the mundane and transcendent perfections refers to the fact that the perfections are differentiated as being mundane or transcendent.

original: de nyid rtsa bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid rtsa bas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very point, he says:🔽In relation to generosity, the giver, the recipient, the gift,

original: sbyin pa sbyin bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: the act of giving, and the result of giving,

original: sbyin pa sbyin par bya ba dang / len pa po dang / gtong ba po dang / gtong ba pos gtong ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin par bya ba dang / len pa po dang / gtong ba po dang / gtong ba pos gtong ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: the transcendent perfection of generosity is described.

original: da ni pha rol tu phyin pa sbyin pa'i sgra'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni pha rol tu phyin pa sbyin pa'i sgra'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the meaning of the term “perfection of generosity,” he says:

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In this regard,

original: de la zhes bya ba ni pha rol dang / phyin pa'i tshig gnyis las so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni pha rol dang / phyin pa'i tshig gnyis las so //
translated: Here, it refers to the two words pāra and mitā.

original: tshig phyi ma yod na mi mngon par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgya gar skad la par zhes bya ba dang / ai ta zhes pa'i tshig yod la /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma yod na mi mngon par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgya gar skad la par zhes bya ba dang / ai ta zhes pa'i tshig yod la /
translated: When the latter word exists, it should not be elided. The Indian language has the words pāra and ita.

original: de la tshig gnyis sdud par byed pa'i dus su pa ra la gnyis pa'i gcig pa'i tshig aam byin la /
analyzed: de la tshig gnyis sdud par byed pa'i dus su pa ra la gnyis pa'i gcig pa'i tshig aam byin la /
translated: When the two words are combined, the second singular of a is added to pāra, and the a of ita is elided.

original: aa ta'i phyis /🔽dang po'i tshig tu byin la /🔽pa ra ma ai ta pa ra mi ta zhes tshig bsdu bar bya ba na /
analyzed: aa ta'i phyis / dang po'i tshig tu byin la / pa ra ma ai ta pa ra mi ta zhes tshig bsdu bar bya ba na /
translated: The a of a is elided, and the i of ita is elided.

original: aa ma dang su mngon par 'gyur ba yin pas 'dir tshig phyi ma yod na mi mngon par mi bya ba'i sgra'i rtsa ba tshig gis su mi mngon par byas nas aa ma mi mngon par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: aa ma dang su mngon par 'gyur ba yin pas 'dir tshig phyi ma yod na mi mngon par mi bya ba'i sgra'i rtsa ba tshig gis su mi mngon par byas nas aa ma mi mngon par byas pa yin no //
translated: When the words are combined as pāramita, the a and i become unpronounced, so here, when the latter word exists, the root letter of the word i is not elided, and the a is elided.

original: mtshan nyid 'di las kyi rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'i tshig aa ma mo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di las kyi rnam par dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'i tshig aa ma mo //
translated: This is called the division of action by this characteristic. The word a is the second.

original: gzugs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni pa ra mi ta zhes bya ba'i sgra'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni pa ra mi ta zhes bya ba'i sgra'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Having the nature of the word paramita” means having the nature of the word paramita.

original: pre sho da ra la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ma'i mtha' can nyid du gzhag go zhes bya ba ni pre sho da ra la sogs pa'i tshig gi nang na pa ram zhes bya ba'i tshig ma'i mtha' can te /
analyzed: pre sho da ra la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir ma'i mtha' can nyid du gzhag go zhes bya ba ni pre sho da ra la sogs pa'i tshig gi nang na pa ram zhes bya ba'i tshig ma'i mtha' can te /
translated: “Because of the existence of prasodara, etc., the suffix ma is added” means that in the words prasodara, etc., the word param has the suffix ma.

original: pa ra ma zhes brjod pa yin pas mi mngon par mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pa ra ma zhes brjod pa yin pas mi mngon par mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Since it is said to be param, it should not be made invisible.

original: shes rab gzug @85b nas bye brag tu bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes rab gzug @85b nas bye brag tu bstan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The perfection of giving is taught in particular, based on wisdom, which has the nature of the three non-apprehensions.”

original: mi dmigs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin can shes rab la brten nas /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gsum gyi rang bzhin can shes rab la brten nas /
translated: Based on wisdom, which has the nature of the three non-apprehensions,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bye brag tu bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bye brag tu bshad pa yin no //
translated: the perfection of giving is taught in particular.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis gzung bar ma gyur cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis gzung bar ma gyur cing /
translated: When it is not apprehended by wisdom,

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa gsum dang ldan pa la sogs pa la pha rol tu phyin par ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa gsum dang ldan pa la sogs pa la pha rol tu phyin par ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: how can it be called a perfection in the context of possessing the three focal objects, and so on?

original: lan ni / sbyin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lan ni / sbyin pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The answer is:

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin kyang pha rol tu 'gro bar nges par gzhag pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'dra bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin kyang pha rol tu 'gro bar nges par gzhag pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'dra bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob pa yin no //
translated: Because of the dedication of the merit, the perfections are established as certain to go to the other shore.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, “because of the dedication of the merit,” and so forth.

original: bsod nams 'dis sangs rgyas nyid thob nas 'gro ba rnams 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral bar bya'o zhes yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyis pha rol tu 'gro bar nges par gzhag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsod nams 'dis sangs rgyas nyid thob nas 'gro ba rnams 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las bsgral bar bya'o zhes yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyis pha rol tu 'gro bar nges par gzhag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The merit is dedicated with the thought, “Having attained buddhahood through this merit, I will liberate beings from the suffering of cyclic existence.” Because of the special dedication, the perfections are established as certain to go to the other shore. The meaning is that they obtain the name “perfection.”

original: tshul khrims las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar sbyin pa mi dmigs pas zin pa gtso bo'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob la /
analyzed: tshul khrims las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar sbyin pa mi dmigs pas zin pa gtso bo'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob la /
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with “morality” is that just as generosity is embraced by the nonapprehension of the three sectors and is called the perfection of generosity,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nye bar btags nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob pa de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa yang yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa nye bar btags nas pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob pa de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa yang yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: so too are morality and so on.

original: mi dmigs pas zin pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas zin pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The generosity and so on embraced by the nonapprehension of the three sectors are not only called perfections.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes kyang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes kyang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that they are also called supramundane perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “perfection,” and so on.

original: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the reason for that, he says,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “because they transcend the mundane,” and so on.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is mundane because it has an objective support. It is supramundane because it is without an objective support.🔽In order to demonstrate that generosity, etc. which is not embraced by the perfection of wisdom is mundane, he says:

original: gang sbyin pa la sogs pa shes rab kyis ma zin pa de dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de ni zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa gtong ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang sbyin pa la sogs pa shes rab kyis ma zin pa de dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de ni zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa gtong ba nyid do //
translated: That is generosity, etc. which is not embraced by the perfection of wisdom.🔽The generosity, etc. of the bodhisattva is not mundane.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni sa dang po ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs ma thob pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni sa dang po ma thob pa'o //
translated: The generosity, etc. of those who have not attained the stage of the bodhisattva is mundane.

original: lhag ma go sla'o //🔽da ni ji skad brjod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs @86a * //
analyzed: lhag ma go sla'o // da ni ji skad brjod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs @86a * //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: pas ni tshigs su bcad pa'i 'brel pa ston pa yin no //🔽rgyal ba'i sras kyi yid la rab gnas shing //
analyzed: pas ni tshigs su bcad pa'i 'brel pa ston pa yin no // rgyal ba'i sras kyi yid la rab gnas shing //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the connection with the verse, he says:🔽The generosity, etc. of the bodhisattva is not mundane.🔽It is well-established in the mind of the victors' spiritual heir.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems la rab tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems la rab tu gnas pa'o //
translated: It is well-established in the mind of the bodhisattvas.

original: yid dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes tha mi dad du zin kyang tha dad par brtags nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yid dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes tha mi dad du zin kyang tha dad par brtags nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: Although the intuition is not different from the mind, it is described as if it were different, having been imagined to be different.

original: dam pa'i rten la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems la'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i rten la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems la'o //
translated: The support of the holy is the thought of the bodhisattva.

original: de'i stobs kyis 'dod chags pa ste /🔽nyon mongs pa'i dri ma bsal bas so //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis 'dod chags pa ste / nyon mongs pa'i dri ma bsal bas so //
translated: By its power, the passion is the passion of the bodhisattva.

original: mdzes pa ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzes pa ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is beautiful because it is endowed with virtues.

original: dga' ba 'di ni zhes bya ba ni dga' bar byed pas na'o //
analyzed: dga' ba 'di ni zhes bya ba ni dga' bar byed pas na'o //
translated: This joy is called joyful because it causes joy.

original: nor bu chu shel bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de yang rten zla ba'i stobs kyis 'od chags pa mdzes pas mun pa stug po sel ba bzhin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nor bu chu shel bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de yang rten zla ba'i stobs kyis 'od chags pa mdzes pas mun pa stug po sel ba bzhin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Like a water-crystal gem means that just as a water-crystal gem, by the power of the moon which is its support, is beautiful with its reflections and dispels the thick darkness, so also the bodhisattva's passion, by the power of the intuition of the ultimate, which is its support, is beautiful with its reflections and dispels the thick darkness of the addictions of himself and others.

original: rgyal zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs pham par byas nas gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rgyal zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs pham par byas nas gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to // de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The word victorious means that it abides having conquered the resistant tendency.

original: mun pa stug po thams cad rnam par bsal te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mun pa stug po thams cad rnam par bsal te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For this very reason, it is said, having dispelled all thick darkness.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams de kho na nyid mthong ba la gegs byed pa'i phyir mun pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams de kho na nyid mthong ba la gegs byed pa'i phyir mun pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas so //
translated: Because the afflictions are of the nature of darkness, since they obstruct the vision of reality.

original: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'grel pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: de ltar gyi sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar gyi sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “In that way, etc.”

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In order to teach the aspect that was explained” means

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni dga' ba mchog tu 'gyur 'chang zhing //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni dga' ba mchog tu 'gyur 'chang zhing //
translated: “that bodhisattva will have the highest joy.”

original: zhes bya ba ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'o //
translated: The aspect is as was explained.

original: lhag ma go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i 'grel pa le'u dang po'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dbu ma la 'jug pa'i 'grel pa le'u dang po'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the first chapter of the Madhyamakavatara is finished.

original: // / le'u gnyis pa'i 'grel pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / le'u gnyis pa'i 'grel pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the second chapter,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “bodhisattva,” etc.

original: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the bodhisattva.

original: tshul khrims phun tshogs yon tan dag ldan phyir //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun tshogs yon tan dag ldan phyir //
translated: Because he is endowed with the qualities of perfect morality,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'grel pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'grel pas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is explained in the commentary.

original: rmi lam du yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rmi lam du yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even in dreams,

original: yang gi sgras ni sad pa'i gnas skabs na lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽tshul khrims dri ma spangs zhes bya ba ni 'tshal ba'i tshul khrims ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yin la /
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni sad pa'i gnas skabs na lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to // tshul khrims dri ma spangs zhes bya ba ni 'tshal ba'i tshul khrims ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yin la /
translated: the word even means that there is no need to mention the waking state.

original: de nyid dri ma ste lus la sogs pa mi gtsang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dri ma ste lus la sogs pa mi gtsang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abandoning the stain of morality means that the morality of the ten unwholesome courses of action is a stain, because it makes the body and so on impure.

original: de spangs pa ni de dang bral lo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de spangs pa ni de dang bral lo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Abandoning that means being free from that.

original: sems bskyed pa gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba ji ltar yin pa de ltar bstan @86b par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba ji ltar yin pa de ltar bstan @86b par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show how the second and subsequent arousals of mind are differentiated,

original: sa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “stage,” and so on.

original: shes pa'i khyad par thams cad ni rang bzhin gcig nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i khyad par thams cad ni rang bzhin gcig nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All the distinctions of knowledge are due to the single nature, because there is no distinction in the nature of nondual knowledge.

original: de med na mi 'byung ba'i yon tan tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phul du byung ba nyid las zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes med na mi 'byung ba'i yon tan tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa phul
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba'i yon tan tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phul du byung ba nyid las zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes med na mi 'byung ba'i yon tan tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa phul
translated: The second generation of the Thought, etc., are the divisions of the stages, from the excellence of the perfection of morality, which is the quality that does not occur without that, i.e., the nondual intuition.🔽The excellence of the perfection of morality, etc., is the quality that does not occur without the nondual intuition.

original: du byung ba nyid las sems bskyed pa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa'i dbye bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: du byung ba nyid las sems bskyed pa gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa'i dbye bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The second generation of the Thought, etc., are the divisions of the stages, from the excellence of the perfection of morality, which is the quality that does not occur without that, i.e., the nondual intuition.

original: ngo bo'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo'i sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not divisions by way of the essence.

original: de la tshul khrims kyi mtshan nyid dang rab tu dbye ba ni sngar t'i k'a las bstan zin to //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyi mtshan nyid dang rab tu dbye ba ni sngar t'i k'a las bstan zin to //
translated: The definition and divisions of morality have already been taught in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: da ni tshul khrims kyi nges tshig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni tshul khrims kyi nges tshig bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the verbal derivation of morality, he says,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽nyon mongs pa dang du mi len pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / nyon mongs pa dang du mi len pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Therein, etc.”

original: mi dge ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sems kyis dang du mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sems kyis dang du mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because one does not tolerate the afflictions” means that one does not tolerate the mind that is an affliction, which is the cause of the nonvirtuous.

original: sdig pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu med na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu med na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no sin means that if there is no cause, there is no effect.

original: sems la yid gcags pa'i mi zhi bas zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa la 'jug pas yid gcags pa 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: sems la yid gcags pa'i mi zhi bas zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa la 'jug pas yid gcags pa 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Because the mind is not tormented means that the mind is tormented by engaging in killing, etc.

original: de med pas bsil ba'i tshul khrims nyid do //
analyzed: de med pas bsil ba'i tshul khrims nyid do //
translated: Since that does not exist, there is the coolness of morality.

original: nges tshig gnyis pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nges tshig gnyis pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the second etymological meaning, he says:

original: bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The cause of happiness, etc.

original: bde ba'i rgyu ni bde 'gro'i rgyu nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu ni bde 'gro'i rgyu nyid kyis so //
translated: The cause of happiness is the cause of good destinies.

original: yang na tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i lus bsrabs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i lus bsrabs par 'gyur la /
translated: Or, one who is endowed with morality will have a lean body.

original: lus bsrabs pa ni bde bar rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pas tshul khrims ni bde ba nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: lus bsrabs pa ni bde bar rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pas tshul khrims ni bde ba nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: And it is said that a lean body is known as happiness. Thus, morality is the cause of happiness itself.

original: des na bde ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas dam pa rnams kyis brten par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims so //
analyzed: des na bde ba'i rgyu nyid yin pas dam pa rnams kyis brten par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims so //
translated: Therefore, because it is the cause of happiness, it is morality, since it is to be relied upon by the holy ones.

original: sdom pa'i rang bzhin can gyi tshul khrims kyi dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdom pa'i rang bzhin can gyi tshul khrims kyi dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the divisions of morality that has the nature of restraint, he says:

original: de yang spong ba bdun gyi mtshan nyid can no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang spong ba bdun gyi mtshan nyid can no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It has the nature of the seven abandonments.

original: de la spong ba bdun ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang ; brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / ngag 'khyal pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: de la spong ba bdun ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang ; brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / ngag 'khyal pa spong ba'o //
translated: The seven abandonments are abandoning killing, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, and frivolous speech.

original: de la srog chags gzhan gsod pa ni srog gcod pa ste /🔽srog chags yin pa dang / srog chags su 'du shes pa dang / gsod par 'dod pa dang / nye bar rtsom pa dang / dngos su gsod pa ste /
analyzed: de la srog chags gzhan gsod pa ni srog gcod pa ste / srog chags yin pa dang / srog chags su 'du shes pa dang / gsod par 'dod pa dang / nye bar rtsom pa dang / dngos su gsod pa ste /
translated: Among them, killing is killing another living being.

original: @87a * // yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: @87a * // yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It has five members: the living being, the perception of the living being, the desire to kill, the preparation, and the actual killing.

original: de la gang gsod par 'dod pa de bsad na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gang gsod par 'dod pa de bsad na yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Among them, if one kills the one who is desired to be killed, but not another,

original: de yang sbyor ba des de ma thag tu 'am /
analyzed: de yang sbyor ba des de ma thag tu 'am /
translated: and if that one is killed immediately by that preparation,

original: phyis shi bar gyur na srog gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis shi bar gyur na srog gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he dies later, then he has killed.

original: de spong ba ni srog gcod pa spong ba'o //🔽ma byin par len pa ni nor gyi bdag pa gzhan la dngos su stobs kyis sam /
analyzed: de spong ba ni srog gcod pa spong ba'o // ma byin par len pa ni nor gyi bdag pa gzhan la dngos su stobs kyis sam /
translated: Abandoning that is abandoning killing.🔽Stealing is taking the wealth of others by force or by stealth.

original: dngos su ma yin pa rku ba'i sgo nas nor len pa ni ma byin par len pa ste /
analyzed: dngos su ma yin pa rku ba'i sgo nas nor len pa ni ma byin par len pa ste /
translated: Stealing is taking the wealth of others by force or by stealth.

original: gzhan gyi yin pa dang / gzhan gyi yin par 'du shes pa dang / len par 'dod pa dang / nye bar rtsom pa dang / dngos su len pa nyid ni yan lag lnga'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yin pa dang / gzhan gyi yin par 'du shes pa dang / len par 'dod pa dang / nye bar rtsom pa dang / dngos su len pa nyid ni yan lag lnga'o //
translated: There are five members: it belongs to another, the perception that it belongs to another, the desire to steal it, the effort to take it, and the actual taking.

original: gal te gang len par 'dod pa de nyid blangs na de'i tshe ma byin par blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te gang len par 'dod pa de nyid blangs na de'i tshe ma byin par blangs pa yin la /
translated: If one takes what one desires to steal, then at that time it is stealing.

original: de spong ba ni ma byin par len pa las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: de spong ba ni ma byin par len pa las ldog pa yin no //
translated: Abandoning that is turning away from stealing.

original: 'dod pa las log par spyod pa ni bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yan lag ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin par 'gro ba ni 'dod pa las log par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa las log par spyod pa ni bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yan lag ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin par 'gro ba ni 'dod pa las log par spyod pa ste /
translated: Sexual misconduct is going to a place that should not be gone to, with a part that should not be used, in a place that is not fit, or at a time that is not fit.

original: bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / bgrod par bya ba ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / mngon par 'gro bar 'dod pa dang / nye bar rtsom pa dang / dngos su spyod pa ni yan lag lnga'o //
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / bgrod par bya ba ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / mngon par 'gro bar 'dod pa dang / nye bar rtsom pa dang / dngos su spyod pa ni yan lag lnga'o //
translated: The five members are: the improper object, the perception of the improper object, the desire to engage in sexual intercourse, the effort, and the actual performance.

original: de la rang gi chung ma dang smad 'tshong ma dag ni bgrod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la rang gi chung ma dang smad 'tshong ma dag ni bgrod par bya ba ste /
translated: One’s own wife and a prostitute are the proper objects,

original: de'i ched du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ched du yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are taken for that purpose.

original: de las gzhan pa ni bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Others are improper objects.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: They are of three kinds:

original: rang bzhin gyis bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / gzhan gyis bdag tu bzung bas bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa tsam mo //🔽de la rang bzhin gyis bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa ni ma'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / gzhan gyis bdag tu bzung bas bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa tsam mo // de la rang bzhin gyis bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa ni ma'am /
translated: naturally improper objects, those who are the property of others, and those who are merely improper.

original: sring mo'am / bu mo'am /
analyzed: sring mo'am / bu mo'am /
translated: A mother, a sister, or a daughter,

original: pha dang / ma dang 'brel pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: pha dang / ma dang 'brel pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: or anyone related to one’s father or mother,🔽are naturally improper objects.

original: ngo tsha ba nyid kyi sgo nas yongs su dor bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / bud med rab tu byung ba yang yin te /
analyzed: ngo tsha ba nyid kyi sgo nas yongs su dor bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / bud med rab tu byung ba yang yin te /
translated: and because they are to be rejected on the basis of shame.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: And women are also ordained, because they have transcended worldly norms.

original: / de las gzhan pa rnams ni gzhan gyis bdag tu bzung ba'i bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de las ldog pa ni brdzun du smra ba spong ba'o //🔽gzhan mdza' bo rnams sam mi mdza' ba rnams dbye ba'i phyir ram /

original: yan lag lnga'o //
