analyzed: /'tsho ba'i yo byad ces bya ba ni gos dang bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The necessities of life are clothing, food, drink, and so on.

original: de gzhan gyis bzung ba'i bud med dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bdag tu bzung ba'i bud med do //
analyzed: de gzhan gyis bzung ba'i bud med dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bdag tu bzung ba'i bud med do //
translated: A woman who is held by another is one who is held by her father, mother, or relatives, or by the king’s edict.

original: gzhan gyi chung ma dang zhes bya ba ni dngos su chung mar blangs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chung ma dang zhes bya ba ni dngos su chung mar blangs pa'o //
translated: Another’s wife is one who has been taken as a wife by another.

original: rigs dang / rtags dang ; chos kyis bsrungs pa rnams la zhes bya ba la rigs kyis bsrungs ba ni gzhon nu ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs dang / rtags dang ; chos kyis bsrungs pa rnams la zhes bya ba la rigs kyis bsrungs ba ni gzhon nu ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: A woman who is protected by her family, by her caste, or by the Dharma is one who is protected by her family, by her caste, or by the Dharma.🔽A woman who is protected by her family is one who is protected by her father, mother, parents, or relatives.

original: rtags kyis bsrungs ba ni chos gos kyi rtags kyis bsrungs pa dge slong ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtags kyis bsrungs ba ni chos gos kyi rtags kyis bsrungs pa dge slong ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: A woman who is protected by her caste is one who is protected by the threat of a fine.

original: chos kyis bsrungs pa ni bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyis bsrungs pa ni bsnyen gnas kyi sdom pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: A woman who is protected by the Dharma is one who is protected by the Dharma of the noble ones.

original: yan lag ma yin pa'i rnam par rig byed dam zhes bya ba ni kha la sogs par log par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag ma yin pa'i rnam par rig byed dam zhes bya ba ni kha la sogs par log par spyod pa'o //
translated: “Non-member” means sexual misconduct, such as in the mouth, etc.

original: bden par smra zhing zhes bya ba ni gzhan la nges par phan pa nyid smra ba ste /🔽gzhan la nges par phan pa bden zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: bden par smra zhing zhes bya ba ni gzhan la nges par phan pa nyid smra ba ste / gzhan la nges par phan pa bden zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: “Speaking the truth” means speaking for the sake of others’ certainty.

original: dus su smra ba ste zhes bya ba ni dus gang du gang smra bar 'os pa de smra zhing gzhan du mi smra'o //
analyzed: dus su smra ba ste zhes bya ba ni dus gang du gang smra bar 'os pa de smra zhing gzhan du mi smra'o //
translated: “Speaking at the right time” means speaking at the time when it is appropriate to speak, not at other times.

original: tshod du smra ba dang zhes bya ba ni tshod zin pa nyid du smra ba'o //
analyzed: tshod du smra ba dang zhes bya ba ni tshod zin pa nyid du smra ba'o //
translated: “Speaking moderately” means speaking in moderation.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang smra ba de las kyis sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang smra ba de las kyis sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: “Doing what one says” means practicing what one preaches.

original: de tha na zhes bya ba ni srog gi phyir na yang ngo //
analyzed: de tha na zhes bya ba ni srog gi phyir na yang ngo //
translated: “Even at the cost of one’s life” means even at the risk of one’s life.

original: rmi lam na yang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang ngo //
translated: “Even in dreams” means even in the state of dreaming.

original: lta ba dang zhes bya ba ni mig gis bltas nas de mi bden pa la mi bden pa nyid du mthong nas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lta ba dang zhes bya ba ni mig gis bltas nas de mi bden pa la mi bden pa nyid du mthong nas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “View” means that having seen with the eye, one sees that which is not true as not true.

original: bzod pa dang zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas bsams nas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bzod pa dang zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas bsams nas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “Patience” means that having reflected with the mental consciousness.

original: 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa bskyed nas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa bskyed nas so //
translated: “Desire” means that having generated the desire.

original: rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba @89b ni shes rab kyis yongs su shes par byas nas so //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa dang zhes bya ba @89b ni shes rab kyis yongs su shes par byas nas so //
translated: “Realization” means that having understood with wisdom.

original: bsgyur te zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'jug par byas te zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bsgyur te zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'jug par byas te zhes pa'o //
translated: “Having changed” means having engaged.

original: bslu ba'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni bslu bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: bslu ba'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni bslu bar 'dod pas so //
translated: “With the intention to deceive” means with the desire to deceive.

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs na sems sngon du btang nas so //🔽dbye na mi byed cing rnam par mi 'tshe ba la zhugs pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs na sems sngon du btang nas so // dbye na mi byed cing rnam par mi 'tshe ba la zhugs pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: “In the state of being awake” means having sent the mind ahead.🔽“Not dividing” means not causing division. “Engaging in non-violence” means

original: 'di dag rtag tu mthun par gyur cig / mi mthun par ma gyur cig snyam pa ni dbye na mi byed pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag rtag tu mthun par gyur cig / mi mthun par ma gyur cig snyam pa ni dbye na mi byed pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: “May they always be in harmony, may they not be in disharmony.” This is engaging in not dividing.

original: 'di dag byed par 'gyur ba la lus dang / ngag dag gis rim pa bzhin du thal lcags la sogs pa dang / gnad du phog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par 'tshe ba med par gyur cig snyam pa ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag byed par 'gyur ba la lus dang / ngag dag gis rim pa bzhin du thal lcags la sogs pa dang / gnad du phog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par 'tshe ba med par gyur cig snyam pa ni rnam par mi 'tshe ba la zhugs pa'o //
translated: One should think, May they not be harmed by me, either physically or verbally, through the use of sticks, etc., or through the characteristic of striking a vital point, and so on. This is called engaging in non-harming.

original: tshu gi las zhes bya ba ni 'di las so //
analyzed: tshu gi las zhes bya ba ni 'di las so //
translated: From this side means from here.

original: pha gir bsnyod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan la mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: pha gir bsnyod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan la mi smra ba'o //
translated: Not to the other side means not to another.

original: bye ba rnams la yang mi gnod do zhes bya ba ni mthun par mi byed cing mi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bye ba rnams la yang mi gnod do zhes bya ba ni mthun par mi byed cing mi brjod pa'o //
translated: Not to the multitude means not to those who are in agreement.

original: mi 'dum pa la dga' zhing mi 'dum pa la mos pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan mi 'dum pas yid bde zhing rgyun du yid bde ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dum pa la dga' zhing mi 'dum pa la mos pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan mi 'dum pas yid bde zhing rgyun du yid bde ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: One who delights in disharmony and is devoted to disharmony means one who is pleased by the disharmony of others and always generates mental pleasure.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bden nam brdzun yang mi 'dum par bya ba'i tshig mi smra'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bden nam brdzun yang mi 'dum par bya ba'i tshig mi smra'o //
translated: Therefore, whether true or false, one does not speak words that cause disharmony.

original: zher 'debs pa dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba nyams par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zher 'debs pa dang zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba nyams par byed pa'o //
translated: Reproaching means causing the roots of virtue to decline.

original: brlang ba dang zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brlang ba dang zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa brjod pa'o //
translated: Harsh means to express intolerance.

original: rtsub pa dang zhes bya ba ni don rtogs pas dga' ba skyed par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtsub pa dang zhes bya ba ni don rtogs pas dga' ba skyed par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Rough means to not generate joy through understanding the meaning.

original: gzhan la gnod pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshig gi bye brag 'byed par dka' bas so //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshig gi bye brag 'byed par dka' bas so //
translated: Harmful to others means that it is difficult to distinguish the different words.

original: gzhan gyi mtshang 'bru ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi skyon brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi mtshang 'bru ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi skyon brjod pa'o //
translated: Exposing the faults of others means to state the faults of others.

original: grong mi'i tshig dang zhes bya ba ni skabs su ma bab pa brjod pa'o //🔽ma rabs kyi tshig gi ngor brjod pa dang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du smra ba'o //
analyzed: grong mi'i tshig dang zhes bya ba ni skabs su ma bab pa brjod pa'o // ma rabs kyi tshig gi ngor brjod pa dang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du smra ba'o //
translated: Words of the townspeople means to express what is not appropriate.🔽Words of the vulgar means to speak directly.

original: ngor brjod pa gzhol ba dang zhes bya ba ni shugs kyis ngor brjod pa lta bur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ngor brjod pa gzhol ba dang zhes bya ba ni shugs kyis ngor brjod pa lta bur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Words that are directed means to speak indirectly, as if directed.

original: gzungs su gzung ba dang zhes bya ba ni rgol ba po gzhan gyis gcod par nus pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs su gzung ba dang zhes bya ba ni rgol ba po gzhan gyis gcod par nus pa'o //
translated: Words that are held means that others who are opponents are able to refute.

original: rnar mi snyan pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshig mi snyan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rnar mi snyan pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshig mi snyan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Unpleasant to the ear means that it is unpleasant due to the unpleasantness of the words.

original: khro zhing gshe ba las byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang gshe bas bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khro zhing gshe ba las byung ba dang zhes bya ba ni khro ba dang gshe bas bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Arisen from anger and harsh speech means that they are produced by anger and harsh speech.

original: mi snyan pa dang yid du mi 'ong bas snying na bar byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi snyan pa dang yid du mi 'ong bas snying na bar byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are painful to the heart because of unpleasant and disagreeable sounds.

original: sgra'i sgo nas mi snyan pa yin la /
analyzed: sgra'i sgo nas mi snyan pa yin la /
translated: They are unpleasant in terms of sound.

original: don gyi sgo nas yid du mi 'ong ba ste /🔽@90a * // des snying na bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi sgo nas yid du mi 'ong ba ste / @90a * // des snying na bar byed pa'o //
translated: They are disagreeable in terms of meaning.🔽They are painful to the heart because of that.

original: yid gdung bar byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni snying ches na bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid gdung bar byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni snying ches na bar byed pa'o //
translated: They afflict the mind because they afflict the heart.

original: rang gi sems kyi rgyud dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud ma rungs par byed pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni rang dang gzhan ngan song du 'gro ba'i rgyu'i tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi rgyud dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud ma rungs par byed pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni rang dang gzhan ngan song du 'gro ba'i rgyu'i tshig go //
translated: They are words that disturb the mental continuum of oneself and others because they are words that are the cause of oneself and others going to the miserable realms.

original: de lta bu mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu mi smra ba'o //
translated: One does not speak in that way.

original: gang 'di mnyen pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba la nye bar ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di mnyen pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba la nye bar ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Gentle means that one teaches the realms of sentient beings the roots of virtue.

original: 'jam pa dang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar reg pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa dang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar reg pa'o //
translated: Gentle means that it is pleasant to the touch in this very life.

original: yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni bzang po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni bzang po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Pleasant means that it is endowed with excellence.

original: dga' bar byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshig 'bru bzang po yin pas so //
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshig 'bru bzang po yin pas so //
translated: Delightful means that it is endowed with excellent words.

original: brdzun pa ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi rgol ba po thams cad kyis gcod par mi nus pas so //
analyzed: brdzun pa ma yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi rgol ba po thams cad kyis gcod par mi nus pas so //
translated: Not false means that it cannot be refuted by any opponent.

original: rnar snyan pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshig mdzes pas so //
analyzed: rnar snyan pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshig mdzes pas so //
translated: Agreeable to the ear means that it is endowed with beautiful words.

original: snying du sdug pa dang zhes bya ba ni gdul bya dang rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying du sdug pa dang zhes bya ba ni gdul bya dang rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Charming to the heart means that it is in accord with the disciples.

original: grong khyer la zhes bya ba ni 'khor thams cad kyis thos par byed pa'o //
analyzed: grong khyer la zhes bya ba ni 'khor thams cad kyis thos par byed pa'o //
translated: City means that it is heard in all circles.🔽 Delightful to many people and so on means that it delights in the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation, and in the final stage.🔽 🔽Not mixed means that it is not mixed with the faults of the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not deficient means that it is not deficient in the three aspects of speech.

original: skye bo mang po'i snying du sdug pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa dang / mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs na dga' bar byed pas so //
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i snying du sdug pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa dang / mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs na dga' bar byed pas so //
translated: Not excessive means that it is not excessive in the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not scattered means that it is not scattered in the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not confused means that it is not confused in the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not distorted means that it is not distorted in the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not inverted means that it is not inverted in the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not defiled means that it is not defiled by the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not agitated means that it is not agitated by the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not dull means that it is not dull in the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not obscured means that it is not obscured by the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not obscured by afflictions means that it is not obscured by afflictions in the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not obscured by karma means that it is not obscured by karma in the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not obscured by rebirth means that it is not obscured by rebirth in the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not obscured by views means that it is not obscured by views in the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not obscured by pride means that it is not obscured by pride in the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not obscured by doubt means that it is not obscured by doubt in the three aspects of speech.🔽 Not obscured by desire means that it is not

original: rang gi sems kyi rgyud dang gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud dang bar byed pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni rang dang gzhan dag gi mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi rgyud dang gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud dang bar byed pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni rang dang gzhan dag gi mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “words that create harmony in one’s own mind and in the minds of others” means that they are the cause of both high status and certain goodness for oneself and others.

original: lan ldon pa'i tshig dang zhes bya ba ni de'i ngag thams cad kyis gus par len pa'o //
analyzed: lan ldon pa'i tshig dang zhes bya ba ni de'i ngag thams cad kyis gus par len pa'o //
translated: The phrase “words that are responsive” means that all of his speech is respectful.

original: dus su smra ba dang zhes bya ba ni dus la bab na smra ba'o //
analyzed: dus su smra ba dang zhes bya ba ni dus la bab na smra ba'o //
translated: The phrase “words that are timely” means that he speaks when the time is right.

original: yang dag par smra ba zhes bya ba ni bden par smra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par smra ba zhes bya ba ni bden par smra ba'o //
translated: The phrase “words that are true” means that he speaks the truth.

original: bden par smra ba yin kyang gang dogs pa med pa de mi smra ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bden par smra ba yin kyang gang dogs pa med pa de mi smra ba yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Even though he speaks the truth, he does not speak what is not appropriate.

original: don smra ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: don smra ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: To show this, the text says, “words that are meaningful.”

original: don dang bcas par smrar zin kyang 'jig rten pa'i dogs pa dang bcas pa'i don smra ba yod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: don dang bcas par smrar zin kyang 'jig rten pa'i dogs pa dang bcas pa'i don smra ba yod pas de'i phyir /
translated: Even though he speaks what is meaningful, there are those who speak what is meaningful but with worldly motives.

original: chos smra ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: chos smra ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the text says, “words that are spiritual.”

original: mu stegs pa thams cad kyang kho bo cag ni chos smra ba po yin no snyam du zhen pa yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: mu stegs pa thams cad kyang kho bo cag ni chos smra ba po yin no snyam du zhen pa yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: All the tirthikas are attached to the idea that they are expounders of the Dharma, so

original: rigs par smra ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rigs par smra ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, “they are logicians.”

original: chos su smra ba de yang nga rgyal gyis smra ba yod pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: chos su smra ba de yang nga rgyal gyis smra ba yod pas de'i phyir /
translated: But even those who expound the Dharma do so out of pride, so he says,

original: dul bar smra ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dul bar smra ba dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: “they are self-controlled.”

original: gzob pa dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang dag dri ba po dang nye ba na smra ba'o //
analyzed: gzob pa dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang dag dri ba po dang nye ba na smra ba'o //
translated: “They are polite” means that they speak in the presence of those who are asking questions.

original: dus dang rmed dang bcas pa'i tshig ces @90b bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pas brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dus dang rmed dang bcas pa'i tshig ces @90b bya ba ni sems rtse gcig pas brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Their speech is timely and measured” means that they speak with a one-pointed mind.

original: de tha na bzhad gad byas pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan la co 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: de tha na bzhad gad byas pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan la co 'dri ba'o //
translated: “They do not even laugh at others” means that they do not ridicule others.

original: gzhan gyi longs spyod dang zhes bya ba ni kha zas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi longs spyod dang zhes bya ba ni kha zas la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The wealth of others” refers to food and so on.

original: gzhan gyi nor dang zhes bya ba ni gser la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor dang zhes bya ba ni gser la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The property of others” refers to gold and so on.

original: yo byad ces bya ba ni mal stan la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: yo byad ces bya ba ni mal stan la sogs pa'o ;
translated: “Goods” refers to bedding and so on.

original: / yang na nor dang yo byad ni longs spyod kyi bshad pa'o //
analyzed: / yang na nor dang yo byad ni longs spyod kyi bshad pa'o //
translated: Or else, wealth and possessions are explained as enjoyments.

original: mngon par 'dod pa tsam yang mi bskyed cing don du yang mi gnyer la mi smon te /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa tsam yang mi bskyed cing don du yang mi gnyer la mi smon te /
translated: He does not even arouse a mere desire for them, nor does he pursue them or wish for them.

original: chags pa'i sems kyang mi skyed do zhes bya ba ni chags pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / chen po'i chen po'i dbye ba byas nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa'i sems kyang mi skyed do zhes bya ba ni chags pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / chen po'i chen po'i dbye ba byas nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: He does not arouse a greedy mind. This is said by distinguishing between small, medium, and great greed, and great-great greed.

original: byams pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: byams pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa'i rnam pa can no //
translated: A loving mind is the aspect of wishing for beings to have happiness in this life.

original: snying rje'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa can no /
analyzed: snying rje'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa can no /
translated: A compassionate mind is the aspect of wishing for all beings to be free from suffering.

original: 'jam pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang ldan pa dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang ldan pa dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa can no //
translated: A gentle mind is the aspect of wishing for those who have happiness not to be separated from it.

original: skye bo thams cad la phan gdags pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa rnams la btang snyoms su gyur cig snyam pa'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad la phan gdags pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa rnams la btang snyoms su gyur cig snyam pa'i rnam pa can no //
translated: The thought of benefiting all beings is the aspect of thinking, “May all sentient beings become indifferent to the afflictions.”

original: khro ba dang zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i rgyur gyur pa nye bar gnas na zhe sdang gi cha shas can sems 'khrug pa dbyug pa dang mtshon cha la sogs 'dzin par byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: khro ba dang zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i rgyur gyur pa nye bar gnas na zhe sdang gi cha shas can sems 'khrug pa dbyug pa dang mtshon cha la sogs 'dzin par byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Anger is a mental factor that, when a cause of harm is present, disturbs the mind and is a part of hatred. Its function is to take up sticks and weapons.

original: khon du 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhe sdang gi cha shas can 'gal ba'i rgyun de nyid mi gtong ba ste /
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhe sdang gi cha shas can 'gal ba'i rgyun de nyid mi gtong ba ste /
translated: Bearing a grudge is a mental factor that, on that basis, does not let go of the continuity of that hostility and is a part of hatred.

original: gnod par byas pa mi bzod pa'i las can no //
analyzed: gnod par byas pa mi bzod pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is to not tolerate harm.🔽Stubbornness is a mental factor that, on that basis, does not let go of the continuity of that hostility and is a part of hatred.🔽Its function is to not tolerate harm.

original: tha ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tha ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gsum ste /
translated: Stubbornness is a part of the three, attachment and so on.

original: gang gis thar pa thob pa'i don du sems bskyed pa las su mi rung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis thar pa thob pa'i don du sems bskyed pa las su mi rung bar byed pa'o //
translated: It makes the mind unworkable with regard to the generation of the thought that is the purpose of attaining liberation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnyen po thong gshol gyis rmo bar dka' bas thab zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnyen po thong gshol gyis rmo bar dka' bas thab zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to plow it with the plow of the antidote, and thus it is called “hard.”

original: skye ba gzhan du goms pa'i stobs kyis tha bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan du goms pa'i stobs kyis tha bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is hardened by the power of habituation in other lives.

original: dri ma ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug ste ;
analyzed: dri ma ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug ste ;
translated: “ Stain” means attachment, hostility, and benightedness.

original: 'tshol pa'i tshul khrims mi gtsang ba 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tshol pa'i tshul khrims mi gtsang ba 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of impurity in the morality of the seeker.

original: gnod sems ni zhe sdang ste /
analyzed: gnod sems ni zhe sdang ste /
translated: “ Malice” means hostility.

original: brdeg go bsad do snyam pa'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: brdeg go bsad do snyam pa'i rnam pa can no //
translated: It has the form of the thought to beat and kill.

original: yongs su gdung ba dang zhes bya ba ni yongs su gdung ba yang gsum ste /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba dang zhes bya ba ni yongs su gdung ba yang gsum ste /
translated: “ Torment” means the three torments:

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go //🔽gang gi @91a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug go // gang gi @91a * //
translated: attachment, hostility, and benightedness.

original: phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la brten nas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'byung la /
analyzed: phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la brten nas tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'byung la /
translated: Because improper mental activity arises in dependence on attachment, hostility, and benightedness,

original: des lus dang sems gdung bar byed pas so //
analyzed: des lus dang sems gdung bar byed pas so //
translated: and that torments body and mind.

original: 'khrug pa dang zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyis sems 'khrug par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'khrug pa dang zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyis sems 'khrug par byed pas so //
translated: “Agitation” means that they agitate the mind.

original: khong khro ba zhes bya ba ni sems rtsub pa'o ;
analyzed: khong khro ba zhes bya ba ni sems rtsub pa'o ;
translated: “Anger” means a rough state of mind.

original: / de dag la rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag yang nas yang du yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: / de dag la rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag yang nas yang du yid la byed pa'o //
translated: “They contemplate them” means that they repeatedly bring them to mind.

original: yang dag pa'i lam la gnas shing zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba nyid bde 'gro'i lam yin pas yang dag pa'i lam yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam la gnas shing zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba nyid bde 'gro'i lam yin pas yang dag pa'i lam yin la /
translated: “Abiding in the true path” means that right view is the path to good destinies, and so it is the true path.

original: de la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'o //
translated: They abide in that.

original: dge mtshan dang zhes bya ba ni rtsis byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge mtshan dang zhes bya ba ni rtsis byed pa ste /
translated: “Auspicious signs” means calculations.

original: des ma 'ongs pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ma 'ongs pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, they know the future.

original: bkra shis zhes bya ba ni lam du 'jug pa la sogs pa mtshan ma bzang po lta ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bkra shis zhes bya ba ni lam du 'jug pa la sogs pa mtshan ma bzang po lta ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Good fortune” means that they see good omens, such as when someone sets out on a journey.

original: ngang tshul ngan pa'i lta ba sna tshogs dang bral ba yin te zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa'i bstan bcos las bstan pa'i lta ba sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: ngang tshul ngan pa'i lta ba sna tshogs dang bral ba yin te zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa'i bstan bcos las bstan pa'i lta ba sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: “They are free from the various bad views” means that they are free from the various views taught in the treatises of the tīrthikas.

original: de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'o //
translated: “They are free from those.”

original: lta ba drang zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni g-yo med pa la sgyu med pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lta ba drang zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni g-yo med pa la sgyu med pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The explanation of the phrase “upright view” is “free of deceit and guile.”

original: de la g-yo ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen cing 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi cha dang ldan par rang gi yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du mi ston par yang dag par gdams ngag ster ba la gegs byed pa gang yin pa'o
analyzed: de la g-yo ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen cing 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi cha dang ldan par rang gi yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du mi ston par yang dag par gdams ngag ster ba la gegs byed pa gang yin pa'o
translated: Deceit is the obstruction to giving proper instruction, which is possessed by the portion of attachment, hostility, and ignorance that is attached to gain and honor and does not reveal one’s good qualities as they are.

original: // de dang bral ba ni g-yo med pa'o //
analyzed: // de dang bral ba ni g-yo med pa'o //
translated: Freedom from that is uprightness.

original: sgyu ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen cing 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi cha dang ldan pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan ston par byed pa log par 'tsho ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: sgyu ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen cing 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi cha dang ldan pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan ston par byed pa log par 'tsho ba'i rten byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Guile is the display of false good qualities, which is possessed by the portion of attachment, hostility, and ignorance that is attached to gain and honor and serves as the basis of wrong livelihood.

original: bsam pa nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum yod pa la sogs par nges par lta ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum yod pa la sogs par nges par lta ba'o //
translated: “One’s mind is firm” means that one has the view that the Three Jewels exist, etc.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “In that way” means in the manner that has been presented.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i zhes bya ba ni sa dang po'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i zhes bya ba ni sa dang po'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: The first generation of the Thought is at the time of the first stage.

original: de la bklags te shin tu dag par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la bklags te shin tu dag par 'gyur //
translated: There, having read, he becomes very pure.

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan du rgyun mi chad par ma nyams pa la sogs pa'i tshul khrims mi dmigs pas kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan du rgyun mi chad par ma nyams pa la sogs pa'i tshul khrims mi dmigs pas kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he practices the morality of never failing in the way of the uninterrupted continuity of the vow, by not apprehending it.

original: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: He, the Bodhisattva,

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni las kyi lam rnams so //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni las kyi lam rnams so //
translated: their, the paths of action,

original: ston ka'i zla ba ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ston ka'i zla ba zhi ba dang 'od chags pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: ston ka'i zla ba ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ston ka'i zla ba zhi ba dang 'od chags pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang ngo //
translated: like the autumn moon,

original: de la zla ba'i zhes bya ba ni gdung @91b ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la zla ba'i zhes bya ba ni gdung @91b ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: There, the moon is free from the sun.

original: de ltar tshul khrims yongs su dag tu zin kyang gal te tshul khrims kyi don la mngon par zhen pa yod par gyur na tshul khrims yongs su dag pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims yongs su dag tu zin kyang gal te tshul khrims kyi don la mngon par zhen pa yod par gyur na tshul khrims yongs su dag pa ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, even though morality is completely pure, if there is any attachment to the meaning of morality, it is not completely pure.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims blangs pa gang yin pa de rjes su bsrung ba la brten nas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims blangs pa gang yin pa de rjes su bsrung ba la brten nas so //
translated: “Thus, he is endowed with morality” means that he is endowed with the morality that he has accepted, based on his protection of it.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams shing gnas zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas brjod pa ste /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams shing gnas zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas brjod pa ste /
translated: “He is restrained by the restraint of the pratimoksa” means that he is restrained by the morality of renunciation.

original: des 'khor ba la nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des 'khor ba la nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he renounces cyclic existence by means of that morality.

original: cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni gshe ba med pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni gshe ba med pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: “He is perfect in his conduct and way of life” means that he is perfect in the morality of non-violence.

original: de la cho ga phun sum tshogs pa ni dam pa rnams kyi spyod lam la sogs pa rnams la mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la cho ga phun sum tshogs pa ni dam pa rnams kyi spyod lam la sogs pa rnams la mi gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of ritual is because it does not harm the conduct, etc. of the holy ones.

original: phun sum tshogs pa ni spyod yul ma yin pa lnga las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa ni spyod yul ma yin pa lnga las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of sphere is because it transcends the five impure spheres.

original: de la spyod yul ma yin pa lnga ni srog chags gsod pa'i sa phyogs dang / smad 'tshong ma'i khang khyim dang / chang 'tshong ma'i khang pa dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / rigs ngan gyi khang pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyod yul ma yin pa lnga ni srog chags gsod pa'i sa phyogs dang / smad 'tshong ma'i khang khyim dang / chang 'tshong ma'i khang pa dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / rigs ngan gyi khang pa'o //
translated: The five impure spheres are: the place where living beings are killed, the house of a prostitute, the house of a liquor seller, the palace of a king, and the house of an outcast.

original: de rnams su mi 'gro ba'o //🔽kha na ma tho ba phra ba rnams la yang 'jigs par lta zhes bya ba ni shin tu gus pa'i sgo nas tshul khrims la slob pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de rnams su mi 'gro ba'o // kha na ma tho ba phra ba rnams la yang 'jigs par lta zhes bya ba ni shin tu gus pa'i sgo nas tshul khrims la slob pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: One does not go to those places.🔽One views with fear even a slight transgression is because one trains in morality with great respect,

original: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba bzhin du bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba yang shin tu gus pas slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba bzhin du bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba yang shin tu gus pas slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one trains with great respect in the proscribed evil just as in the case of the naturally evil.

original: yang dag par blangs te bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob cing zhes bya ba ni kun nas yongs su rdzogs par bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs te bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob cing zhes bya ba ni kun nas yongs su rdzogs par bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And having taken up the precepts, he trains in the bases of training means that he trains in the bases of training that are completely perfected.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: lus dang ngag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang go bar smos so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang go bar smos so //
translated: he also says that it is understood by body, speech, and so on.

original: 'tsho ba yongs su dag kyang zhes bya ba ni tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tsho ba yongs su dag kyang zhes bya ba ni tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And his livelihood is pure means that he is free from hypocrisy and so on.

original: bdag tu smra ba yin te zhes bya ba ni bdag yod do zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba yin te zhes bya ba ni bdag yod do zhes smra ba'o //
translated: He is a proponent of self means that he advocates the self exists.

original: tshul khrims 'tshal pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa ltar bcos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'tshal pa zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa ltar bcos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of one who pretends to have morality is that he pretends to have morality.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par blangs kyang zhes bya ba de la sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis ni bsod snyoms pa dang / stan gcig pa dang / kha zas phyis mi len pa dang / chos gos gsum pa dang / phying ba can dang /
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par blangs kyang zhes bya ba de la sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis ni bsod snyoms pa dang / stan gcig pa dang / kha zas phyis mi len pa dang / chos gos gsum pa dang / phying ba can dang /
translated: the alms-food ascetic practice, the one-sitting ascetic practice, the after-meal ascetic practice, the three-piece-garment ascetic practice, the refuse-rag ascetic practice,

original: @92a * // phyag dar khrod pa dang / dgon pa pa dang / shing drung pa dang / bla ga ba med pa dang / dur khrod pa dang / cog pu ba dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: @92a * // phyag dar khrod pa dang / dgon pa pa dang / shing drung pa dang / bla ga ba med pa dang / dur khrod pa dang / cog pu ba dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: the charnel-ground ascetic practice, the any-bed ascetic practice, the tree-root ascetic practice, the open-space ascetic practice, the sitting-only ascetic practice, the any-time-alms-food ascetic practice, and the as-found-alms-food ascetic practice.

original: de la bsod snyoms pa ni 'dris pa dang ma 'dras pa'i rigs rnams las bsod snyoms rnyed pa za ba'o //
analyzed: de la bsod snyoms pa ni 'dris pa dang ma 'dras pa'i rigs rnams las bsod snyoms rnyed pa za ba'o //
translated: The alms-food ascetic practice is to eat alms-food obtained from the homes of those who are acquainted with you and those who are not.

original: stan gcig pa ni stan gcig la 'dug nas ci tsam za bar byed pa de za ba ste /
analyzed: stan gcig pa ni stan gcig la 'dug nas ci tsam za bar byed pa de za ba ste /
translated: The one-sitting ascetic practice is to eat as much as you can in one sitting.

original: stan de las kyang langs nas mi za ba'o //
analyzed: stan de las kyang langs nas mi za ba'o //
translated: You do not eat after rising from that seat.

original: phyis mi len pa ni stan la 'dug ste ci tsam za bar nus pa de tsam byin len byas nas za'i byin len ma byas par mi za ba'o //
analyzed: phyis mi len pa ni stan la 'dug ste ci tsam za bar nus pa de tsam byin len byas nas za'i byin len ma byas par mi za ba'o //
translated: Not accepting later is not eating what is not the formal acceptance of alms, having accepted as much as one can eat while sitting on one seat.

original: chos gos gsum pa ni snam sbyar dang / stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs te ;
analyzed: chos gos gsum pa ni snam sbyar dang / stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs te ;
translated: The three-piece-robed is the patched robe, the upper robe, and the lower robe.

original: chos gos gsum po rnams skyong ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos gsum po rnams skyong ba'o //
translated: The three-piece-robed is one who keeps the three robes.

original: chos gos gsum las lhag pa'i gos mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos gsum las lhag pa'i gos mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The three-piece-robed does not keep robes other than the three robes.

original: zhes pa'o // phying pa can ni gang chos gos gsum mam de las lhag pa'i gos thams cad ni bal gyi 'chang gi de las gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // phying pa can ni gang chos gos gsum mam de las lhag pa'i gos thams cad ni bal gyi 'chang gi de las gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The felt-wearer is one who wears only the three robes or more robes made of wool, not any other.

original: phyag dar khrod pa ni gzhan dag gis lam la sogs par dor ba bshad gci dang / rnag khrag dang / mchil ma rnams kyis gos pa de'i mi gtsang ba de bsal nas snying po blangs te bkrus nas kha dog bsgyur te chos gos byas nas 'chang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa ni gzhan dag gis lam la sogs par dor ba bshad gci dang / rnag khrag dang / mchil ma rnams kyis gos pa de'i mi gtsang ba de bsal nas snying po blangs te bkrus nas kha dog bsgyur te chos gos byas nas 'chang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The charnel-ground-wearer is one who, having removed the filth from a cloth discarded on a road, etc., by feces, urine, pus, blood, and spittle, takes the essence, washes it, dyes it, makes it into a Dharma robe, and wears it.

original: dgon pa ba ni grong dang grong khyer las thag ring ba'i dgon pa dang / nags kyi nang du gnas shing nyal ba la sogs pa byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgon pa ba ni grong dang grong khyer las thag ring ba'i dgon pa dang / nags kyi nang du gnas shing nyal ba la sogs pa byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The forest-dweller is one who lives and sleeps in a forest far from towns and cities.

original: shing dung ba ni shing gi rtsa bar gnas shing 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: shing dung ba ni shing gi rtsa bar gnas shing 'dug pa'o //
translated: The tree-dweller is one who lives and sleeps at the foot of a tree.

original: bla gab med pa ni steng g-yogs med pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: bla gab med pa ni steng g-yogs med pa'i gnas so //
translated: The open-air-dweller is one who lives in a place without a roof.

original: dur khrod pa ni gang du mi ro'i tshogs skyel ba der gnas 'cha' ba'o //
analyzed: dur khrod pa ni gang du mi ro'i tshogs skyel ba der gnas 'cha' ba'o //
translated: The charnel-ground-dweller is one who lives in a charnel ground where the corpses of humans are taken.

original: cog pu ni khri'u 'am rtsva shing gi stan la 'dug nas dus 'da' bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: cog pu ni khri'u 'am rtsva shing gi stan la 'dug nas dus 'da' bar byed pa ste /
translated: The sitter is one who spends time sitting on a bench or on a seat made of grass or wood.

original: rtsva shing gi phung po'am rtsig pa'am ka ba la sogs pa la mi snyes pa'o //
analyzed: rtsva shing gi phung po'am rtsig pa'am ka ba la sogs pa la mi snyes pa'o //
translated: He does not lean on a pile of grass or wood, a wall, a pillar, and so on.

original: gzhi ji bzhin pa ni rtsva'i stan bting ba'am shing lo'i stan la nyal ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhi ji bzhin pa ni rtsva'i stan bting ba'am shing lo'i stan la nyal ba yin la /
translated: The as-it-is-placed-dweller is one who sleeps on a seat made of grass or leaves.

original: de yang dang po ji ltar bting ba de kho na la nyal gyi phyis mi 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po ji ltar bting ba de kho na la nyal gyi phyis mi 'chos pa'o //
translated: Moreover, he sleeps only on the very seat that was prepared first and does not change it later.

original: ci'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Why are they called “the ascetic practices”?

original: dper na bal lam ras bal gang gi tshe ma bsed pa de'i tshe 'byar ba dang ma 'byar ba ma yin pas bkal bar mi rung la /
analyzed: dper na bal lam ras bal gang gi tshe ma bsed pa de'i tshe 'byar ba dang ma 'byar ba ma yin pas bkal bar mi rung la /
translated: For example, when wool or cotton is not spun, it is neither compact nor loose, and so is not suitable for weaving.🔽But when it is spun, it becomes suitable.

original: bsed na rung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du bsod snyoms dang / chos gos dang / mal stan la chags pas sems las su mi rung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsed na rung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du bsod snyoms dang / chos gos dang / mal stan la chags pas sems las su mi rung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Similarly, the mind becomes unfit due to attachment to alms, Dharma robes, and bedding.

original: de sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyis @92b las su rung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyis @92b las su rung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan zhes bya'o //
translated: But it becomes fit through the virtues of austerity, and so they are called the virtues of austerity.

original: dmigs par lta ba yin te zhes pa'i bshad pa ni nar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa de ni zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs par lta ba yin te zhes pa'i bshad pa ni nar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa de ni zhes pa'o //
translated: The explanation of “view of the objective” is “that which is based on the view of ‘I’ and ‘mine.’”

original: de la ngar 'dzin pa ni kho bo ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la ngar 'dzin pa ni kho bo ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: There, the view of “I” is “I am moral.”

original: nga yir 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims 'di kho bo'i 'o ;
analyzed: nga yir 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims 'di kho bo'i 'o ;
translated: The view of “mine” is “this morality is mine.”

original: / de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshul khrims kyi ngo bo la mngon par zhen pa yod na tshul khrims 'chal pa yin la /
analyzed: / de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshul khrims kyi ngo bo la mngon par zhen pa yod na tshul khrims 'chal pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, because of the existence of attachment to the nature of morality, one is immoral.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Because he is not endowed with morality.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the phrase “entity and non-entity, etc.,” etc.,

original: sogs pa'i sgras bden pa dang / brdzun pa dang ; rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras bden pa dang / brdzun pa dang ; rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: the term “etc.” includes such things as truth and falsity, permanence and impermanence, and so on.

original: de las gzhan pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan pa'i so so'i skye bo la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan pa'i so so'i skye bo la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: With regard to the phrase “the others,” etc., the others are ordinary beings other than bodhisattvas.

original: shin tu che ba nyid dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu che ba nyid dang zhes bya ba ni mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “extremely great” means that it is the cause of high status.

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rten nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde 'gror skyes na dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan du mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rten nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde 'gror skyes na dad pa la sogs pa'i yon tan du mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “in order to demonstrate that it is the basis of all excellent qualities” means that when one is born in a happy realm, many excellent qualities such as faith are born.

original: tshul khrims rkang pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims nyid rkang pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims rkang pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims nyid rkang pa ste /
translated: The phrase “the foot of morality” means that morality itself is the foot.

original: bde 'gror 'gro ba'i thabs yin pas so //
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba'i thabs yin pas so //
translated: It is the means of going to a happy realm.

original: nyams pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa chen po dang / 'bring dang chung ngu kun tu spyod pas so //
analyzed: nyams pa zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa chen po dang / 'bring dang chung ngu kun tu spyod pas so //
translated: “Loss” refers to the practice of killing, etc., in its great, middling, and small forms.

original: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa de nyid las so //
analyzed: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa de nyid las so //
translated: “From that very thing” means from that very generosity.

original: skyed bcas dngos 'du zad pas na'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i sa bon sngar btab pa'i 'bras bus longs spyod spyad pas dngos po nyams pas so //
analyzed: skyed bcas dngos 'du zad pas na'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i sa bon sngar btab pa'i 'bras bus longs spyod spyad pas dngos po nyams pas so //
translated: “Because of the exhaustion of the seed, the thing, and the accumulation” means that the thing is exhausted because of the enjoyment of wealth that is the result of the previously planted seed of generosity.

original: byas pa chud gson pa'i tshul can zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi sa bon skyed dang bcas pa la longs spyod cing sa bon mi 'debs pas so //
analyzed: byas pa chud gson pa'i tshul can zhes bya ba ni sngar gyi sa bon skyed dang bcas pa la longs spyod cing sa bon mi 'debs pas so //
translated: “The one who is a squanderer of what has been done” means that one enjoys the previously planted seed, but does not plant a new seed.

original: sngar gyi sa bon tsam yang zhes pa la /
analyzed: sngar gyi sa bon tsam yang zhes pa la /
translated: “The one who has only the seed” means🔽that the seed is not exhausted.

original: yang gi sgras ni skyed 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni skyed 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
translated: The word “also” means that not only is the seed not exhausted,

original: sa bon kyang ngo /
analyzed: sa bon kyang ngo /
translated: but also the thing.

original: dngos po 'du ba yang zhes bya ba ni rnon po'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'du ba yang zhes bya ba ni rnon po'o //
translated: “The accumulation of the thing” means the sharp.

original: gnas ma yin par zhes bya ba ni nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar ro //
analyzed: gnas ma yin par zhes bya ba ni nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar ro //
translated: “In an improper place” means in the destinies of the occasional hells, etc.

original: snga na med pa'i 'phen pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can sbyin pa ma btang ba'i phyir ro //🔽sngar 'phangs pa ma lus par nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar sbyin pa btang bas 'bras bu gan @93a * //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i 'phen pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can sbyin pa ma btang ba'i phyir ro // sngar 'phangs pa ma lus par nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sngar sbyin pa btang bas 'bras bu gan @93a * //
translated: Because it is free from the impetus of former karma, because one does not give gifts that have the result of enjoyment.

original: 'phangs pa de ma lus par longs spyod pa zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phangs pa de ma lus par longs spyod pa zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the former impetus is completely enjoyed, because one enjoys without remainder the result of former giving.

original: rang dbang 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi dag rang dbang du thos pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dbang 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi dag rang dbang du thos pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has mastery, because gods and men have mastery in listening, etc.

original: mthun gnas pas zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa la sogs pa'i skal ba can dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mthun gnas pas zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa la sogs pa'i skal ba can dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Because of the presence of favorable conditions, because one has the good fortune of living in a suitable place, of meeting with spiritual benefactors, etc.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: This refers to the ordinary man.

original: bdag 'dzin par mi byed na zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang / dad pa dang / thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams la bdag nyid gnas par mi byed na'o //
analyzed: bdag 'dzin par mi byed na zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang / dad pa dang / thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams la bdag nyid gnas par mi byed na'o //
translated: If one does not make oneself into an object of self-clinging, one does not make oneself into an object of the virtues of morality, faith, learning, etc.

original: g-yang sar ltung bas zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs par ltung ba'o //
analyzed: g-yang sar ltung bas zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs par ltung ba'o //
translated: One falls into an abyss means one falls into the hells, etc.

original: gzhan dbang 'jug 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i las kyi dbang du 'jug par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan dbang 'jug 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i las kyi dbang du 'jug par 'gyur bas so //
translated: One comes under the sway of others means one comes under the sway of nonvirtuous karma.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni ngan song las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni ngan song las so //
translated: From that means from the lower realms.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni thabs so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni thabs so //
translated: By that means by the means.

original: slong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi dag rnyed par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: slong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi dag rnyed par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: One is born means one is born among gods and humans.

original: dpa' bo mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba ltar zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba ltar zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: Like a hero freed from bondage, living in a friendly land is the example.

original: sa bde yangs na gnas pas 'ching ba las grol ba ltar ro //
analyzed: sa bde yangs na gnas pas 'ching ba las grol ba ltar ro //
translated: Like one freed from bondage, living in a pleasant, spacious land is the example.

original: des na zhes bya ba 'don par 'gyur ba med pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba 'don par 'gyur ba med pas so //
translated: Therefore means because there is no recitation.

original: gnod par bya ba'i phyir ngan 'gro kho nar nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mi sogs pa dang / sdig pa'i las sogs par byed pas so //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba'i phyir ngan 'gro kho nar nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mi sogs pa dang / sdig pa'i las sogs par byed pas so //
translated: This is because he does not accumulate the roots of virtue and he accumulates sinful karma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gnod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gnod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means for the purpose of harming.

original: rnam par smin pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun gyi 'bras bu gnyis te 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun gyi 'bras bu gnyis te 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Two fruitions means two fruitions of natural outflow, which will be explained later.

original: gtam zad nas zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gtam zad nas zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: When the conversation has ended means when the teaching has been completed.

original: tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Morality means one who possesses morality.

original: rjes 'gro'i zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i gtam gyi de ma thag tu'o //🔽rgyal ba'i bshad pa ni sdig pa'i chos mtha' dag pham par mdzad pa'i zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rjes 'gro'i zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i gtam gyi de ma thag tu'o // rgyal ba'i bshad pa ni sdig pa'i chos mtha' dag pham par mdzad pa'i zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Subsequent means immediately after the conversation about generosity.🔽The explanation of the Victor is that he has conquered all sinful qualities.

original: sdig pa'i chos can nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos can nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro//
translated: This is because he has abandoned all afflictions that are sinful qualities.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa nyid yon tan yin la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i yon tan chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa nyid yon tan yin la /
translated: Generosity and so forth are virtues because they do not waste the virtues of generosity and so forth.

original: de chud mi za ba ni tshul khrims kyi stobs kyis bde 'gror skyes na sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa'i dus su yang sbyin pa gtong bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de chud mi za ba ni tshul khrims kyi stobs kyis bde 'gror skyes na sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa'i dus su yang sbyin pa gtong bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Their non-wastage is due to the power of morality, because when one is born in a happy realm, one practices generosity at the time of enjoying the results of generosity.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyud pa zhes bya ba la sogs @93b pas ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa'i tshe yang sbyin pa gtong bas 'bras bu'i tshogs nye bar 'phel zhing dus ring por longs spyod pa po nye bar longs spyod par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyud pa zhes bya ba la sogs @93b pas ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod pa'i tshe yang sbyin pa gtong bas 'bras bu'i tshogs nye bar 'phel zhing dus ring por longs spyod pa po nye bar longs spyod par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: By the verse beginning “The continuum of cause and effect” and so forth, it is said that when one enjoys the results of generosity, one practices generosity, and so the collection of results increases and one becomes an enjoyer who enjoys for a long time.

original: gsungs skyes dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams te /
analyzed: gsungs skyes dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams te /
translated: “Those born from speech” are the śrāvakas.

original: gzhan gyis chos gsungs pa la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis chos gsungs pa la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are born in dependence on the speech of another teaching the Dharma.

original: 'di dag brten pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni kun nas slong ba'i sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di dag brten pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni kun nas slong ba'i sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “These are the causes of support” means the mind that is the motivating impetus.

original: shas che ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun nas slong bde chen po yin na dmyal ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /
analyzed: shas che ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la kun nas slong bde chen po yin na dmyal ba'i rgyur 'gyur la /
translated: The phrase “for the most part” is used because if the motivation is great, it becomes the cause for rebirth in the hells.

original: 'bring gis ni dud 'gro'i rgyur 'gyur zhing chung ngus ni yi dgas kyi 'jig rten gyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring gis ni dud 'gro'i rgyur 'gyur zhing chung ngus ni yi dgas kyi 'jig rten gyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: The great, medium, and small are the causes of hell, animal realm, and ghost realm, respectively.

original: rnam par smin pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun gyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun gyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The two fruitions are the fruitions of natural outflow.

original: thun mong gi longs spyod du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba na gzhan dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir dbang med pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong gi longs spyod du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba na gzhan dang thun mong yin pa'i phyir dbang med pa'o //
translated: The common enjoyment is the enjoyment of others, because it is not under one’s control.

original: 'khor g-yog yid brtan du mi rung ba zhes bya ba ni de'i 'khor g-yog rnams kyang yid brtan du mi rung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor g-yog yid brtan du mi rung ba zhes bya ba ni de'i 'khor g-yog rnams kyang yid brtan du mi rung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The retinue is untrustworthy, because even the retinue is untrustworthy.

original: dgra zla dang bcas pa'i chung mar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de'i chung ma yang gzhan gyi thad du nyal po byed pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dgra zla dang bcas pa'i chung mar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de'i chung ma yang gzhan gyi thad du nyal po byed pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The wife is adulterous, because even the wife is adulterous.

original: skur ba mang ba dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi skyon mang du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: skur ba mang ba dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi skyon mang du brjod pa'o //
translated: Having many detractors means that many others will speak of his faults.

original: g-yog 'khor mi 'dum pa dang zhes bya ba ni phan tshun bye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: g-yog 'khor mi 'dum pa dang zhes bya ba ni phan tshun bye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Having a disunited retinue means that they will be divided from each other.

original: g-yog 'khor ngan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gtum po la sogs pa de'i 'khor du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: g-yog 'khor ngan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gtum po la sogs pa de'i 'khor du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Having a bad retinue means that his retinue will be made up of violent people and so on.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba thos pa dang zhes bya ba ni stag dang / seng ge dang / mi ma yin pa'i sgra thos par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba thos pa dang zhes bya ba ni stag dang / seng ge dang / mi ma yin pa'i sgra thos par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Hearing unpleasant sounds means hearing the sounds of tigers, lions, and non-humans.

original: 'thab mo'i tshig tu 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du gzhan dang 'thab mo'i tshig 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'thab mo'i tshig tu 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du gzhan dang 'thab mo'i tshig 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Becoming words of strife means that at all times words of strife with others will arise.

original: ma nges pa'i spobs par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni de'i tshig mi btsan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i spobs par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni de'i tshig mi btsan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Becoming uncertain eloquence means that his words will not be authoritative.

original: chog mi shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni gya nom pa ma yin pa dang / chung ngu rnyed pa la sems yongs su gdung ba'o //
analyzed: chog mi shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni gya nom pa ma yin pa dang / chung ngu rnyed pa la sems yongs su gdung ba'o //
translated: Being insatiable means that the mind is tormented by obtaining what is not excellent and what is small.

original: 'dod pa che ba ni ma rnyed pa'i dngos po gya nom pa dang / mang du 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa che ba ni ma rnyed pa'i dngos po gya nom pa dang / mang du 'dod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Great desire is the desire for excellent and abundant things that have not been obtained.

original: phan pa mi tshol ba dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i blo mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: phan pa mi tshol ba dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i blo mi skye ba'o //
translated: Not seeking benefit is the non-arising of the intention to help others.

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de la gzhan rnams kyis brdegs pa la sogs pas 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa bya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de la gzhan rnams kyis brdegs pa la sogs pas 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
translated: Others will do harm means that others will harm him with beatings, etc.

original: @94a * // srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @94a * // srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du zhes bya ba la /
translated: Up to the peak of existence.

original: bar gyi sgra ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha drug dang bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa gsum gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bar gyi sgra ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha drug dang bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa gsum gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The word up to should be understood to include the six desire realm gods, the four concentrations, and the three formless [absorptions].

original: skye ba yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: There will be birth - by this he shows it to be the cause of high status.

original: nges par legs pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nges par legs pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show it to be the cause of definite goodness,

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says after that, etc.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pa'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pa'i 'og tu'o //
translated: After that means after taking up the path of the ten virtues.

original: nyi tshe ba'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa ma rdzogs pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i sems dang zhes bya ba ni chos kyi bdag med pa yongs su shes pa ma rdzogs pa'i phyir te ;
translated: With a limited mind means that the full knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena is incomplete.

original: de yang sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de yang sngar bstan zin to //
translated: And that has already been explained above.

original: khams gsum la skrag pa'i yid dang zhes bya ba ni 'dis snying rje chen po med pa'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum la skrag pa'i yid dang zhes bya ba ni 'dis snying rje chen po med pa'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //
translated: With a mind frightened by the three realms shows the cause of the absence of great compassion.

original: gzhan la thos pa'i rjes su 'gro zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la thos pa'i rjes su 'gro zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of follows the hearing of others is called following sound.

original: shes rab kyi rnam pas zhes bya ba ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rang bzhin can stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa can gyis so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rnam pas zhes bya ba ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rang bzhin can stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa can gyis so //
translated: By the aspect of wisdom means by the aspect of emptiness, which has the nature of thorough analysis.

original: des yongs su bsgoms pa ni nye bar mtshon pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: des yongs su bsgoms pa ni nye bar mtshon pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is fully cultivated by that is the illustration.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dod pas na theg pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dod pas na theg pa ste /
translated: The Sravaka Vehicle is the vehicle because it is desired here.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is nirvana.

original: gzhan las thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ste zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis rang sangs rgyas las khyad par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ste zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis rang sangs rgyas las khyad par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The words “in accordance with what is heard from others” indicate the difference from the pratyekabuddha.

original: snying rje chen po med pa dang zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa las so //
analyzed: snying rje chen po med pa dang zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa las so //
translated: The words “without great compassion” indicate the difference from the bodhisattva vehicle.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su sbyangs nas zhes bya ba ni de las lhag par sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su sbyangs nas zhes bya ba ni de las lhag par sbyangs pa ste /
translated: “After that” and so on. “Having trained” means having trained beyond that.

original: gang gis gzung ba'i rtog pa spong ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis gzung ba'i rtog pa spong ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the cause for the elimination of the conception of apprehended objects.

original: de lta bu'i dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu yongs su sbyangs na rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'grub par byed do zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu yongs su sbyangs na rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'grub par byed do zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Having trained in the ten virtuous karmic paths in that way, one accomplishes the pratyekabuddha vehicle.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo khong du chud pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khong du chud nas so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo khong du chud pas zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin can rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba khong du chud nas so //
translated: “By comprehending the profound dependent origination” means that having comprehended dependent origination, which has the nature of emptiness,

original: de la yang gzung bar rtog pa spang ba'i thabs tsam yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la yang gzung bar rtog pa spang ba'i thabs tsam yod pa yin gyi /
translated: There is only a method for abandoning the conception of an object.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo nyid yongs su rdzogs par rtogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo nyid yongs su rdzogs par rtogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But there is no complete realization of profound dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo rtogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yod pa'i @94b phyir ro ;
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo rtogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yod pa'i @94b phyir ro ;
translated: Because there is a realization of profound dependent origination for bodhisattvas.

original: / snying rje chen po dang thabs la mkhas pa med pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: / snying rje chen po dang thabs la mkhas pa med pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “without great compassion and skill in means.”

original: snying rje chen po nyid gzhan gyi don byed pa la thabs mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po nyid gzhan gyi don byed pa la thabs mkhas pa ste /
translated: Great compassion itself is skill in means for accomplishing the welfare of others.

original: de dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: de dang bral ba yin la /
translated: They are devoid of that.

original: rang gi don gtso bor byed pa dang / rdzu 'phrul tsam gyi sgo nas gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi don gtso bor byed pa dang / rdzu 'phrul tsam gyi sgo nas gzhan gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they make their own welfare primary, and they accomplish the welfare of others by means of mere miracles.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo khong du chud pa dang / de dgag pa'i phyir gzhan la mi 'tshol ba dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo khong du chud pa dang / de dgag pa'i phyir gzhan la mi 'tshol ba dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “without understanding the profound dependent origination and without seeking it from others in order to block it.”

original: gzhan la mi 'tshol ba ni gzhan dag la lam mi 'tshol ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la mi 'tshol ba ni gzhan dag la lam mi 'tshol ba'o //
translated: Not seeking from others means not seeking the path from others.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “because of one’s own complete enlightenment.”

original: bdag nyid kyis lam mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis lam mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one realizes the path oneself.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “because of being in accord with self-arising.”

original: skye ba gzhan du lam goms pa'i stobs kyis ye shes rang 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan du lam goms pa'i stobs kyis ye shes rang 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is in accord with the self-arising of wisdom through the power of cultivating the path in other lives.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, “because of not being dependent on others.”

original: de nyid shes pa la gal te 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid shes pa la gal te 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to know that, it is said, “if here…” and so on.

original: shin tu rgya che zhing tshad med pa'i snying brtse ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu rgya che zhing tshad med pa'i snying brtse ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said, “because of great compassion, which is vast and immeasurable.”

original: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir rgya che ba dang / rang nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir rgya che ba dang / rang nyid stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad med pa'o //
translated: It is vast because it focuses on emptiness, and it is immeasurable because it is itself emptiness.

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos la dmigs pa dang ; dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos la dmigs pa dang ; dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is endowed with great compassion, because it is endowed with compassion that focuses on phenomena and that is non-apprehending.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thabs la mkhas pas bsdu ba dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thabs la mkhas pas bsdu ba dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: For that very reason, it is the collection of skill in means.
